abilities_interactive.name: Locate Inevitable
entries: An arbiter can always sense the direction of the nearest non-arbiter inevitable on the plane, but it cannot sense the range of the inevitable.
Items shortsword.

abilities_active.name: Electrical Burst
entries: The arbiter releases an electrical burst from its body that deals {@dice 3d6} electricity damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save). Following such a burst, the arbiter becomes {@condition stunned} for 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Crystalline Dust Form
entries: The axiomite shifts between its {@spell humanoid form|CRB} and that of a cloud of crystalline dust in which strange symbols and equations flash. In this form it gains a fly Speed of 40 feet and can fit through even tiny apertures, similarly to {@spell gaseous form|CRB}. It can cast spells, but it can’t make melee or ranged attacks in this state. It can return to its {@spell humanoid form|CRB} by using this action while in crystalline dust form.

abilities_interactive.name: Truespeech
entries: A kolyarut can speak with and understand any creature that has a language.
Items +1 striking bastard sword.

abilities_interactive.name: Envisioning
entries: Pleromas care little for communication with other creatures, but when they do convey information, they do so wordlessly through a series of psychic projections. This acts as {@spell telepathy|CRB} with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language, though the aeon’s meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. An aeon can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane as itself.

abilities_automatic.name: Reality Twist
abilities_automatic.trigger: The pleroma critically fails the saving throw.
entries: The critical failure becomes a normal failure.

abilities_active.name: Energy Touch
entries: A pleroma’s touch deals its choice of positive or negative damage, but neither energy can be used to {@spell heal|CRB} a creature.

abilities_active.name: Sphere of Creation
entries: Three times per day, a pleroma can manifest a 2-foot-diameter sphere of white energy that hovers above its left hand. By using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, the pleroma can cause the sphere to fly 10 feet. The sphere can move in any direction, ignoring difficult terrain, but it can’t move farther than 300 feet away from the pleroma. Wherever the sphere travels, it leaves behind a 5-foot-wide path of new matter, creating either new terrain (the pleroma’s choice of normal, difficult, or greater difficult terrain) or a 5-foot-square solid barrier of a single natural substance (such as clay, wood, or stone). The sphere can enter the space of a creature; when it does, the creature must succeed at a DC 43 Fortitude save or be absorbed into the sphere. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to a space of the GM’s choice away from the sphere. Those who fail take {@dice 20d6} positive damage (even if they are living) and are pushed away as a success. Those who critically fail, or are reduced to 0 HP by the damage from a failure, become one with the new material and can be restored only via a 10th-level spell. A pleroma can have only one Sphere of {@spell Creation|CRB} in existence at a time, and the sphere automatically vanishes in a flash of blinding light after {@dice 1d4} minutes. All creatures within 30 feet of the sphere of {@spell creation|CRB} when it vanishes must succeed at a DC 43 Fortitude save or be permanently {@condition blinded}.

abilities_active.name: Sphere of Oblivion
entries: Three times per day, a pleroma can manifest a 2-foot-diameter sphere of complete and utter {@spell darkness|CRB} that hovers above its right hand. It can move and control the sphere in the same manner as its Sphere of {@spell Creation|CRB}. The sphere is an empty void that lasts for 1 minute before collapsing in on itself and winking out of existence. Once manifested, the sphere can be used as a ranged attack, but it blinks out of existence immediately after that attack is resolved. Any unattended object that touches the void is sucked in and completely destroyed. Larger objects (such as ships or buildings) are destroyed at a rate of one 10-foot cube per round of contact. The sphere can enter the space of a creature, with effects similar to the Sphere of {@spell Creation|CRB} except that it deals negative damage (even to undead) on a failure and annihilates rather than incorporating the creature into material. Such a destroyed creature can be restored only by a 10th-level spell.

attacks.name: energy touch (agile, lawful, magical)
attacks.damage: {@dice 5d8+18} positive or negative damage plus {@dice 1d6} lawful

abilities_active.name: Assume Form
entries: The faceless stalker spends 10 minutes reshaping its appearance to take on the shape of any Small or Medium humanoid. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to pass as that creature.

abilities_active.name: Blood Nourishment
entries: The faceless stalker uses its three-pronged tongue to drink the blood of an adjacent {@condition restrained} or {@condition unconscious} creature. The creature gains {@condition drained} 1.

abilities_active.name: Compression
entries: When the faceless stalker successfully Squeezes, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a faceless stalker.

abilities_active.name: Revert Form
abilities_active.requirements: The faceless stalker is in an assumed form.
entries: The faceless stalker resumes its true form. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_interactive.name: Mucus Cloud
entries: 5 feet. While underwater, an aboleth exudes a cloud of transparent slime. An air-breathing creature adjacent to an aboleth must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save each round or lose the ability to breathe air but gain the ability to breathe water for 3 hours.

stages.entry: the victim’s skin softens, inflicting drained 1
the victim’s skin transforms into a clear, slimy membrane, inflicting drained 2 until the curse ends;

abilities_interactive.name: Mucus Cloud
entries: As aboleth, but DC 36, 30-foot radius, and 24 hours.
entries_as_xyz: 5 feet. While underwater, an aboleth exudes a cloud of transparent slime. An air-breathing creature adjacent to an aboleth must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save each round or lose the ability to breathe air but gain the ability to breathe water for 3 hours.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Consume Memories
entries: When a veiled master makes a fangs {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature, it can consume some of that creature’s memories. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude saving throw or become {@condition stupefied} 1. A veiled master regains 5 Hit Points each time it successfully consumes memories. When a veiled master consumes memories, it learns some of the creature’s memories (subject to the GM’s discretion).

abilities_active.name: Delayed Suggestion
entries: When a veiled master successfully casts {@spell dominate|CRB} on a creature, a {@spell suggestion|CRB} spell triggers when the {@spell dominate|CRB} spell ends. This {@spell suggestion|CRB} usually causes the target to return to the veiled master, so the creature can cast {@spell dominate|CRB} again, but a veiled master can set the {@spell suggestion|CRB} to different orders if it wishes.

abilities_active.name: Slime
entries: As alghollthu master, but DC 36.

stages.entry: the victim’s skin softens, inflicting drained 1
the victim’s skin transforms into a clear, slimy membrane, inflicting drained 2 until the curse ends;

abilities_active.name: Tentacle Flurry
entries: The veiled master thrashes about with its tentacles. Make a tentacle {@action Strike|CRB} against each creature within its reach. Roll only one attack roll, and roll the damage only once for all targets.

abilities_active.name: Thoughtlance
entries: A creature touched by the veiled master’s tentacles, whether those tentacles deal damage or not, must attempt a DC 34 Will save, becoming {@condition slowed} 1 on a failure or {@condition slowed} 2 on a critical failure. Each time the affected creature ends its turn, its {@condition slowed} value decreases by 1.

attacks.name: fangs
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d8+12} piercing plus slime and consume memories

abilities_automatic.name: Transfer Protection
entries: A non-evil creature can wear a willing cassisian as a helmet. While it does, the cassisian can take no actions, but the cassisian extends its +1 status bonus to AC and saves against evil creatures to its wearer. At any time, the cassisian can detach itself from its wearer as an action.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Eye Beams
entries: The cassisian releases beams of heat or cold from its eyes, dealing {@dice 2d6} cold or fire damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save) to all creatures in a 15-foot line. It can’t use Eye Beams again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Repository of Lore
entries: While the cassisian isn’t particularly intelligent, it has perfect memory and can remember everything it sees or hears. This allows it to attempt Lore checks on any topic, provided (at the GM’s discretion) the cassisian has encountered the topic in question before. The cassisian’s limited intellect often prevents it from acting upon its knowledge, making it a better resource than agent in matters of information use.

abilities_automatic.name: Harmonizing Aura
entries: 20 feet. Allies in the area gain a +2 status bonus to sonic damage rolls and a +1 status bonus to AC and all saves against sonic and auditory effects. Enemies in the area take a –2 status penalty to sonic damage rolls and a –1 status penalty to AC and all saves against sonic and auditory effects.

abilities_active.name: Deafening Aria
entries: On a critical hit with piercing hymn, the target is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Harmonize
entries: The choral angel adds its harmony to a choral angel ally within its harmonizing aura. The ally can cast {@spell calm emotions|CRB} or {@spell heroism|CRB} on its next turn in place of its 3rd-level {@spell sound burst|CRB} or heighten its 3rd-level {@spell sound burst|CRB} by 1 level. If five different choral angels use Harmonize on the same choral angel ally, it can instead cast {@spell divine decree|CRB} in place of its 3rd-level {@spell sound burst|CRB}.

attacks.name: piercing hymn
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d6} sonic damage plus {@dice 1d6} good and deafening aria

abilities_automatic.name: Confessor’s Aura
entries: 20 feet. Creatures in the balisse’s aura are subject to {@spell zone of truth|CRB} (DC 23). Additionally, if these creatures choose to honestly express their own conflicted feelings, the aura makes it easier for them to put words to those feelings.

abilities_active.name: Brand of the Impenitent
entries: The balisse marks an evil creature within its confessor’s aura as irredeemable. It can only do so after a failed attempt to convince the creature to repent. The touched creature takes a –1 status penalty to AC and saves, reduces its resistances by 2, and gains weakness 2 to good damage. The duration depends on the target’s DC 26 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.

abilities_active.name: Flaming Armament
entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a flaming property rune while a balisse wields it.

abilities_active.name: Guiding Angel
entries: While {@condition invisible}, a balisse can spiritually attach itself to a non-evil mortal. When it does so, it merges with the mortal’s body and is unable to use any of its spells and abilities other than to interact with the mortal. It must use Guiding Angel again to leave the mortal. While merged with the mortal, the balisse can take a form of its choice that only the mortal can see, such as a small angel on the mortal’s shoulder. Alternatively, it can communicate with the mortal using a bodiless voice only the mortal can hear.

abilities_automatic.name: Traveler’s Aura
entries: 20 feet. Creatures in the astral deva’s aura are protected from ambient environmental damage from any plane, including severe and extreme heat and cold as well as more exotic dangers. The astral deva is never {@condition flat-footed} to creatures within its aura.

abilities_automatic.name: Messenger’s Amnesty
entries: An astral deva with a {@spell message|CRB} to deliver is continually protected by the effect of {@spell sanctuary|CRB} (DC 32). If the deva breaks the {@spell sanctuary|CRB}, the effect returns if the deva ceases hostility for 10 minutes.

abilities_active.name: Divine Armament
entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a holy property rune while an astral deva wields it.

abilities_active.name: Stunning Strike
abilities_active.requirements: The astral deva hit a foe earlier this turn with a weapon Strike.
entries: The astral deva makes a weapon {@action Strike|CRB} against the foe. On a success, the foe must succeed at a DC 34 Fortitude save or become {@condition stunned} 1. On a critical failure, the foe is {@condition stunned} 2 instead.

abilities_automatic.name: Construct Armor
entries: Like normal objects, an animated broom has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated broom is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

abilities_active.name: Dust
entries: A creature hit by an animated broom’s bristles must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or spend its next action coughing. Even if hit by multiple dust attacks, the creature has to spend only 1 action coughing to clear the dust out. A creature that doesn’t breathe is immune to this effect.

abilities_automatic.name: Construct Armor
entries: As animated broom, but reduced to AC 13 when {@condition broken}.
entries_as_xyz: Like normal objects, an animated broom has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated broom is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

abilities_automatic.name: Construct Armor
entries: As animated broom, but reduced to AC 15 when {@condition broken}.
entries_as_xyz: Like normal objects, an animated broom has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated broom is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

abilities_automatic.name: Construct Armor
entries: As animated broom, but reduced to AC 22 when {@condition broken}.
entries_as_xyz: Like normal objects, an animated broom has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated broom is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

abilities_active.name: Brazier
entries: The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach. Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue. Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal {@dice 2d8} fire damage.

abilities_active.name: Burn Alive
entries: The statue grinds a creature it has {@condition grabbed} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes {@dice 3d8} fire damage and {@dice 1d8} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}.

abilities_active.name: Armor-Rending Bite
entries: The ankhrav makes a mandibles {@action Strike|CRB}; if the {@action Strike|CRB} hits, the target’s armor takes the damage and the acid damage bypasses the armor’s Hardness.

abilities_active.name: Spray Acid
entries: The ankhrav spews acid in a 30-foot cone, dealing {@dice 3d6} acid damage and {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage} (DC 20 basic Reflex save).

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Armor-Rending Bite
entries: The hive mother makes a mandibles {@action Strike|CRB}; if the {@action Strike|CRB} hits, the target’s armor takes the damage and the acid damage bypasses the armor’s Hardness.

abilities_active.name: Frenzy Pheromone
entries: The hive mother unleashes a pheromone that causes all other ankhravs within a 100-foot emanation to become {@condition quickened} 1 until the start of the hive mother’s next turn, and they can use the extra action only for {@action Burrow|CRB}, {@action Stride|CRB}, or {@action Strike|CRB} actions. The hive mother can’t unleash the pheromone again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Spray Acid
entries: The hive mother spews acid in a 60-foot cone, dealing {@dice 8d6} acid damage and {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage} (DC 26 basic Reflex save). It can’t spew acid again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Frightening Display
entries: The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 30 feet must attempt a DC 20 Will save. While a creature is {@condition frightened} by this ability, it is {@condition flat-footed} to the gorilla.

entries.Critical Success: No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Mangling Rend
entries: A megaprimatus makes two fist Strikes against the same target. If both hit, the attack deals an additional {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage, the target is {@condition flat-footed}, and the target takes a –20-foot status penalty to all Speeds until the end of its next turn.

abilities_active.name: Terrifying Display
entries: The megaprimatus beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 50 feet must attempt a DC 27 Will save. While a creature is {@condition frightened} by this ability, it is {@condition flat-footed} to the megaprimatus and to gorillas.

entries.Critical Success: No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened} 2 and {@condition fleeing} until the end of its next turn.

creature.name: Arboreal Warden
items: large bark shield (Hardness 3, Hit Points 20, BT 10)

abilities_automatic.name: Axe Vulnerability
entries: An arboreal warden takes 5 additional damage from axes.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_active.name: Shield Push
entries: The arboreal warden Strides and then makes a shield bash {@action Strike|CRB}. If the attack hits, the target is pushed 10 feet.

abilities_automatic.name: Axe Vulnerability
entries: An awakened tree takes 5 additional damage from axes.

abilities_automatic.name: Axe Vulnerability
entries: The arboreal regent takes 5 additional damage from axes.

abilities_active.name: Awaken Tree
entries: The arboreal regent causes a tree within 180 feet to uproot itself and fight as a minion using the statistics for an awakened tree. The arboreal regent can control up to two awakened trees at a time, and it can issue commands to both trees as a single action, which has the concentrate and auditory traits.

abilities_active.name: Sunder Objects
entries: When an arboreal regent damages an item or structure, it deals an additional {@dice 2d10} damage to that item or structure.

abilities_active.name: Throw Rock
entries: The monster picks up a rock within reach or retrieves a stowed rock and throws it, making a ranged {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Retributive Strike
entries: The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + the monster's level. If the foe is within reach, the monster makes a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against it.
abilities_automatic.trigger: An enemy damages the monster's ally, and both are within 15 feet of the monster.

abilities_active.name: Gestalt
entries: Nine lantern archons can use this activity, all within 1 round of the first, to merge together to form a composite being for 7 rounds that appears as a glowing warrior of light. The gestalt has the base statistics of a legion archon (AC, saving throws, attacks, skills, Speeds, and so on) but the spells and special abilities of a lantern archon. Additionally, it has a ranged light ray {@action Strike|CRB} (+18 attack, Damage {@dice 3d4} fire and {@dice 3d4} good), and the bonus from its Lantern of Hope increases to +3. When the gestalt separates, its remaining Hit Points are divided evenly among the lantern archons, and if the gestalt had fewer than 9 HP, some of the lantern archons die.

abilities_active.name: Lantern of Hope
entries: The lantern archon shines as a beacon of hope. Good allies within 30 feet gain a +1 status bonus to damage rolls and to saving throws against {@spell crushing despair|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Menacing Guardian
entries: 30 feet. Enemies that start their turn in the area or enter it must attempt a DC 19 Will save. On a failure, they take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, spell rolls, and damage rolls against any other target while in the aura for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. On a critical failure, they can’t use {@condition hostile} actions against any other target while in the area for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to further menacing guardian auras for 24 hours.

abilities_automatic.name: Retributive Strike
entries: The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + the monster's level. If the foe is within reach, the monster makes a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against it.
abilities_automatic.trigger: An enemy damages the monster's ally, and both are within 15 feet of the monster.

abilities_active.name: Archon’s Door
entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door|CRB}, it can cast an innate {@spell dimension door|CRB} (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon’s {@spell dimension door|CRB}. If the archon’s {@spell dimension door|CRB} has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either used {@spell dimension door|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Touch of Charity
entries: A horned archon can touch another creature to take on that creature’s wounds, transferring up to 30 of the horned archon’s HP to the touched creature. The horned archon can’t transfer more HP than it currently has.

abilities_automatic.name: Menacing Guardian
entries: As horned archon, but DC 23.
entries_as_xyz: 30 feet. Enemies that start their turn in the area or enter it must attempt a DC 19 Will save. On a failure, they take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, spell rolls, and damage rolls against any other target while in the aura for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. On a critical failure, they can’t use {@condition hostile} actions against any other target while in the area for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to further menacing guardian auras for 24 hours.

abilities_automatic.trigger: An enemy damages the monster's ally, and both are within 15 feet of the monster.

abilities_active.name: Archon’s Door
entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door|CRB}, it can cast an innate {@spell dimension door|CRB} (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon’s {@spell dimension door|CRB}. If the archon’s {@spell dimension door|CRB} has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either used {@spell dimension door|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Flame of Justice
entries: A legion archon’s spirit of righteousness manifests in its hands as a mighty two-handed sword called the flame.

abilities_interactive.name: Morphic Hands
entries: A shield archon’s hands can change into a +1 holy striking spear and a lesser sturdy shield or back into hands. Transforming does not restore any HP to the items, and if either the weapon or shield is fully destroyed, the archon loses that hand until it receives a {@spell regenerate|CRB} spell or similar magic. If a shield archon is slain, its weapon and shield can be taken, but they fade into nothingness after 24 hours.

abilities_automatic.name: Living Shield
entries: A shield archon’s shield is the focal point of its courage and soul. It always has its shield raised without needing to {@action Raise a Shield|CRB}, and it can use Shield Block as a free action instead of a reaction (Hardness 10, HP 80). A shield archon can trigger its Shield Block free action when an ally within 10 feet is the target of an attack, reducing damage to that ally instead of itself but otherwise following the normal rules of Shield Block.

abilities_automatic.name: Menacing Guardian
entries: As horned archon, but DC 27.
entries_as_xyz: 30 feet. Enemies that start their turn in the area or enter it must attempt a DC 19 Will save. On a failure, they take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, spell rolls, and damage rolls against any other target while in the aura for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. On a critical failure, they can’t use {@condition hostile} actions against any other target while in the area for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to further menacing guardian auras for 24 hours.

abilities_automatic.name: Retributive Strike
entries: The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + the monster's level. If the foe is within reach, the monster makes a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against it.
abilities_automatic.trigger: An enemy damages the monster's ally, and both are within 15 feet of the monster.

abilities_active.name: Archon’s Door
entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door|CRB}, it can cast an innate {@spell dimension door|CRB} (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon’s {@spell dimension door|CRB}. If the archon’s {@spell dimension door|CRB} has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either used {@spell dimension door|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Courageous Switch
entries: When a shield archon uses its {@spell dimension door|CRB} innate spell, it can choose to move into the space of a willing ally it can see within range. If it does so, the ally switches places with the archon, appearing in the space the archon just vacated, as if it too had cast {@spell dimension door|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Starlight Blast
entries: The lyrakien unleashes a blast of holy starlight in a 5-foot burst centered on itself. Creatures in the area take {@dice 1d6} chaotic damage and {@dice 1d6} good damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The lyrakien can’t use Starlight Blast or its starlight ray ranged attack for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Smoke
entries: A gancanagh’s lungs can’t tolerate smoke. They take a –2 circumstance penalty to saving throws against effects that create some form of smoke.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Invigorating Passion
entries: The gancanagh embraces or kisses a willing creature, infusing that creature with their invigorating passion. The creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and 10 temporary Hit Points for 10 minutes. After that time, the target becomes {@condition fatigued} for 10 minutes unless they succeed at a DC 21 Fortitude save.

abilities_automatic.name: Free Expression
entries: A lillend’s auditory and sonic effects attempt to counteract any effect that would directly control, manipulate, or prevent them from expressing themself freely, such as {@spell silence|CRB}. She can also spend an action, which has concentrate trait, to speak forcefully and counteract such effects.

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d6+10} bludgeoning plus {@dice 1d6} chaotic, {@dice 1d6} good, and Grab

abilities_automatic.name: Free Blade
abilities_automatic.trigger: The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.
entries: A ghaele’s blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay. The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword {@action Strike|CRB}, gives it a penalty to its greatsword {@action Strike|CRB}, or prevents it from acting. The ghaele can use this ability even if it’s otherwise unable to act.

abilities_automatic.name: Light Form
entries: A ghaele’s body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness). It can move through solid objects but can’t end its action within a solid object.

abilities_active.name: Choose Weakness
entries: A ghaele attempts to {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB} about a foe it is facing. If successful, it can change the elemental damage dealt by its greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the a foe’s weakness. It can also change its energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for its attacks). The choices remain until it next uses Choose Weakness.

abilities_active.name: Ghaele’s Gaze
entries: When a ghaele fixes its gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature suffers the effects of {@spell divine decree|CRB} (DC 33 Will save). If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to Ghaele’s Gaze for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Holy Blade
entries: Any weapon becomes a +2 holy striking weapon while the ghaele wields it.

attacks.name: holy greatsword
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d12+13} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} good and {@dice 1d6} other (see Choose Weakness)

attacks.name: light ray
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d12} chaotic plus {@dice 1d12} good plus {@dice 2d6+6} other (see Choose Weakness)

abilities_interactive.name: Hears Heartbeats
entries: The banshee can hear heartbeats within 60 feet (imprecise).

abilities_interactive.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
entries: If in direct sunlight, the banshee is {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t use actions that have the attack trait.

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

abilities_automatic.name: Vengeful Spite
abilities_automatic.trigger: A foe critically hits the banshee, or the banshee critically fails their save against a foe’s damaging effect.
entries: The banshee lashes back at their tormentor, dealing {@dice 4d10+14} mental damage (DC 38 basic Will save) and applying the effects of terrifying touch based on the results of the same Will save.

abilities_active.name: Spectral Ripple
entries: When a banshee Strides at least 10 feet, they’re {@condition concealed} until the start of their next turn.

abilities_active.name: Terrifying Touch
entries: A creature damaged by the banshee’s touch that isn’t already {@condition frightened} must attempt a DC 38 Will save (DC 43 if the attack was a critical hit). If the creature fails its save, it’s {@condition frightened} 2; on a critical failure, the creature also cowers with {@spell fear|CRB} and is {@condition stunned} 4. If the creature is protected against {@spell fear|CRB} by a spell or magic item, the banshee’s touch first attempts to counteract the {@spell protection|CRB} effect, with the effect of a 9th-level {@spell dispel magic|CRB} spell.

abilities_active.name: Wail
entries: The banshee unleashes a soul-chilling {@spell wail of the banshee|CRB} (DC 38). This Wail overcomes {@spell silence|CRB} and similar effects of 5th level or lower. The banshee can instead use Wail as a three-action activity to overcome such effects of up to 8th level.

The banshee’s Wail resonates for 1 round, and any creature that comes within the area during that time must attempt a save against the effect. A creature can’t be affected more than once by the same Wail. The banshee can’t Wail again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: All-Around Vision
entries: This monster can see in all directions simultaneously, and therefore can't be flanked.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Double Opportunity
entries: A baomal gains an extra reaction each round that it can use only to make an {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB}. It must use a different head for each one it attempts, and it can’t make more than one {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB} for the same triggering action.

abilities_automatic.name: Psychic Static Aura
entries: 120 feet. All creatures, except aberrations, that begin their turn in the area take {@dice 5d6} mental damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Two Heads
entries: Any ability that would sever a baomal’s head (such as a critical hit with a vorpal weapon) severs one head at random. Losing one head doesn’t kill a baomal, but it does prevent the baomal from making Strikes with the lost head and from using Double Opportunity or Two-Headed {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Breath of the Sea
entries: A baomal can inhale tremendous amounts of water, drawing everything in the sea nearby closer. All creatures and objects in the water within 60 feet of the baomal (including ships) are pulled toward it. Creatures must succeed at a DC 42 Athletics check or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the baomal (40 feet on a critical failure). For ships, use the captain’s Sailing Lore in place of Athletics. Unattended objects are automatically pulled.

abilities_active.name: Shell Rake
entries: The baomal Swims or Strides alongside a creature or the hull of a vessel, dealing damage with the strong spikes on its shell. Each creature or ship the baomal is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes {@dice 6d6+10} slashing and piercing damage (DC 42 basic Reflex save). Against vessels, Shell Rake ignores the first 5 Hardness and creates an explosion of splinters that deals {@dice 3d6+5} damage to every creature within 10 feet of the deck’s edge (DC 42 basic Reflex save).

abilities_active.name: Two-Headed Strike
entries: The baomal makes a {@action Strike|CRB} with each set of jaws, each against a different creature. These Strikes count as one attack for the baomal’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after both attacks.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Feed
entries: Once per month, a barghest can spend 1 minute to devour a corpse, gaining a permanent +1 status bonus to its checks and DCs. Each subsequent time it feeds, this bonus increases by 1. The fourth time a barghest feeds, it sheds its skin and mutates into a greater barghest, and the status bonus ends.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Mutations
abilities_active.trigger: The barghest completes a Strike.
entries: The process of consuming corpses to evolve into a greater barghest results in odd and unpredictable physiological changes. A greater barghest has one mutation, typically chosen from the following options.

items: {@bold Fangs} (poison) The barghest grows elongated fangs that seep poison. Its jaws deal {@dice 1d6} additional poison damage and {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent poison damage}.

{@bold Toxic Breath} (divine, evocation, poison) The barghest breathes a cloud of toxic gas that deals {@dice 8d6} poison damage to all creatures in a 30-foot cone (DC 25 basic Fortitude save). It can’t use Toxic Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

{@bold Vestigial} Arm {@action Strike|CRB} {@as F} Frequency once per round; The barghest makes a claw {@action Strike|CRB} with a shriveled third arm hanging from its torso. This attack doesn’t count for the barghest’s multiple attack penalty, nor does that penalty apply on the attack.
{@bold Wings} The barghest has malformed wings extending from its back. It gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.

abilities_automatic.name: Petrifying Glance
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within 30 feet that the basilisk can see starts its turn.
entries: The target must attempt a DC 20 Fortitude save. If it fails, it’s {@spell slow|CRB} 1 for 1 minute as its body slowly stiffens.

abilities_active.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: The basilisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a DC 22 Fortitude save. If it fails and has not already been {@condition slowed} by Petrifying Glance or this ability, it becomes {@condition slowed} 1. If the creature was already {@condition slowed} by this ability or Petrifying Glance, a failed save causes the creature to be {@condition petrified} permanently.

A creature {@condition petrified} in this manner that is coated (not just splashed) with fresh basilisk blood (taken from a basilisk that has been dead no longer than 1 hour) is instantly restored to flesh. A single basilisk contains enough blood to coat {@dice 1d3} Medium creatures in this manner.

abilities_interactive.name: Echolocation
entries: A bat swarm can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

abilities_active.name: Blood Feast
entries: Each enemy in the bat swarm’s space takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage (DC 16 basic Reflex save). Creatures that fail this save also take 1 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.

abilities_interactive.name: Echolocation
entries: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

abilities_automatic.name: Wing Thrash
abilities_automatic.trigger: An adjacent enemy damages the giant bat.
entries: The bat makes one or two wing Strikes—one against the triggering creature and one against another adjacent creature.

abilities_active.name: Mauler
entries: The grizzly bear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has {@condition grabbed}.

abilities_active.name: Rush
entries: The grizzly bear Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement.

abilities_active.name: During the
entries: {@action Stride|CRB}, the grizzly bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

abilities_active.name: Mauler
entries: The bear gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has {@condition grabbed}.

abilities_active.name: Rush
entries: The cave bear Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement.

abilities_active.name: During the
entries: {@action Stride|CRB}, it gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

abilities_automatic.name: Luminescent Aura
entries: 10 feet. The flash beetle’s bioluminescent organs fill the area with bright light.

abilities_active.name: Light Flash
entries: The flash beetle creates a brilliant flash of light. All creatures in its luminescent aura must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or be {@condition dazzled} for 1 minute. The flash beetle’s glow then goes out, disabling its aura for 24 hours, during which time it cannot use Light Flash.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Attach
entries: When a bloodseeker hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to grabbing the creature, but the bloodseeker moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The bloodseeker is flatfooted while attached. If the bloodseeker is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has {@condition drained} blood from, that creature takes 1 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}. Escaping the attach or removing the bloodseeker in other ways doesn’t cause bleed damage.

abilities_active.name: Blood Drain
abilities_active.requirements: The bloodseeker is attached to a creature.
entries: The bloodseeker uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it’s attached to.

This deals {@dice 1d4} damage, and the bloodseeker gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood {@condition drained} by a bloodseeker is {@condition drained} 1 until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_active.name: Boar Charge
entries: The boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk {@action Strike|CRB}. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_active.name: Daeodon Charge
entries: The daeodon Strides twice and then makes a tusk {@action Strike|CRB}. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.
A medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a DC 19 Reflex save or be knocked {@condition prone} by the force of the blow.

abilities_active.name: Swamp Stride
entries: A boggard scout ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

abilities_active.name: Terrifying Croak
entries: The boggard scout unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes {@condition frightened} 1 unless they succeed at a DC 17 Will save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Tongue Grab
entries: If the boggard scout hits a creature with its tongue, that creature becomes {@condition grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn’t {@condition immobilized}, but it can’t move beyond the reach of the boggard’s tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 13 and dealing at least 2 slashing damage. Though this doesn’t deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents it from using its tongue {@action Strike|CRB} until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

abilities_active.name: Swamp Stride
entries: A boggard scout ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

abilities_active.name: Terrifying Croak
entries: As boggard scout, except DC 18.

abilities_active.name: Tongue Grab
entries: As boggard scout, except AC 15 and 3 HP.

abilities_interactive.name: Performance
entries: +8, Religion +9 Str +3, Dex +0, Con +2, Int +0, Wis +4, Cha +3 Items staff.

abilities_active.name: Destructive Croak
entries: The swampseer utters a powerful croak that deals {@dice 4d6} sonic damage to any non-boggard within a 15-foot emanation (DC 19 basic Fortitude save); any creature with the {@condition frightened} condition takes additional sonic damage equal to twice the value of their {@condition frightened} condition. The boggard can’t use.

abilities_active.name: Destructive
entries: Croak again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Drowning Drone
abilities_active.trigger: The boggard swampseer or one of its allies within 60 feet attempts a saving throw against an auditory or sonic effect.
entries: Trigger The boggard swampseer or one of its allies within 60 feet attempts a saving throw against an auditory or sonic effect. The swampseer releases a croak that drowns out other sound. It rolls a Performance check. It and boggard allies in the area can use the higher result of the swampseer’s Performance check or their saves to resolve the effects against the auditory or sonic effect.

abilities_active.name: Swamp Stride
entries: A boggard scout ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

abilities_active.name: Terrifying Croak
entries: As boggard scout, except DC 19.

abilities_active.name: Tongue Grab
entries: As boggard scout, except AC 15 and 4 HP.

abilities_active.name: Blue Dragonfly Poison
entries: Boggards brew a potent toxin made from blue dragonflies.
Swampseers consume this mixture to awaken their divine powers, but the poison inspires crippling hallucinations in most other creatures.

abilities_interactive.name: Occultism
entries: +21, Stealth +17 Str +6, Dex +3, Con +5, Int +4, Wis +4, Cha +3.

abilities_automatic.name: Brain Blisters
entries: A brain collector has seven brain blisters on its back that it uses to house stolen brains. A brain collector without all seven blisters full is {@condition stupefied} with a value equal to the number of empty blisters.

abilities_automatic.name: Brain Loss
entries: If a brain collector takes 30 damage from a critical hit or takes 25 mental damage, it must succeed at a DC 26 save (Fortitude for critical damage or Will for mental damage) or one of its brain blisters is destroyed.

abilities_active.name: Collect Brain
entries: The brain collector collects a brain of a creature that has been dead for no more than 1 minute. It can then use an {@action Interact|CRB} action to secure the brain in one of its empty brain blisters.

abilities_active.name: Bushwhack
entries: The bugbear thug Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to {@action Grapple|CRB} a creature they’re {@condition undetected} by. If they succeed, they also deal fist damage to that creature.

abilities_active.name: Mauler
entries: The bugbear thug gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have {@condition grabbed}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Twin Feint
entries: The bugbear tormentor makes a dazzling series of attacks with two weapons, using the first attack to throw their foe off guard against a second attack at a different angle. They make one {@action Strike|CRB} with each of their two melee weapons, both against the same target. The target is automatically {@condition flat‑footed} against the second attack. Apply the bugbear tormentor’s multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

abilities_active.name: Favored Prey
entries: A bulette gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls with its jaws against a specific type of creature designated as its favorite food. Unless otherwise stated, a bulette’s favored prey is halflings. Elves are never a favored prey for bulettes.

abilities_active.name: Leaping Charge
entries: The bulette attempts a {@action High {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB} or {@action Long {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB}. If it’s adjacent to an enemy at the apex of its {@action High {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB} or at the end of its {@action Long {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB}, it can make a claw {@action Strike|CRB} against the enemy at that moment. If the bulette jumps at least 5 feet vertically or at least 20 feet horizontally, it can attempt two claw Strikes instead of one. The bulette’s multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until it has made all the claw Strikes that are part of its Leaping Charge.

abilities_active.name: Powerful Jumper
entries: A bulette jumps 10 feet up on a successful {@action High {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB}, or 20 feet up on a critical success.

abilities_interactive.name: Blood Scent
entries: The bunyip can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

abilities_automatic.name: Aquatic Opportunity
entries: As {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB}, but both the bunyip and the triggering creature must be in water.

abilities_active.name: Blood Frenzy
abilities_active.trigger: The bunyip deals bleed damage to a living creature.
abilities_active.requirements: The bunyip is not fatigued or already in a frenzy.
entries: Requirements The bunyip is not {@condition fatigued} or already in a frenzy. The bunyip flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the bunyip gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its jaws, gains 8 temporary HP that go away at the end of the frenzy, and takes a –2 penalty to AC.

abilities_active.name: Roar
entries: The bunyip lets out a loud and horrifying roar.

Other creatures within 100 feet must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition frightened} 2 ({@condition frightened} 3 on a critical failure, {@condition frightened} 1 on a success, or unaffected on a critical success)
No matter the result, the creature is temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Shift Form
entries: A bunyip can alter its form slightly to gain an advantage and make it harder to recognize. When it does, its teeth {@spell shrink|CRB} and its jaws {@action Strike|CRB} doesn’t deal the {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}. It can choose to gain either a long snake tail, granting its tail {@action Strike|CRB} reach 10 feet and Grab, or squat crocodile legs, increasing its land Speed to 20 feet. If it uses Shift Form again, the bunyip can return to normal or switch between a long tail or crocodile legs.

abilities_interactive.name: Thievery
entries: +7 Str +0, Dex +4, Con +2, Int –1, Wis +1, Cha +3 Items baton (light mace), dagger.

abilities_automatic.name: Distracting Frolic
entries: Trigger An ally within 10 feet of the dancer rolls a saving throw against a mental or illusion effect. The target ally can roll the save twice and take the better result.

abilities_automatic.name: Death Flare
entries: When the dancer dies, their body combusts in a flare of white light. All creatures in a 10-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or be {@condition dazzled} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

Calignis that fail this save are also {@condition frightened} 1. The dancer’s gear and treasure are left in a pile where they died. As this isn’t a magical effect, the light has no effect within magical {@spell darkness|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Dancer’s Curse
entries: The caligni dancer touches a foe and curses it. If the target fails a DC 18 Will save, it gains {@condition clumsy} 1 and {@condition stupefied} 1. The target is then temporarily immune for 24 hours. These conditions persist until the curse is removed. The victim can attempt a new DC 18 Will save once per hour to end the curse.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

creature.name: Caligni Creeper
items: black smear poison (3 doses; see page 50)

abilities_automatic.name: Death Flash
entries: When the caligni creeper dies, their body combusts in a flash of bright light. All creatures in a 10-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or be {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. Creatures with light {@spell blindness|CRB} who successfully save are still {@condition blinded} for 1 round. The creeper’s gear and treasure are left in a pile where they died. As this isn’t a magical effect, the light has no effect within magical {@spell darkness|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

attacks.name: dagger
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4+4} piercing plus black smear poison (see below)

attacks.name: dagger
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4} piercing plus black smear poison (see below)

creature.name: Caligni Stalker
items: black smear poison (6 doses; see below)

abilities_automatic.name: Death Flame
entries: When the stalker dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a 20-foot burst take {@dice 5d6} fire damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save)
The stalker’s gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.

abilities_active.name: Double Slice
entries: The caligni stalker makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The stalker combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the stalker’s multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

abilities_active.name: Encircling Command
entries: Each caligni creeper within 30 feet of the stalker can {@action Step|CRB}. Each creeper can benefit from Encircling {@spell Command|CRB} only once per round.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Black Smear Poison
entries: Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.

attacks.name: shortsword
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d6+7} piercing plus black smear poison (see below)

abilities_active.name: Maul
entries: The leopard makes two claw Strikes against a creature it has {@condition grabbed}. Both count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks are made.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The leopard Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the leopard began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability’s {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The lion deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage to any creature that’s within reach of at least two of the lion’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The lion Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the ability’s {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The tiger Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the tiger began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability’s {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Wrestle
entries: The tiger makes a claw {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

abilities_active.name: Grab
entries: The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is {@condition grabbed} by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to {@action Strike|CRB} creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures {@condition grabbed} by it. A {@condition grabbed} creature can use the {@action Escape|CRB} action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a {@condition grabbed} creatures if the monster moves away from it.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

abilities_active.name: Pierce Armor
entries: The smilodon makes a fangs {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}; if the creature is wearing armor with hardness 10 or lower, the armor is {@condition broken}. If this {@action Strike|CRB} breaks a creature’s armor or damages a creature who is unarmored or wearing {@condition broken} armor, the creature also takes {@dice 2d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn’t further damage armor that’s already {@condition broken}.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The smilodon Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the smilodon began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability’s {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_automatic.name: Cat’s Luck
abilities_automatic.trigger: The catfolk pouncer fails or critically fails a Reflex saving throw.
entries: Trigger The catfolk pouncer fails or critically fails a Reflex saving throw. Reroll that saving throw and take the better result.

abilities_active.name: Sudden Charge
entries: The catfolk pouncer Strides up to double their Speed. If the catfolk ends their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against that enemy.

abilities_interactive.name: Thoughtsense
entries: The cauthooj senses a creatures mental essence at the listed ranged.

abilities_automatic.name: Hop-Dodge
abilities_automatic.trigger: The cauthooj is the target of a melee
entries: {@action Strike|CRB} and is adjacent to another enemy that is also within the reach of the melee {@action Strike|CRB}. The cauthooj nimbly hops aside, redirecting the triggering {@action Strike|CRB} against the adjacent enemy. The cauthooj Strides up to half its Speed, and this movement does not trigger reactions.

abilities_active.name: Staccato Strike
entries: With subtle alterations in the pitch and tone of its song, the cauthooj directs one creature {@condition confused} by its Warbling Song to make a {@action Strike|CRB}. This works like other Strikes made by {@condition confused} creatures, except that the cauthooj chooses the target. If no target is in reach or range, or the creature is unable to {@action Strike|CRB} for any other reason, this ability has no effect.

abilities_active.name: Warbling Song
entries: The cauthooj gives a strange, ululating cry that causes nearby creatures to lash out violently and without control. Each creature within a 120-foot emanation that can hear the cauthooj must attempt a DC 32 Will save to resist the effect.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
entries.Failure: The target is {@condition confused} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is {@condition confused} for 1 round and immediately attacks itself (in the normal fashion for attacking oneself while {@condition confused}). This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn’t give the creature a flat check to recover from the {@spell confusion|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Inexorable
entries: The purple worm recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It’s also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the {@condition immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

abilities_automatic.name: Shake It Off
abilities_automatic.trigger: The purple worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as baleful polymorph).
entries: The purple worm negates the triggering condition or effect. s from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can’t be avoided in this way.

abilities_active.name: Fast Swallow
abilities_active.trigger: The purple worm Grabs a creature.
entries: The worm uses Swallow Whole.

abilities_active.name: Regurgitate
entries: The purple worm can violently regurgitate a creature or boulder it has swallowed to make a ranged {@action Strike|CRB}. The {@action Strike|CRB} deals bludgeoning damage depending on the size of the projectile: Tiny deals {@dice 2d6+13}, Small {@dice 3d6+13}, Medium {@dice 4d6+13}, Large {@dice 5d6+13}, and Huge {@dice 6d6+13}. A regurgitated creature takes falling damage from the height of the target or from 20 feet, whichever is greater.
Boulders occupy space in the worm’s stomach as a creature of equivalent size, and purple worms often have several boulders swallowed. A purple worm can use a single action to swallow a new boulder.

abilities_active.name: Rock Tunneler
entries: A purple worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_active.name: Thrash
entries: The worm makes a {@action Strike|CRB} once against each creature in its reach. It can {@action Strike|CRB} up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes all the attacks.

abilities_automatic.name: Inexorable
entries: The purple worm recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It’s also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the {@condition immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

abilities_automatic.name: Shake It Off
entries: The purple worm negates the triggering condition or effect. s from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can’t be avoided in this way.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The purple worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as baleful polymorph).

abilities_active.name: Breach
entries: The azure worm Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 30 feet, making a {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature at the apex of the {@spell jump|CRB} (this lets it attack a creature within 45 feet of the water’s surface). After the {@action Strike|CRB}, the worm splashes back down. It can use Improved Grab on this {@action Strike|CRB} and follow it up with Fast Swallow.

abilities_active.name: Fast Swallow
abilities_active.trigger: The worm Grabs a creature.
entries: The worm uses Swallow Whole.

Each attack counts toward the worm’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes all the attacks.

abilities_automatic.name: Fire Healing
entries: As long as a crimson worm is in contact with a fire or body of magma at least as large as itself, it gains fast healing 20. When struck by a magical fire effect from anything other than itself, a crimson worm regains Hit Points equal to half the fire damage the effect would otherwise deal.

abilities_automatic.name: Inexorable
entries: The purple worm recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It’s also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the {@condition immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

abilities_automatic.name: Shake It Off
entries: The purple worm negates the triggering condition or effect. s from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can’t be avoided in this way.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The purple worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as baleful polymorph).

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The crimson worm breathes a blast of flame in a 60-foot cone that deals {@dice 18d6} fire damage to all creatures in the area (DC 41 basic Reflex save). It can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Fast Swallow
abilities_active.trigger: The worm Grabs a creature.
entries: The worm uses Swallow Whole.
