It can {@action Strike|CRB} up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes all the attacks.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d10+18} piercing plus {@dice 2d6} fire and Improved Grab

attacks.name: stinger
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d12+18} piercing plus {@dice 2d6} fire and crimson worm venom

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Swarming Bites
entries: Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes {@dice 1d8} piercing damage (DC 20 basic Reflex save) plus centipede swarm venom.

abilities_automatic.name: Three Headed
entries: Any ability that would sever a chimera’s head (such as a critical hit with a vorpal weapon) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn’t kill a chimera (as long as it has one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using the head’s Breath Weapon.

abilities_automatic.name: Triple Opportunity
entries: A chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can’t use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The chimera breathes a cone or line that deals {@dice 9d6} damage to all creatures in the area (DC 26 basic save of a type indicated below). The color of the chimera’s dragon head determines the area of the Breath Weapon, the type of damage it deals, and the type of save to avoid it. The chimera can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Draconic Bite
entries: A chimera’s dragon head deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of a type matching the dragon’s color (see Breath Weapon).

abilities_active.name: Three-Headed Strike
entries: The chimera makes a {@action Strike|CRB} with its dragon jaws, lion jaws, and goat horns, each at a –2 penalty and targeting a different creature. These Strikes count as only one attack for the chimera’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after it has made all three attacks.

attacks.name: dragon jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d6+9} piercing plus {@dice 2d6} energy damage (see draconic bite)

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Mandibles
abilities_active.requirements: A creature is grabbed and paralyzed by the chuul’s tentacles.
entries: The creature takes {@dice 3d6} piercing damage.

abilities_active.name: Tentacle Transfer
abilities_active.requirements: The chuul has a creature grabbed.
entries: The chuul transfers the {@condition grabbed} creature from its claws to its tentacles, or vice versa. A creature is exposed to the chuul’s paralytic venom when transferred into the tentacles and at the start of each of the chuul’s turns if it remains {@condition grabbed} by the tentacles.

abilities_interactive.name: Shadow Shift
entries: Cloakers are {@condition concealed} in dim light even to creatures with low-light vision and {@spell darkvision|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Envelop
entries: The cloaker makes an attack roll with a +14 bonus against an adjacent creature’s Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it envelops the target, who is {@condition restrained}. Attacks that hit an enveloping cloaker deal half their damage to the cloaker and half to the trapped victim. The cloaker can’t {@action Fly|CRB}, and when it moves using its land Speed it moves the enveloped creature with it. The cloaker can make only jaws Strikes against the {@condition restrained} creature but can make tail Strikes against other creatures.
A creature that voluntarily puts on the cloaker becomes engulfed automatically. A cloaker can engulf only Large or smaller creatures, and no more than one creature at a time.

abilities_active.name: Infrasonic Moan
entries: The cloaker lets out an infrasonic moan that has one of the effects below. A creature that succeeds at a DC 22 Will save is unaffected. Any creature that attempts this save becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour. Because the moan is infrasonic, most humanoids don’t detect the source of their plight if they aren’t already aware of the cloaker.

items: {@spell Fear|CRB} ({@spell fear|CRB}, incapacitation) Each creature within a 30-foot emanation becomes {@condition frightened} 1 (or, on a critical failure, {@condition frightened} 2 and {@condition fleeing} until the end of its next turn).
{@bold Nausea} Each creature within a 30-foot emanation falls {@condition prone} and become {@condition sickened} 2.
{@bold Stupor} The cloaker targets a single creature within 30 feet. The creature becomes {@condition clumsy} 1 and {@condition stupefied} 1 for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Calcification
entries: A peck from a cockatrice hardens the flesh of the creature struck. The target must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become {@condition slowed} 1 (or {@condition slowed} 2 on a critical failure). Further failed saves against calcification increase the {@condition slowed} condition. Once a creature’s actions are reduced to 0 by calcification, that creature becomes {@condition petrified}.

Every 24 hours after it was {@condition petrified}, the victim can attempt a DC 20 Fortitude save to recover. On a success, it becomes flesh again, but is {@condition slowed} 1 for the next 24 hours. On a critical success, the creature recovers and isn’t {@condition slowed}. On a failure, the creature remains {@condition petrified}, but can try again in 24 hours. On a critical failure, the petrification is permanent, and the creature can’t attempt any more saves.

abilities_active.name: Aquatic Ambush
entries: The monster moves up to its swim Speed + 10 feet toward the triggering creature, traveling on water and on land. Once the creature is in reach, the monster makes a {@action Strike|CRB} against it. The creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster is hiding in water and a creature that hasn't detected it is within the listed number of feet.

abilities_active.name: Death Roll
abilities_active.requirements: The crocodile must have a creature grabbed.
entries: The crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the {@condition grabbed} creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature {@condition prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

abilities_active.name: Deep Breath
entries: The crocodile can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

abilities_active.name: Aquatic Ambush
entries: The monster moves up to its swim Speed + 10 feet toward the triggering creature, traveling on water and on land. Once the creature is in reach, the monster makes a {@action Strike|CRB} against it. The creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster is hiding in water and a creature that hasn't detected it is within the listed number of feet.

abilities_active.name: Deep Breath
entries: A deinosuchus can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_automatic.name: Flash of Insight
abilities_automatic.trigger: The cyclops is about to roll a d20.
entries: The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. It gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

abilities_active.name: Swipe
entries: The cyclops makes a melee {@action Strike|CRB} and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the cyclops’s multiple attack penalty.

abilities_automatic.name: Catch Rock
entries: The monster gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack or to any defense against the falling rock. If the attack misses or the monster successfully defends against the falling rock, the monster catches the rock, takes no damage, and is now holding the rock.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is targeted with a thrown rock Strike or a rock would fall on the monster.
abilities_automatic.requirements: The monster must have a free hand but can Release anything it's holding as part of this reaction.

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_automatic.name: Flash of Brutality
abilities_automatic.trigger: The great cyclops succeeds at an attack roll.
abilities_automatic.frequency: once per day, and recharges when the great cyclops uses Ferocity;
entries: The attack becomes a critical success.

abilities_active.name: Powerful Charge
entries: The great cyclops Strides twice and makes a horn {@action Strike|CRB}. If it moved at least 20 feet away from its starting position, the {@action Strike|CRB}’s damage is increased to {@dice 3d10+20}.

abilities_active.name: Throw Rock
entries: The monster picks up a rock within reach or retrieves a stowed rock and throws it, making a ranged {@action Strike|CRB}.

entries.name: Cacodaemonia
entries.note:
The cacodaemon can telepathically
communicate with the afflicted creature at any distance on the
same plane

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Soul Lock
entries: Once per day, a cacodaemon can ingest the soul of a sentient creature within 30 feet that died within the last minute. When it does, the cacodaemon grows a fist-sized soul gem (Hardness 2, HP 8) in its gut and can regurgitate it at any time as an {@action Interact|CRB} action. Destroying the gem frees the soul within but does not return the deceased creature to life. The caster of a spell to return a creature to life whose soul is trapped within a soul gem must succeed at a DC 30 Religion check. On a success, the soul gem shatters and the creature is returned to life as normal for the spell.
By using an {@action Interact|CRB} action, a fiend can ingest a soul gem it is holding, condemning the soul to the fiend’s home plane. The fiend gains fast healing 5 for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The ceustodaemon breathes flames in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the cone take {@dice 7d6} fire damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save). The ceustodaemon and each creature that fails the save catch fire, taking {@dice 2d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}. The breath weapon can’t be used again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Drawn to Service
entries: When bringing a ceustodaemon to another plane with effects like a planar binding or planar ally ritual, the primary and secondary skill DCs are reduced by 5, and the ceustodaemon demands only half the normal cost for its service.

abilities_active.name: Vicious Wounds
entries: On a successful jaws or claw {@action Strike|CRB}, the ceustodaemon viciously tears into its victim as similar wounds appear on its own body. The target takes an extra {@dice 1d6} amount of damage, and the ceustodaemon takes the same extra damage. If this extra damage to the target is doubled, due to a critical hit, the ceustodaemon takes double damage as well.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d10+5} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and vicious wounds

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d6+5} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and vicious wounds

abilities_interactive.name: Plaguesense
entries: A leukodaemon senses any creature with a disease, and it knows the type and current stage of all diseases carried by any creature within range.

abilities_automatic.name: Infectious Aura
entries: 30 feet. Leukodaemons radiate infection. All creatures within 30 feet of a leukodaemon take a –2 status penalty to saves against disease effects. If a creature within range contracts or progresses a disease, all adjacent creatures are exposed to the same disease, at the same DC.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The leukodaemon exhales a cloud of corpse-bloated, biting black flies in a 20-foot cone. Creatures within the cone take {@dice 4d8} piercing damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save)
A creature that fails the save becomes {@condition sickened} 1 (or {@condition sickened} 2 on a critical failure).

entries.name: Daemonic Pestilence
entries.note:
The leukodaemon can telepathically communicate
with the afflicted creature at any distance on the same plane

abilities_active.name: Quicken Pestilence
entries: The leukodaemon coaxes a disease into full bloom. It chooses a target in its aura of pestilence that’s currently affected by a disease. That creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the disease as if the interval for the disease’s current stage had passed.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d12+9} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and daemonic pestilence

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+9} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and daemonic pestilence

attacks.name: composite longbow
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+9} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and Daemonic Pestilence

abilities_automatic.name: Soul Siphon
entries: 30 feet. An astradaemon draws power from the souls of the recently slain. If a Small or larger living creature dies within its aura, the astradaemon gains 5 temporary Hit Points and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 round, unless the creature was slain by an astradaemon’s.

abilities_automatic.name: Devour
entries: Soul ability. Incorporeal undead and living spirits traveling outside the body take {@dice 1d8} force damage each round within the daemon’s aura from the spiritual pressure as the astradaemon pulls in fragments of their soul.

abilities_automatic.name: Displacement
entries: An astradaemon bends light, appearing shifted from its true position, though still in the same space. Creatures targeting the astradaemon must attempt a DC 11 flat check, as if the astradaemon were {@condition hidden}, even though it remains {@condition observed}. s such as the Blind-Fight feat and halfling’s keen eyes that apply on the flat check against {@condition hidden} creatures also apply against a displaced astradaemon.

abilities_active.name: Devour Soul
abilities_active.requirements: The astradaemon hasn’t used an action with the attack trait yet this turn.
entries: Requirements The astradaemon hasn’t used an action with the attack trait yet this turn. The astradaemon draws out and consumes the soul of a living creature it has {@condition grabbed}. The creature must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or instantly die. If it dies, the astradaemon gains 10 temporary Hit Points and a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute, or for 1 day if the victim was 15th level or higher.
A victim slain in this way can be returned to life normally. A creature that survives is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Essence Drain
entries: When an astradaemon hits with its claw, jaws, or tail, it drains the target’s spiritual and vital essences. The target takes {@dice 2d10} negative energy damage and the astradaemon regains an equal number of Hit Points. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or become {@condition doomed} 1 and {@condition drained} 1. If the target was already {@condition drained} or {@condition doomed}, it instead increases both conditions’ value by 1, to a maximum of 4.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d8+9} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} evil, essence drain, and Grab

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d6+9} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and Essence Drain

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d10+9} bludgeoning plus {@dice 1d6} evil and Essence Drain

abilities_active.name: Hidden Movement
entries: If the deep gnome scout starts its turn {@condition undetected} or {@condition hidden} to a creature, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the deep gnome scout’s attacks until the end of the turn.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_interactive.name: Abyssal Knowledge
entries: When a quasit offers {@action Aid|CRB} for an Arcana or Religion check, it gets the critical success result on any success and gets the critical failure result on any failure.

abilities_automatic.name: Virtue Aversion
entries: The quasit’s link to a mortal soul gave it birth, but it presents a vulnerability. Once per round, a creature can present an object related to something virtuous or good in the life of the quasit’s creator (such as a beloved daughter’s doll) as an {@action Interact|CRB} action to automatically deal the quasit {@dice 2d6} mental damage.

abilities_active.name: Abyssal Healing
entries: The quasit restores {@dice 1d6} HP to itself.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d6-1} slashing plus {@dice 1d4} evil and quasit venom

abilities_automatic.name: Rejection Vulnerability
entries: As succubi are beings of pure lust, creatures that reject their lust can metaphysically {@spell harm|CRB} them. When a succubus fails a Diplomacy check to Embrace or {@action Request|CRB}, or when a creature succeeds at its save against a succubus’s mental spell or ability, the succubus takes {@dice 2d6} mental damage. For one hour after causing mental damage to a succubus in this way, a creature can deal {@dice 2d6} mental damage to the succubus with a successful {@action Demoralize|CRB} incorporating its rejection.

abilities_automatic.name: Seductive Presence
entries: 10 feet. Any creature in the aura that could be sexually attracted to a succubus takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to oppose the succubus’s mental spells, Deception, and Diplomacy.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Embrace
entries: The succubus attempts to {@action Grapple|CRB} a creature using their Diplomacy bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, the succubus grapples it automatically.

abilities_active.name: Passionate Kiss
entries: The succubus engages a creature they have {@condition grabbed} in an embrace or other act of passion to drain its vital essence. The kiss makes the creature {@condition drained} 1 or increases its {@condition drained} condition by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes {@dice 3d6} negative damage and the succubus regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.
The target must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be affected by a {@spell suggestion|CRB} to submit to more actions of passion rather than trying to {@action Escape|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Profane Gift
entries: The succubus on can give a willing humanoid a profane gift. That creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. As long as the gift persists, the succubus can communicate telepathically with the target at any distance, see through the creature’s senses, and target the creature with {@spell suggestion|CRB} through the telepathic link. In addition, the creature uses an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolls on saving throws against the lust demon’s suggestions.

A humanoid can’t have more than one profane gift at a time, and a succubus can’t grant more than one profane gift at a time. Removing the gift requires an atone ritual. The succubus can remove the gift as a free action to give the recipient a permanent {@condition stupefied} 3 condition. A 4th-level {@spell restoration|CRB} spell is required to reduce this {@condition stupefied} condition by 1.
A summoned succubus can’t grant a profane gift.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Peace Vulnerability
entries: A vrock’s wrath is the heart of their essence, and forcing peace upon them wrenches at their soul. If they fail a save against {@spell calm emotions|CRB} or a similar effect forcing them to be peaceful, a vrock takes {@dice 4d6} mental damage.

abilities_active.name: Dance of Ruin
entries: The vrock dances in flight and chants to create a ruinous explosion of electricity. If more vrocks within 30 feet want to join the dance, the vrock can delay the dance to wait for more vrocks; FPO in that case, the effect occurs after the last vrock uses Dance of Ruin or one of the vrocks chooses to complete that round of the dance. Each non-demon creature in a 20-foot emanation from any of the dancing vrocks takes {@dice 2d12} electricity damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). For each additional vrock that joins the dance, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} and the save DC increases by 1 (to a maximum of four vrocks dealing {@dice 5d12} damage with a DC 31 save). The vrocks can continue dancing by using Dance of Ruin each round, for up to 3 rounds in total. The emanation’s size increases by 20 feet each round, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} per vrock each round.

abilities_active.name: Spore Cloud
entries: The vrock emits a cloud of spores from their body, dealing {@dice 2d8} poison damage to all adjacent creatures. Each creature damaged this way must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or take {@dice 2d8} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent piercing damage} as the spores penetrate its skin and grow into thick, green vines. The vines cease growing after 10 rounds, and they wither away in {@dice 1d4} days if not shaved off before then. The vines can be destroyed if the creature is affected by a good spell or if holy water is applied to the vines (with an {@action Interact|CRB} action). Once the vrock uses Spore Cloud, the ability can’t be used for {@dice 1d6} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Stunning Screech
entries: The vrock emits a shrill screech. Each non-demon creature within a 30-foot burst must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition stunned} 2, and on a critical failure, it’s {@condition stunned} 3.

abilities_automatic.name: Truth Vulnerability
entries: A glabrezu’s lies sustain them, and the truth can destroy them. Whenever a revelation effect counteracts or reveals the glabrezu’s illusions or the glabrezu fails a save against an effect that would prevent them from lying (such as {@spell zone of truth|CRB}), the demon takes {@dice 3d6} mental damage. They take this damage only once per effect, even if the effect reveals multiple illusions or prevents multiple lies.

abilities_active.name: Captive Rake
abilities_active.requirements: A creature is grabbed in the glabrezu’s pincer.
entries: The glabrezu pulls the {@condition grabbed} creature up to 5 feet closer, then makes two claw Strikes against it. Those Strikes count as one attack when determining a treachery demon’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after both Strikes.

abilities_active.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: When a reaction would disrupt a glabrezu’s spell, the demon can attempt a DC 15 flat check, avoiding the disruption on a success.

abilities_active.name: Sudden Betrayal
entries: A glabrezu can always use Deception when rolling initiative as long as they’re aware of at least one opponent before initiative is rolled. When using Deception for initiative, the demon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception.

abilities_active.name: Treacherous Veil
entries: A glabrezu’s {@spell illusory disguise|CRB} can allow it to appear as a creature of any size.

abilities_active.name: Twisted Desires
entries: Once per month, a glabrezu can grant a mortal humanoid the effects of a {@spell miracle|CRB} spell granted by an Abyssal patron, though the glabrezu always perverts the {@spell miracle|CRB} according to their own treacherous nature.

abilities_automatic.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: 30 feet. A non-evil creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save. If it fails, it’s {@condition slowed} 1 for 1 round, and if it critically fails, it is instead {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.

abilities_automatic.name: Succor Vulnerability
entries: A shemhazian’s mutilation is a part of them, and they can’t bear to see it reversed. The first time each round that a creature heals from damage the shemhazian dealt on their last turn, the demon takes {@dice 3d6} mental damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Tail Whip
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within reach of the shemhazian’s tail leaves a square during a move action it’s using.
entries: The shemhazian attempts to {@action Trip|CRB} the triggering creature. On a success, the creature also takes damage as if the shemhazian had hit with a tail {@action Strike|CRB}, and if the creature was flying, it falls 30 feet.

abilities_active.name: Enfeebling Bite
entries: If the shemhazian’s jaws {@action Strike|CRB} damages a creature, the target is {@condition enfeebled} 3. The target can attempt a DC 37 Fortitude save to reduce this to {@condition enfeebled} 1 (or be unaffected on a critical success).

abilities_active.name: Focused Gaze
entries: The shemhazian focuses their gaze on a non-evil creature they can see within 30 feet. If that creature isn’t already {@condition slowed} by the shemhazian’s paralyzing gaze, it must attempt a save against the shemhazian’s paralyzing gaze. If that creature is {@condition slowed}, it must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round. A shemhazian can’t use this ability against the same creature more than once per round.

abilities_active.name: Rend
entries: A Rend entry lists a {@action Strike|CRB} the monster has. The monster automatically deals that {@action Strike|CRB}'s damage again to the enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.

attacks.name: jaws (evil, magical, reach 20 feet)
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d12+17} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and enfeebling bite

attacks.name: pincer (evil, magical, reach 20 feet)
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d8+17} bludgeoning plus {@dice 1d6} evil and Improved Grab

abilities_automatic.name: Commander’s Aura
entries: 100 feet. Commanded or allied evil creatures in the aura of lower level than the marilith gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

entries.Failure: Vulnerability A marilith’s pride feeds their strength, so the sting of failure wounds them. If the marilith uses a damaging spell or makes a {@action Strike|CRB} on their turn but doesn’t deal any damage that turn, they take {@dice 3d6+10} mental damage at the end of their turn and their commander’s aura deactivates until the end of their next turn.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Bladestorm
entries: The marilith makes up to six longsword Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the marilith’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks.

abilities_active.name: Defensive Assault
entries: The marilith makes two Strikes, each with a different weapon, and they use the remaining weapons for {@spell protection|CRB}. The demon gains a circumstance bonus to AC for 1 round equal to the number of weapons not used for attacks. If the marilith later uses any of those weapons to attack (including for an {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB}), the bonus to AC decreases by 1 for each weapon used.

abilities_active.name: Focused Assault
entries: The marilith attacks a single target with all the weapons they wield in their arms, overwhelming the target with multiple attacks and leaving almost nowhere to dodge. The demon makes a longsword {@action Strike|CRB}. On a successful attack, the marilith deals longsword damage to the target, plus an additional {@dice 1d8} damage for every longsword they wield beyond the first (typically {@dice 5d8} extra damage). Even on a failed attack, the marilith deals the damage from one longsword to the target, though they still miss completely on a critical failure. This counts toward the marilith’s multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of longswords the pride demon wields.

abilities_active.name: Greater Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC. A creature that fails this save falls {@condition unconscious}, and a creature that succeeds is then temporarily immune to falling {@condition unconscious} from Greater Constrict for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Infuse Weapons
entries: Any weapon becomes a +2 greater striking weapon made of cold iron and silver while a marilith wields it. The marilith can change its evil damage to chaotic whenever it attacks.

abilities_automatic.name: Aura of Flame
entries: 20 feet. A foe that starts its turn in the aura takes {@dice 3d6+10} fire damage, or {@dice 6d6+20} fire damage if the balor has {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} it. A creature that hits a balor with an unarmed {@action Strike|CRB} takes {@dice 3d6+10} fire damage, and weapons that hit a balor take {@dice 3d6+10} fire damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Death Throes
entries: When a balor dies, their body explodes in a 100-foot aura of intense demonic flame. All creatures and objects in range take {@dice 16d10} fire damage (DC 45 basic Reflex save). Because the flame is infused with Abyssal energy, creatures in the area apply only half their usual fire resistance. Creatures with immunity to fire use an outcome one degree of success better than what they rolled, instead of gaining the usual benefit of immunity. The bodies of creatures reduced to 0 Hit Points by a balor’s death throes are completely incinerated into fine ash.

abilities_active.name: Dimensional Dervish
entries: A balor can cast their 5th-level innate {@spell dimension door|CRB} with only a single action.

abilities_active.name: Dispelling Strike
abilities_active.trigger: The balor hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a weapon Strike.
entries: The balor casts an innate {@spell dispel magic|CRB} on the target of the triggering {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Infuse Weapons
entries: Any weapon a balor wields becomes a +3 major striking vorpal weapon made of cold iron and silver while the demon holds it. A weapon that isn’t eligible for the vorpal rune doesn’t gain its effects. The balor can change its evil damage to chaotic whenever it attacks. The demon can conjure a whip made of flames with an {@action Interact|CRB} action. This whip gains the same benefits as other weapons the balor wields.

abilities_active.name: Lifedrinker
abilities_active.trigger: The balor kills a living creature that is at least 15th level.
entries: The balor drinks the triggering creature’s life force and regains {@dice 10d8+80} Hit Points.

abilities_active.name: Whip Reposition
entries: When a balor grabs a creature with a whip {@action Strike|CRB}, they can move the creature to any space in the whip’s reach. The balor can move without ending the grab as long as the creature remains within the whip’s reach, and the balor can move the creature to any other space in the whip’s reach with an {@action Interact|CRB} action.

attacks.name: cold iron silver flame whip
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d6+17} fire plus {@dice 1d6} evil, Improved Grab, and whip reposition

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
entries: A dero stalker takes 4 damage for every hour they’re exposed to sunlight.

abilities_automatic.name: Nimble Dodge
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature targets the dero with an attack and the dero can see the attacker.
abilities_automatic.requirements: The dero stalker is not encumbered.
entries: The dero dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
entries: As dero stalker, but 8 damage.
entries_as_xyz: A dero stalker takes 4 damage for every hour they’re exposed to sunlight.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
entries: As dero stalker but 10 damage.

abilities_active.name: Cytillesh Stare
entries: The magister focuses their gaze on a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a DC 24 Will saving throw or be {@condition confused} for 1 round.

abilities_active.name: Subservience
entries: Lemures have little drive of their own, but other devils can take {@spell command|CRB} of them. A non-lemure devil can issue a {@spell command|CRB} to all lemures within 60 feet of it with a single action, which has the auditory and concentrate traits. The devil picks one of the following orders lemures can understand, and the lemures follow that order. The {@spell command|CRB} and its effects end once the commander is out of the lemure’s sight, a new {@spell command|CRB} is issued by the same or another devil, or the lemure dies.

items: {@bold Kill} The lemure attacks one target the commander singles out and gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against the target.
{@action Defend|CRB} The lemure circles the commander and attacks any creature that comes near. It gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saves.
{@bold Fetch} The lemure gains a +10–foot circumstance bonus to its Speed and attempts to get an object or person the commander singles out. It attacks anyone and anything that gets in the way.
{@bold Work} The lemure performs drudge work dictated by the commander.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Diabolic Healing
entries: The imp regains {@dice 1d6} Hit Points.

abilities_active.name: Infernal Temptation
entries: The imp offers a non‑fiend within 15 feet a bargain, granting a boon of good luck if the creature accepts. The boon lasts for 1 hour once accepted. If the creature dies while the boon is in place, its soul travels to Hell, where it is bound for eternity and unable to be raised or resurrected except by {@spell wish|CRB} or similar magic. Once during the hour, the creature can roll an attack roll or saving throw twice and use the higher result.

attacks.name: stinger
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4-1} piercing plus {@dice 1d4} evil and imp venom

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Infernal Wound
entries: A bearded devil’s glaive {@action Strike|CRB} also deals {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} that resists attempts to {@spell heal|CRB} it. The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at DC 20. The DC is reduced to 15 only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery.

The DC to {@action Administer First Aid|CRB} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5. A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to {@spell heal|CRB} the creature.

abilities_active.name: Reposition
abilities_active.trigger: The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike.
entries: The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil’s glaive. This movement doesn’t trigger reactions.

abilities_active.name: Wriggling Beard
entries: The barbazu makes a beard {@action Strike|CRB}. This {@action Strike|CRB} ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn’t count toward that penalty.

attacks.name: glaive
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d8+7} slashing plus {@dice 2d6} evil and infernal wound

abilities_active.name: Flames of Fury
entries: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a flaming rune while they hold it.

abilities_active.name: Furious Fusillade
entries: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a 30‑foot cone. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys’s multiple attack penalty.

abilities_active.name: Rope Snare
entries: An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for rope) that animates in their hands. When a creature is hit by the erinys’s rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10–foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium. When a creature Escapes the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

abilities_automatic.name: Ward Contract
entries: A signed contract carried by a living contract devil (including draped over its horns) is immune to damage from all creatures other than that contract devil. A contract devil is immune to mental effects that would make it destroy, nullify, or alter a contract.

abilities_active.name: Draft Contract
entries: The contract devil produces an infernal contract for a single living mortal. This contract can grant a wide range of abilities and effects, akin to the power of a {@spell wish|CRB} spell but fulfilled to the letter by the contract devil. To receive any of those benefits, the mortal must willingly sign its true name to the contract. At that point, the mortal’s soul is bound to the contract devil and Hell.

While the contract is in effect, the victim can’t be restored to life except by {@spell wish|CRB} or similar magic. If the mortal is restored to life by those means, the contract devil knows which mortal came to life and can {@spell locate|CRB} the creature or creatures who restored the mortal to life for 1 year, gaining the effects of a {@spell locate|CRB} spell with unlimited range. Avoiding the terms of an infernal contract is difficult and often dangerous.

abilities_active.name: Infernal Investment
entries: A contract devil can cast a 10th-level innate {@spell scrying|CRB} spell at will, but only to target a creature with which it has a contract. The target automatically critically fails its save.

abilities_active.name: Infernal Wound
entries: As barbazu, but the {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} is {@dice 3d6}, and the counteract DC to use healing magic is 29.
entries_as_xyz: A bearded devil’s glaive {@action Strike|CRB} also deals {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} that resists attempts to {@spell heal|CRB} it. The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at DC 20. The DC is reduced to 15 only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery.

The DC to {@action Administer First Aid|CRB} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5. A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to {@spell heal|CRB} the creature.

attacks.name: binding contract
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d6+11} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} evil, Grab, and infernal wound

abilities_automatic.name: Frightful Presence
entries: A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected by the presence.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

attacks.name: frost longspear
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+12} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} cold, {@dice 1d6} evil, and slowing frost

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d6+12} bludgeoning plus {@dice 2d6} cold, {@dice 1d6} evil, and slowing frost

abilities_automatic.name: Commander’s Aura
entries: 100 feet. Commanded or allied evil creatures in the aura of lower level than the pit fiend gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

abilities_automatic.name: Frightful Presence
entries: A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected by the presence.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Devil Shaping
entries: The pit fiend reshapes a large number of lemures within a 600-foot radius into more powerful devils to swell Hell’s legions. The pit fiend must have available the number of lemures listed on the table in the sidebar on page 92. The pit fiend can shape 100 lemures per day, to a maximum of 1,100 lemures in 11 days. Devils created in this way are in thrall to the pit fiend and follow its orders, with the exception of created pit fiends or other devils of similar power, which are always independent. As a result, few pit fiends choose to create peers. At the end of the Devil Shaping activity, the pit fiend attempts an incredibly hard Religion check of the desired devilʼs level, with results as follows.

entries.Critical Success: The pit fiend shapes two devils from the massed lemures instead of one.
entries.Success: The pit fiend shapes a devil of the desired type and level.
entries.Failure: The devil shaped from the lemures is 2 levels lower than the intended devil.
entries.Critical Failure: The pit fiend fails to shape any devils and draws the ire of an archdevil for its waste of resources.

abilities_active.name: Fast Swoop
entries: The pit fiend Flies and makes a wing {@action Strike|CRB} at any point during its movement.

abilities_active.name: Masterful Quickened Casting
entries: If the pit fiendʼs next action is to cast an 8th-level or lower innate spell, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d10+17} piercing plus {@dice 2d6} evil and pit fiend venom

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d10+17} bludgeoning plus {@dice 2d6} evil and Improved Grab

abilities_automatic.name: Stench
entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the emanation must attempt a DC 27 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened} 1, and on a critical failure is also {@condition slowed} 1. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune to this effect for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Root
entries: Until the next time it acts, the dezullon appears to be a normal pitcher plant. It has an automatic result of 41 (44 in forests or swamps) on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a non‑creature plant.

abilities_automatic.name: Blood of the Night
entries: The dhampir’s penalty and Hit Point reduction from the {@condition drained} condition are reduced as though the condition value were 1 lower.

abilities_active.name: Leaping Charge
entries: The velociraptor Strides up to 10 feet, ignoring difficult terrain as it leaps over obstacles. It then makes a {@action Strike|CRB} with its talons, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The velociraptor deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage to any creature that’s within reach of at least two of the velociraptor’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Darting Attack
entries: The deinonychus Strides up to 10 feet and then makes a {@action Strike|CRB}, or makes a {@action Strike|CRB} and then Strides up to 10 feet.

abilities_active.name: Predator’s Advantage
entries: Bleeding creatures are {@condition flat-footed} to the deinonychus.

abilities_active.name: Punishing Tail
entries: A creature struck by the ankylosaurus’s tail must attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save. On a failure, it’s {@condition slowed} 1 until the end of its next turn; on a critical failure, it’s {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_automatic.name: Dorsal Deflection
abilities_automatic.trigger: The stegosaurus is targeted with a melee attack.
entries: The stegosaurus leans its dorsal plates into the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the stegosaurus Steps after the attack.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_automatic.name: Frill Defense
abilities_automatic.trigger: The rider is targeted with an attack.
entries: Requirements A creature must be mounted on the triceratops. The triceratops intercepts the attack with its bony frill. The rider gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

abilities_active.name: Lumbering Charge
entries: The triceratops Strides up to 10 feet and then makes a {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Vicious Gore
entries: A triceratops deals {@dice 2d6} extra {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} to {@condition prone} targets it hits with its horns.

abilities_active.name: Tail Sweep
entries: The brontosaurus makes a tail {@action Strike|CRB} and compares the attack roll to the AC of up to three foes, each of whom must be within its tail’s melee reach and adjacent to at least one other target. It rolls damage only once and applies it to each creature hit. A Tail Sweep counts as two attacks for its multiple attack penalty.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Fling
abilities_active.requirements: A creature is Grabbed in the tyrannosaurus’s jaws.
entries: The tyrannosaurus flings the creature into the air up to 10 feet up from its mouth and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the tyrannosaurus flings it as high as it can) and takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a DC 23 basic Reflex save.

abilities_active.name: Pin Prey
abilities_active.trigger: The tyrannosaurus critically hits a Large or smaller foe with its foot.
entries: The creature struck by the foot is knocked {@condition prone} and the tyrannosaurus uses its foot to hold the creature in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn’t move from its position, the pinned creature is {@condition Grabbed}. A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner, but it cannot use Swallow Whole on the target unless it uses its jaws to Grab the victim first.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The dog’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the dog’s allies.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The dog’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the dog’s allies.

abilities_automatic.name: End the Charade
abilities_automatic.trigger: The doppelganger is transformed with Change Shape and another creature moves adjacent to it or takes a hostile action against it.
entries: The doppelganger reverts to its natural form and can make a {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the creature was unaware the doppelganger was in disguise, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this attack.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Dragon, Chromatic
entries: While there are many types of dragons, from the powerful planar dragons to the strange esoteric dragons, few dragon varieties are as well-known and as rightly feared as the chromatic dragons. Differentiated by the hue of their scales, each color of dragon unleashes its own flavor of murderous cruelty—be it by claw, tooth, or breath—and unlike most creatures, dragons only become more powerful as they age. Their lust for treasure, food, bloodshed, and control are legendary. Physically powerful with egos to match, these dragons are often morally depraved and act as criminal masterminds, vicious tyrants, or voracious raiders.

abilities_active.name: Shape-Changing Dragons
entries: Some dragons can take {@spell humanoid form|CRB}, allowing them to infiltrate settlements or influence others without revealing their true nature. They gain the following ability:

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Chromatic Dragon Spellcasters
entries: Each type of chromatic dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a chromatic dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon’s Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give it the spells outlined in its sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other arcane spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each level. You might also want to increase the dragon’s Intelligence or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect its mastery of magic.

abilities_active.name: Chromatic Dragons of Golarion
entries: The chromatic dragons that dwell around the Inner Sea region are cruel and sinister monsters who inspire as much {@spell fear|CRB} as reverence. These terrible beasts are no mere myth, however, but a very real threat to the people with whom they share their lands. Most dwell in the wild places of the world, and only the most brazen of them regularly meddle in mortal affairs. The dragons of Golarion believe that they are descended from two original beings, Apsu and Tiamat, and their rich mythology attempts to explain the origins of the age-old war between chromatic and metallic dragons.

entries: The dragon permanently befouls 10 cubic feet of liquid within 90 feet. The liquid becomes undrinkable and unable to support water-breathing life. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they’re of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a DC 28 Will save to protect liquids in its {@spell possession|CRB}). This doesn’t affect the liquids in a creature’s body.

entries: The dragon slams into the ground. It can do this if it’s on the ground or Flying within 10 feet of the ground. abilities_active.name: Dragon, Metallic
entries: Paragons of virtue, nobility, and grace, metallic dragons are benevolent entities revered as mythic beings akin to gods in both their power and majesty. Few have ever seen a metallic dragon firsthand, but tales of their intervention in mortals’ lives—and of their passing—always spread far and wide. Named for the way their scales resemble the shining metals humanoids use in commerce, warfare, and industry, these immense beings are diverse in their interests and abilities, and they don’t seem to mind being associated with such mundane materials. After all, to compare a gold dragon to a gold coin is like comparing an ocean to a glass of water—though they may seem similar at first glance, the raw power, breadth, and grandeur of one simply overwhelms the other.

In addition to metallic dragons and their chromatic counterparts (page 104–115), other types of dragons roam the world and the rest of the multiverse. In the legendary lands of Tian Xia on the other side of the globe are the imperial dragons, serpentine beings who protect the cosmic balance and defend their ancient homeland. Outside the Material Plane, primal dragons such as the domineering brine dragon and reclusive cloud dragon shape the nature and goings-on of the Elemental Planes. Countless other types of dragons are sure to exist, including dragons on far-flung planes of existence and, it is rumored, primeval dragons who soar between the stars.

abilities_active.name: Shape-Changing Dragons
entries: Some dragons can take {@spell humanoid form|CRB}, allowing them to infiltrate settlements or influence others without revealing their true nature. They gain the following ability:

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Metallic Dragon Spellcasters
entries: Each type of metallic dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that kind. To make a metallic dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon’s Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give it the spells outlined in its sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other arcane spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each level. You might also want to increase the dragon’s Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect its mastery of magic.

abilities_active.name: Metallic Dragons on Golarion
entries: Metallic dragons are found throughout the Inner Sea region, especially in pockets of wilderness where they can carve a hideout and then take action on political and social issues, both in their local area and on a wider scale. Their everlasting war with chromatic dragons keeps them in close proximity to their evil brethren; in regions where metallic and chromatic dragons’ territories intersect, humanoid settlements get caught in the crossfire, and villagers and city-dwellers alike rightfully {@spell fear|CRB} for their own safety.

Silver dragons lair in abundance around the cold wastes west of Mendev, as a consequence of the days when they joined thousands of crusaders who marched headlong into the demon-infested Worldwound. Bronze dragons are abundant in Taldor, and many copper dragons lair in the wilds of Andoran, where they wage war alongside other freedom fighters to overthrow devils in the neighboring empire of Cheliax. Perhaps the most extreme example of a metallic dragon taking part in human affairs is on the island nation of Hermea, where Mengkare—an ancient gold wyrm—has begun a grand social experiment he calls “the Glorious Endeavor.” Ostensibly intended to create a future utopia on Golarion, this highly controversial experiment is instead regarded by many as a cruel and unusual form of eugenics.

entries: Whenever the drakauthix takes at least 10 slashing damage, it releases a cloud of brown spores that has the effect of {@spell obscuring mist|CRB} for 1 minute, centered around the drakauthix. This cloud of spores does not move with the drakauthix, nor is it displaced by its movement.
