entries: The drow {@class fighter|CRB} draws a weapon using the {@action Interact|CRB} action, then Strikes with that weapon.

abilities_active.name: Skewer
entries: The drow {@class fighter|CRB} Strikes with its rapier, and gains a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. A creature damaged by the attack takes {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.

abilities_interactive.name: Light Blindness
entries: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in {@spell darkness|CRB}. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's {@condition dazzled}.

abilities_automatic.name: Nimble Dodge
abilities_automatic.trigger: The drow rogue is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the drow rogue can see.
abilities_automatic.requirements: A drow rogue can’t use this reaction while encumbered.
entries: The drow {@class rogue|CRB} gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack.

abilities_active.name: Quick Draw
entries: As drow {@class fighter|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_interactive.name: Light Blindness
entries: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in {@spell darkness|CRB}. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's {@condition dazzled}.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_automatic.name: Light Blindness
entries: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in {@spell darkness|CRB}. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's {@condition dazzled}.

abilities_active.name: Bola Bolt
entries: This shot deals no damage, but on a hit, the target must succeed at a DC 16 Reflex save or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition immobilized} until it is freed with a successful DC 15 check to {@action Escape|CRB}. This check can be attempted either by the target or a creature adjacent to the target.

abilities_interactive.name: Infused Items
entries: A duergar bombardier’s items listed as infused last for 24 hours, or until the next time they make their daily preparations.

abilities_automatic.name: Light Blindness
entries: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in {@spell darkness|CRB}. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's {@condition dazzled}.

abilities_active.name: Alchemical Formulas
entries: lesser acid flask, lesser {@class alchemist|CRB} fire, lesser {@spell tanglefoot|CRB} bag.

abilities_active.name: Far Lobber
entries: The duergar bombardier has a range increment of 30 feet with their bombs instead of 20 feet.

abilities_active.name: Quick Alchemy
entries: The duergar bombardier creates a single alchemical item from their formula book (see Alchemical Formulas). This item has the infused trait, but it remains potent only until the start of the duergar bombardier’s next turn.

abilities_active.name: Quick Bomber
entries: The duergar can use {@action Interact|CRB} to draw a bomb, then {@action Strike|CRB} with it.

abilities_automatic.name: Iron Mind
entries: Duergar taskmasters automatically disbelieve all illusions of 1st level or lower.

abilities_automatic.name: Light Blindness
entries: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in {@spell darkness|CRB}. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's {@condition dazzled}.

abilities_active.name: Take Them Down!
entries: The duergar taskmaster smashes their maul into the ground and invokes Droskar’s name to rally their allies to action. All allied duergars of equal or lower level that are within 20 feet of the duergar taskmaster gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the duergar taskmaster’s next turn.

abilities_automatic.name: Frightful Presence
entries: A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected by the presence.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Head Hunter
entries: Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes keen, and any hatchet it wields becomes returning. If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target. These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.

abilities_active.name: Reap
entries: The dullahan removes the head of a dead creature within reach. Each creature within the area of the dullahan’s frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.

abilities_active.name: Summon Steed
entries: The dullahan summons a warhorse (page 209) with elite adjustments (page 6) and the fiend trait. This steed remains until it is slain, the dullahan Dismisses it, or the dullahan summons another steed.

abilities_active.name: Eagle Dive
entries: The eagle Flies up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Evasion
entries: When a giant eagle rolls a success on a Reflex save, it gets a critical success instead.

abilities_active.name: Eagle Dive
entries: The giant eagle Flies up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Snatch
entries: A giant eagle can {@action Fly|CRB} at half Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in its talons, carrying that creature along with it.

abilities_active.name: Stunning Shock
entries: A creature critically hit by the electric eel’s tail must attempt a DC 17 Fortitude save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4+1} bludgeoning plus {@dice 1d4} electricity and stunning shock

abilities_automatic.name: Ambush
abilities_automatic.trigger: A target creature passes within 20 feet of the giant moray eel’s hiding place and has not detected the giant moray eel.
entries: The giant moray eel lunges out of its hiding place, Swims directly toward the triggering creature, and makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} against it. The target creature is {@condition flat-footed} to this attack.

abilities_active.name: Pharyngeal Jaws
abilities_active.requirements: The giant moray eel has a creature grabbed in its jaws.
entries: The giant moray eel uses its second set of jaws to pull the prey into its gullet. The eel deals {@dice 1d6+4} piercing damage to the {@condition grabbed} creature and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its Swallow Whole attempts and to the DC for the creature to {@action Escape|CRB}. This effect ends if the target Escapes or the giant moray eel Swallows it Whole.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Cinder Dispersal
abilities_automatic.trigger: The elananx takes damage from a hostile source.
entries: The elananx disperses into a cloud of smoke and cinders, filling its space and a 20-foot emanation. While in this form, the elananx can’t be attacked or targeted, and it doesn’t take up space. Anything inside this cloud is {@condition concealed}, and any creature ending its turn there takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage. At the start of its turn, the elananx returns to its normal form in any square the cloud covered. If the elananx Strikes a creature using its first action after returning to its normal form, the target is {@condition flat-footed} and the {@action Strike|CRB} deals an extra {@dice 1d6} fire damage.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The elananx’s Strikes deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of its allies.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The elananx Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the elananx began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the attack.

abilities_active.name: Elemental, Air
entries: Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes.

abilities_active.name: Circling Attack
entries: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn’t trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk’s multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes both attacks.

abilities_automatic.name: Disperse
abilities_automatic.trigger: The living whirlwind takes damage from a hostile action.
entries: The living whirlwind disperses. Until the end of the current turn, it can’t be attacked or targeted, doesn’t take up space, and any auras or emanations it has are suppressed. At the end of the turn, the living whirlwind reforms in any space in which it can fit within 25 feet of where it dispersed and any auras or emanations it has are restored as long as their duration didn’t run out while it was dispersed.

abilities_active.name: Swiftness
entries: The living whirlwind’s movement doesn’t trigger reactions.

abilities_automatic.name: Naturally Invisible
entries: The {@condition invisible} stalker is {@condition invisible} at all times, though when it takes a {@condition hostile} action of any kind, it is {@condition hidden} instead of {@condition undetected} until the start of its next turn, as the vague outline of its {@spell humanoid form|CRB} is faintly visible for a short period of time.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack

For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Swift Tracker
entries: The {@condition invisible} stalker moves at full Speed while Tracking.

abilities_automatic.name: High Winds
entries: 20 feet. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures that do not have the air trait.

A creature knocked into a solid object stops moving and takes {@dice 10d6} bludgeoning damage. The elemental hurricane can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is Pushed 40 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

abilities_active.name: Swiftness
entries: The elemental’s movement doesn’t trigger reactions.

abilities_active.name: Elemental, Earth
entries: Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

abilities_interactive.name: Crystal Sense
entries: A sod hound can sense crystals or gems within 60 feet as if using the scent ability.

abilities_active.name: Earth Glide
entries: The sod hound can {@action Burrow|CRB} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the sod hound moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

abilities_interactive.name: Earthbound
entries: When not touching solid ground, the living landslide is {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t use reactions.

abilities_automatic.name: Crumble
abilities_automatic.trigger: The living landslide takes damage from a hostile source while atop rock or earth.
entries: The living landslide crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 10 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions. The living landslide can’t Crumble again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

entries: Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the scorching Plane of Fire.

abilities_interactive.name: Smoke Vision
entries: The cinder rat ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.

entries: 5 feet. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn there must succeed at a DC 22 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened} 1. Everything within the aura, including the cinder rat, is {@condition concealed} by smoke.

entries: The salamander stokes its internal flames. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, and when an adjacent creature touches it or hits it with a physical attack, that creature takes {@dice 2d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage} unless it succeeds at a DC 25 Reflex save.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

entries: When the elemental inferno scores a critical hit, its body surges with blue flames, increasing the damage of its intense heat and Inferno {@action Leap|CRB} by {@dice 3d6} until the start of its next turn.

abilities_active.name: Inferno Leap
entries: The elemental inferno jumps horizontally and vertically with a maximum height and distance each equal to its Speed. Its intense heat is suppressed until the end of the {@spell jump|CRB}. At any point during the {@spell jump|CRB}, flames explode from the elemental in a 30-foot emanation, dealing {@dice 12d6} fire damage to each creature within the area (DC 30 basic Reflex save). The elemental inferno can’t Inferno {@action Leap|CRB} again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Elemental, Mephit
entries: Mephits—sometimes known as elemental scamps—are little bipedal critters with bat-like wings who serve stronger elementals on the Elemental Planes or neophyte spellcasters who summon them to the Material Plane. All mephits have an inkling of magical power as well as a breath weapon.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The air mephit breathes sand and grit in a 15-foot cone that deals {@dice 2d6} slashing damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The air mephit can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The earth mephit breathes rocks in a 15-foot cone that deals {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The earth mephit can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_interactive.name: Smoke Vision
entries: The fire mephit ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The fire mephit breathes flames in a 15-foot cone that deals {@dice 2d4} fire and {@dice 1d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage} to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The fire mephit can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The water mephit breathes acid in a 15-foot cone that deals {@dice 2d6} acid damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The water mephit can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Drench
entries: The water mephit puts out all fires in a 5-foot emanation. The mephit extinguishes all non‑magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires (+7 counteract modifier).

abilities_active.name: Elemental, Water
entries: Water elementals can be very destructive, but often not intentionally so; just as water can bring life to those in need on the Material Plane, its waves can pound shores and rains can flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

abilities_active.name: Deep Plunge
entries: The brine shark dives straight down into the water, moving up to twice its swim Speed in a straight vertical line. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.

abilities_interactive.name: Water-Bound

entries: The mammoth makes two tusk Strikes, each against a different creature. This counts as one attack for the mammoth’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after both attacks.

abilities_active.name: Grabbing Trunk
entries: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the elephant’s trunk is {@condition grabbed}. If the elephant moves, it can bring the {@condition grabbed} creature along with it.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Ethereal Step
entries: The ether spider shifts to either the Ethereal Plane or the Material Plane. The ether spider can remain on the Ethereal Plane indefinitely without ill effect. While there, it can see clearly onto the Material Plane with a range of 60 feet. On its first round in an encounter, the ether spider can use this ability once as a free action.

abilities_active.name: Ethereal Web Trap
entries: A creature hit by the ether spider’s {@spell web|CRB} attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface ({@action Escape|CRB} DC 22).

abilities_active.name: Web Burst
entries: The ether spider flings a gout of stored webs in a 30-foot cone. These webs can pass between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. Each creature in the area is {@condition immobilized}, as ethereal {@spell web|CRB} trap, unless it succeeds at a DC 22 Reflex save.

attacks.name: fangs
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d10+7} piercing plus ether spider venom and Grab

abilities_interactive.name: Independent Brains
entries: Each of an ettin’s heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can {@action Delay|CRB}. At the start of a head’s turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls one of the ettin’s arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever an ettin’s head (such as the vorpal weapon property) doesn’t cause the ettin to die if it still has its other head, but does cause it to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of the ettin’s heads.
Items flail (2)

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The dragon breathes euphoric gas in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or become {@condition stupefied} 2 and {@condition slowed} 1 for {@dice 1d4} rounds; on a critical failure, the duration is 1 minute. The faerie dragon can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: Disgusting Demise
entries: When the grothlut is reduced to 0 Hit Points, its digestive organs rupture, unleashing alchemical acid and poison upon all creatures in a 30-foot emanation. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 19 Fortitude save or take {@dice 2d6} acid damage and become {@condition sickened} 1 (double damage and {@condition sickened} 2 on a critical failure).

abilities_automatic.name: Piteous Moan
entries: 60 feet. Each non-grothlut creature that enters or starts its turn within the area must succeed at a DC 17 Will saving throw or become {@condition sickened} 1 ({@condition sickened} 2 on a critical failure). The creature then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute. The grothlut can activate or deactivate the aura by using a single free action that has the concentrate trait. A grothlut usually does not begin moaning until it senses the presence of a non-grothlut creature, and it usually stops once it doesn’t sense any more such creatures.

attacks.name: digestive spew
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d6} acid damage plus {@dice 1d6} splash acid damage

abilities_active.name: Web Trap
entries: A creature hit by a drider’s {@spell web|CRB} attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface ({@action Escape|CRB} DC 21).

abilities_automatic.name: Quick Capture
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature hits or touches the flytrap.
entries: The flytrap makes a leaf {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is {@condition grabbed} in that leaf.

abilities_active.name: Focused Assault
entries: The flytrap attacks a single target with both its leaves. The flytrap makes one leaf {@action Strike|CRB}. On a success, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf {@action Strike|CRB} plus an additional {@dice 1d8} damage for every leaf beyond the first. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf {@action Strike|CRB}, but it can’t use Improved Grab. It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the flytrap’s multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of leaves the flytrap has.

abilities_active.name: Hungry Flurry
entries: The flytrap makes two leaf Strikes at a –2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes all its attacks.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

attacks.name: leaf
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d8+2} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} acid and Improved Grab

abilities_automatic.name: Clawed Feet
abilities_automatic.trigger: The gargoyle is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it.
entries: The gargoyle makes a claw {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.

abilities_active.name: Statue
entries: Until the next time it acts, the gargoyle appears to be a statue. It has an automatic result of 32 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

languages: one elemental language (Aquan, Auran, Ignan, or Terran)
one planar language (Abyssal, Celestial, or Infernal)

abilities_automatic.name: Elemental Endurance
entries: A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which it takes 1 damage per hour until it leaves or dies.

abilities_active.name: Change Size
entries: The janni changes a creature’s size. This works as a 4th-level {@spell enlarge|CRB} or {@spell shrink|CRB} spell but can target an unwilling creature (DC 21 Fortitude save negates).

abilities_automatic.name: Whirlwind
entries: 20 feet. All squares in the djinni’s aura are difficult terrain for Striding and Flying creatures. Creatures with the air trait are immune.

abilities_active.name: Hurricane Blast
entries: The djinni all creatures in its whirlwind pushes back 20 feet, or forces all creatures in the aura to move 20 feet clockwise or counterclockwise. Each creature must attempt a DC 21 Fortitude save. On a success, it avoids being moved, and on a critical failure it falls {@condition prone} in addition to being moved. Creatures with the air trait are immune.

abilities_active.name: Earth Glide
entries: The shaitan can {@action Burrow|CRB} through dirt and stone at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

abilities_active.name: Shove into Stone
entries: When the shaitan Pushes a creature into a stone barrier, the target must succeed at a DC 22 Reflex save or become merged with the barrier (as meld with stone). The victim can attempt to {@action Escape|CRB} (DC 28).

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4+12} bludgeoning plus Push 10 feet and shove into stone

abilities_active.name: Elemental Planes, or Material
entries: Plane only) 5th {@spell illusory object|CRB}; 4th {@spell gaseous form|CRB}, {@spell invisibility|CRB} (×2); Cantrips (5th) {@spell produce flame|CRB}; Constant (5th) {@spell detect magic|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Burning Grasp
entries: When the efreeti grabs a creature, that creature takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage, and takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains {@condition grabbed}.

abilities_active.name: Change Size
entries: as janni (DC 29).

abilities_active.name: Combat Grab
abilities_active.requirements: The efreeti has one hand free.
entries: The efreeti makes a melee {@action Strike|CRB} while keeping one hand free. If the {@action Strike|CRB} hits, the target is {@condition grabbed} in the efreeti’s free hand.

abilities_automatic.name: Vortex
entries: 40 feet. Water in the aura that is also in the same body of water as the marid is difficult terrain for Swimming creatures. Creatures with the water trait are immune.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Rush of Water
entries: The marid releases a jet of water in a 60-foot line, dealing {@dice 9d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed 10 feet (20 feet on a critical failure). The marid can’t use Rush of Water again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Skewer
entries: The marid makes a trident {@action Strike|CRB}, dealing an extra {@dice 2d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} on a hit ({@dice 4d6} on a critical hit).

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

abilities_automatic.name: Rejuvenation
entries: Setting right the injustice that led to the commonerʼs death allows it to move on to the afterlife.

abilities_active.name: Frightful Moan
entries: DC 21.

entries: {@dice 6d6} bludgeoning, DC 29.

entries: Skills Athletics +19, Intimidation +11 Str +6, Dex +0, Con +4, Int –2, Wis +2, Cha +0 Items greatclub, hide armor, sack with 5 rocks.

abilities_automatic.name: Catch Rock
entries: The monster gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack or to any defense against the falling rock. If the attack misses or the monster successfully defends against the falling rock, the monster catches the rock, takes no damage, and is now holding the rock.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is targeted with a thrown rock Strike or a rock would fall on the monster.
abilities_automatic.requirements: The monster must have a free hand but can Release anything it's holding as part of this reaction.

abilities_active.name: Throw Rock
entries: The monster picks up a rock within reach or retrieves a stowed rock and throws it, making a ranged {@action Strike|CRB}.

entries: The frost giant breathes out a 15-foot cone of freezing moisture that quickly condenses into ice, dealing {@dice 4d6} cold damage. Each creature in the cone must attempt a DC 28 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is also {@condition immobilized} and takes {@dice 2d6} cold damage at the end of each of its turns until it gets free ({@action Escape|CRB} DC 28). The giant can’t use Chill Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Ice Stride
entries: A frost giant isn’t impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor does it need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

entries: The cloud giant Strikes a creature with its ranseur, surrounded in a roar of rushing air. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@dice 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. Whether or not the {@action Strike|CRB} hits, each non-cloud giant within a 20-foot emanation, including the target of the {@action Strike|CRB}, is buffeted by roaring winds and must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude saving throw.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature takes {@dice 4d8} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but double damage and also knocked {@condition prone}.

abilities_active.name: Command Giants
entries: When a rune giant casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 39, rather than 35.

abilities_active.name: Demand
entries: When a rune giant casts its innate {@spell sending|CRB} spell, it can also cast {@spell suggestion|CRB} on the target.

abilities_active.name: Flashing Runes
abilities_active.trigger: The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell.
entries: The runes on the giant’s body flash as they produce magical energy. Each creature within a 10-foot emanation must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

abilities_active.name: Invoke Rune
entries: The rune giant invokes one of the runes on its body, causing the rune to spray forth a 30-foot cone of sparks that deals {@dice 6d12} electricity damage to all creatures in the cone (DC 37 basic Reflex save)

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant’s choice. The giant can’t use Invoke Rune again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

items: {@bold Rune of Destruction} The weapon gains the deadly trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is {@condition drained} 1 unless it succeeds at a DC 35 Fortitude save.
{@bold Rune of Flames} The weapon deals an additional {@dice 3d6} fire damage on all attacks.
{@bold Rune of Smiting} When the weapon hits, the giant can Push the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.

abilities_active.name: Throw Rock
entries: The monster picks up a rock within reach or retrieves a stowed rock and throws it, making a ranged {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Wide Swing
entries: The rune giant makes a single greatsword {@action Strike|CRB} and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant’s multiple attack penalty.

abilities_automatic.name: Gibbering
entries: Each creature that begins its turn within 60 feet of a gibbering mouther must attempt a DC 19 Will save. On a failure, they are {@condition confused} for 1 round. On a success, they are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: All-Around Vision
entries: This monster can see in all directions simultaneously, and therefore can't be flanked.

abilities_automatic.name: Reactive Gnaw
abilities_automatic.trigger: An adjacent creature deals the gibbering mouther slashing damage.
entries: The gibbering mouther’s wound opens into another maw. It makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.

abilities_active.name: Burn Eyes
entries: A creature that takes damage from a gibbering mouther’s spittle must succeed at a DC 22 Fortitude save or be {@condition dazzled} for 1 round (or {@condition blinded} for 1 round on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Engulf
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of any creatures in its path. Any creature of the monster's size or smaller whose space the monster moves through can attempt a Reflex save with the listed DC to avoid being engulfed. A creature unable to act automatically critically fails this save. If a creature succeeds at its save, it can choose to be either pushed aside (out of the monster's path) or pushed in front of the monster to the end of the monster's movement. The monster can attempt to Engulf the same creature only once in a single use of Engulf. The monster can contain as many creatures as can fit in its space.

A creature that fails its save is pulled into the monster's body. It is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The creature takes the listed amount of damage when first engulfed and at the end of each of its turns while it's engulfed. An engulfed creature can get free by Escaping against the listed escape DC. An engulfed creature can attack the monster engulfing it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either method can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.
If the monster dies, all creatures it has engulfed are automatically released as the monster's form loses cohesion.

abilities_active.name: Ground Manipulation
entries: The gibbering mouther causes stone and earth under its body to grow soft and muddy, remaining so for 1 minute after the mouther moves off the location. A gibbering mouther can move through these areas with ease, but other creatures treat them as difficult terrain.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+5} piercing plus {@dice 1d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} and Grab

abilities_interactive.name: Hungersense
entries: Hungersense allows the gimmerling to sense creatures that require food to live.

abilities_automatic.name: Treacherous Aura
entries: 15 feet. Tangled roots, jagged divots, sharp rocks and other hazards appear on surfaces in the aura, creating difficult terrain.

abilities_automatic.name: Trip Up
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature critically fails a melee attack to hit the gimmerling or moves into a space within the gimmerling’s treacherous aura.
entries: The triggering creature must attempt a DC 32 Reflex save.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected.
entries.Success: The target is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.
entries.Failure: The target takes {@dice 2d10} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Disarm
abilities_active.requirements: The gimmerling’s last action was a success with a Strike that has Disarm in its damage entry.
entries: The gimmerling knocks a held or carried weapon to the ground in the target’s space.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Trickster’s Step
entries: The gimmerling ignores difficult terrain and doesn’t trigger traps with its movement.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: A gnoll hunter deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage to any creature that’s within reach of at least two of the gnoll hunter’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Rugged Travel
entries: A gnoll ignores the first square of difficult terrain it moves into each time it Steps or Strides.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: A gnoll hunter deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage to any creature that’s within reach of at least two of the gnoll hunter’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Rugged Travel
entries: A gnoll ignores the first square of difficult terrain it moves into each time it Steps or Strides.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Bark Orders
entries: The gnoll sergeant commands its allies to reposition. Any allies who hear and understand this order can use a reaction to {@action Step|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: A gnoll hunter deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage to any creature that’s within reach of at least two of the gnoll hunter’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Rugged Travel
entries: A gnoll ignores the first square of difficult terrain it moves into each time it Steps or Strides.

abilities_automatic.name: Goblin Scuttle
abilities_automatic.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the warrior.
entries: The goblin warrior Steps.

abilities_automatic.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: The goblin warrior Steps.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the warrior.

abilities_automatic.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: The goblin warrior Steps.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the warrior.

abilities_automatic.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: The goblin warrior Steps.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the warrior.

abilities_active.name: Goblin Song
entries: The war chanter sings annoying goblin songs, distracting foes with silly and repetitive lyrics. The chanter attempts a Performance check against the Will DCs of up to two enemies within 30 feet. This has the usual traits and restrictions for a Performance check.

entries.Critical Success: The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute.
entries.Success: As critical success, but the target is affected for only 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is temporarily immune to Goblin Song for 1 hour.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.

abilities_automatic.name: Irritating Dander
entries: A creature that hits the goblin dog with an unarmed attack, tries to {@action Grapple|CRB} it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to {@spell goblin pox|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Juke
abilities_automatic.trigger: The rider issues a command to the goblin dog.
abilities_automatic.requirements: A creature must be mounted on the goblin dog.
entries: The goblin dog Steps before following the {@spell command|CRB}.

entries.name: Goblin Pox
entries.note: Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to goblin pox.

stages.entry: sickened 2 and can’t reduce its sickened value below 1 .

abilities_active.name: Scratch
entries: The goblin dog vigorously scratches itself, exposing all adjacent creatures to {@spell goblin pox|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Skittering Reposition
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature that starts its move outside the gogiteth’s reach moves into its reach.
entries: The gogiteth moves 10 feet. This does not trigger reactions.

abilities_active.name: Carry Off Prey
entries: The gogiteth can move at its full Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} in its jaws, bringing the {@condition grabbed} creature along.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Skittering Assault
entries: The gogiteth Strides three times. Once per {@action Stride|CRB}, it can attempt a leg {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature in its reach at any point during the {@action Stride|CRB}; it must make each attack against a different creature, but it doesn’t apply its multiple attack penalty until after making all its Strikes. If any of the Strikes result in a critical failure, Skittering Assault ends.

abilities_automatic.name: Berserk
entries: A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

abilities_automatic.name: Golem
entries: Antimagic harmed by fire ({@dice 5d8}, {@dice 3d4} from areas or {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage}); healed by electricity (area {@dice 2d4} HP); {@condition slowed} by cold.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
entries: Casting a {@spell flesh to stone|CRB} spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

abilities_automatic.name: Electric Reflexes
abilities_automatic.trigger: The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.
entries: The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to {@action Grapple|CRB} an adjacent creature. The creature also takes {@dice 3d6} electricity damage on a success, or {@dice 6d6} electricity damage on a critical success.

abilities_active.name: Berserk Slam
abilities_active.requirements: The flesh golem is berserk.
entries: The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a –1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals {@dice 1d6} extra damage and knocks the target {@condition prone}.

abilities_automatic.name: Alchemical Chambers
entries: An alchemical golem’s body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll {@dice 1d6} and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no alchemical effect): 1 acid damage; 2 cold damage; 3 electricity damage; 4 fire damage; 5 poison damage; 6 sickness: DC 26 Fortitude save or {@condition sickened} 1 ({@condition sickened} 2 on a critical failure)

abilities_automatic.name: Alchemical Rupture
entries: When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a {@spell shatter|CRB} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a 5-foot emanation. Roll on the alchemical chambers list (see above) to determine which one shatters—on a roll of 1–5, creatures in the area take {@dice 10d6} damage of the appropriate type (DC 28 basic Reflex). On a roll of 6, creatures must instead save against the sickness effect.

abilities_automatic.name: Golem
entries: Antimagic harmed by sonic ({@dice 5d8}, {@dice 2d6} from areas or {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage}); healed by acid (area {@dice 2d4} HP); {@condition slowed} by cold.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
entries: Casting a {@spell shatter|CRB} spell on an alchemical golem affects the golem normally, but also causes an alchemical rupture (see above).

abilities_active.name: Alchemical Injection
entries: When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe {@action Strike|CRB}, roll {@dice 1d6} on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack. The syringe deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage of the appropriate type (or exposes the target to the sickness effect, as appropriate).

abilities_active.name: Generate Bomb
entries: The golem fills an empty vial from one of its alchemical chambers to create a bomb and then makes a bomb {@action Strike|CRB}. Determine the type of bomb created by rolling {@dice 1d6} on the alchemical chambers list above. On a roll of 1–4, it creates the corresponding greater alchemical bomb: an acid flask from chamber 1, a frost vial from chamber 2, bottled lightning from chamber 3, or {@class alchemist|CRB}’s fire from chamber 4. On a roll of 5, it creates a poisonous bomb that deals {@dice 3d10} poison damage and 3 poison splash damage with no other effects. On a roll of 6, it creates a sickness bomb, which exposes the target and all creatures in the splash radius to the sickness effect; creatures hit by only the splash receive a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude saves.

abilities_automatic.name: Berserk
entries: A severely damaged clay golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 50 or fewer Hit Points at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

abilities_automatic.name: Golem
entries: Antimagic harmed by cold and water ({@dice 5d10}, {@dice 2d6} from areas or {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage}); healed by acid (area {@dice 2d6} HP); {@condition slowed} by earth.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Disintegrate
entries: A {@spell disintegrate|CRB} spell affects the golem but deals half the normal amount of damage and causes the golem to become {@condition slowed} 2 for 1 round.

abilities_automatic.name: Quicken
abilities_automatic.trigger: The clay golem’s turn begins.
entries: It can’t trigger this free action on the first turn of combat. The clay golem becomes {@condition quickened} for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Berserk Slam
abilities_active.requirements: The golem is berserk.
entries: The clay golem Strikes with its fist at a –1 circumstance penalty. If its {@action Strike|CRB} hits, the clay golem deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage and knocks the target {@condition prone}.

abilities_active.name: Cursed Wound
entries: A creature hit by the clay golem’s fist must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be cursed until healed to its maximum HP. The cursed creature can’t regain HP except via magic, and anyone casting a spell to {@spell heal|CRB} the creature must succeed at a DC 29 counteract check or the healing has no effect. The golem’s counteract level is equal to its creature level.

abilities_automatic.name: Golem
entries: Antimagic harmed by cold and water ({@dice 5d10}, {@dice 2d8} from areas and {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage}); healed by acid (area {@dice 2d8} HP); {@condition slowed} by earth.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh
entries: A {@spell stone to flesh|CRB} spell negates the golem’s golem antimagic and its resistance to physical damage for 1 round. A {@spell flesh to stone|CRB} spell reverses this effect immediately.

abilities_active.name: Impose Paralysis
abilities_active.trigger: The stone golem hits a slowed creature.
entries: The creature must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.

abilities_active.name: Inexorable March
entries: The stone golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 34 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise it is damaged as if hit by the golem’s fist.

abilities_active.name: Slowing Pulse
entries: Each creature in a 10-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or be {@condition slowed} 1 for 1 minute. The golem can’t use Slowing Pulse again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: Golem
entries: Antimagic harmed by acid ({@dice 6d10}, {@dice 2d8} from areas and {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage}); healed by fire (area {@dice 2d8} HP); {@condition slowed} by electricity.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
entries: Casting {@spell neutralize poison|CRB} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Rust
entries: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster’s antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a 10-foot radius centered on the corner of one of the iron golem’s squares. The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem’s poison. The golem can’t use its Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Inexorable March
entries: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 37 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem’s fist.

entries.name: Iron Golem Poison
entries.note: Any drained value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

abilities_automatic.name: Golem
entries: Antimagic harmed by acid ({@dice 9d10}, {@dice 2d10} from areas or {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage}); healed by fire (area {@dice 2d10} HP); {@condition slowed} by electricity.

abilities_automatic.name: Repair Mode
entries: When the adamantine golem is at 0 HP, it isn’t destroyed. Instead, it enters repair mode, during which it is {@condition slowed} 1, can’t take reactions, and can take only the Self-{@action Repair|CRB} action. Once it has more than 30 HP, it can use any type of action and can use reactions, though it remains {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t take any reactions until the start of its next turn. If a critical hit with an adamantine vorpal weapon reduces the golem to 0 HP, or if such a weapon hits it while it’s already at 0 HP, then the golem is destroyed.

abilities_automatic.name: Vulnerable to Dispelling
entries: The golem can be targeted by {@spell disjunction|CRB} and {@spell dispel magic|CRB}. If targeted by such a spell of 9th level or higher, the golem has its resistance to physical damage lowered to 15 and is {@condition slowed} 1 (or {@condition slowed} 2 if in repair mode) for {@dice 1d4} rounds. During this time, if the golem is reduced to 0 HP while already in repair mode, it is destroyed.

abilities_active.name: Destructive Strike
entries: On a critical hit, the adamantine golem’s fist {@action Strike|CRB} breaks the target’s armor, if any, in addition to dealing damage to the target. If the target has a shield raised, the golem breaks the shield instead.

abilities_active.name: Inexorable March
entries: The adamantine golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can try to bar the way by attempting a DC 45 Fortitude save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature takes no damage and its armor takes no damage.
entries.Success: The golem halts its movement and cannot enter the creature’s square.
entries.Failure: The resisting creature is damaged and its armor takes damage as if hit by the adamantine golem’s fist.

abilities_active.name: Self-Repair
entries: The golem repairs itself, regaining 30 Hit Points.

abilities_active.name: Vent
entries: The golem vents a 30-foot cone of superheated steam from its internal forge. This deals {@dice 15d6} fire damage to all creatures in the cone (DC 40 basic Reflex). The golem can't use Vent again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.

abilities_interactive.name: Self-Loathing
entries: A mitflit’s self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a –4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to {@action Coerce|CRB}, {@action Demoralize|CRB}, {@action Make an Impression|CRB}, and {@action Request|CRB}.

abilities_interactive.name: Vermin Empathy
entries: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to {@action Make an Impression|CRB} on and {@action Request|CRB} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of {@condition indifferent} to mitflits.
Items dart (10), shortsword.

abilities_active.name: Vengeful Anger
entries: As long as it isn’t {@condition frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

abilities_automatic.name: Unluck Aura
entries: 20 feet. Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and gnolls in the aura become extremely unlucky (DC 16 Will save; creature must roll this Will save twice and take the worse result). On a successful save, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it is within the aura.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Tinker
entries: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it’s also unobtrusive and can be performed while Hiding. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (DC 5 flat check or waste any action to {@action Interact|CRB} with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

abilities_active.name: Flying Strafe
entries: The griffon Flies up to its fly Speed and makes two talon Strikes at any point during that movement. Each {@action Strike|CRB} must target a different creature. The attacks take the normal multiple attack penalty.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The griffon Strides and makes a talon {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the griffon began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the attack.

abilities_interactive.name: Implant Core
entries: The grikkitog implants its core into an adjacent section of earth or stone, melding seamlessly and changing its visual appearance to match the surrounding rock. It’s {@condition immobilized} but automatically succeeds at its Deception check to Impersonate the stone around it; creatures actively searching for it can still attempt Perception checks against its Deception DC as normal. A grikkitog can release its implantation as a free action, which has the manipulate trait. A grikkitog’s infestation aura and manifold vision are only active while implanted.

abilities_interactive.name: Manifold Vision
entries: While its core is implanted, the grikkitog can see through the eyes it creates throughout the area of its infestation aura, gaining the benefits of all-around vision.

abilities_automatic.name: Infestation Aura
entries: 120 feet. While its core is implanted, a grikkitog infests all earth and stone within 120 feet, as long as there is a contiguous physical connection between the earth, including stone objects touching on the ground. This effect spreads even if the grikkitog does not have line of effect, though it can affect earth or stone on the surface and exposed to the air only if at least part of its core is exposed as well. Within the aura, it can grow maws and eyes everywhere. It can make jaws attacks against any creature, originating from any earth or stone in the aura adjacent to that creature. Determine cover from the origin point of the attack, not from the grikkitog’s core.

abilities_active.name: Barbed Maw Upon
entries: Striking a creature with its jaws, the grikkitog can extend its barbed teeth, immobilizing the target unless it succeeds at a DC 34 Reflex save. While {@condition immobilized}, the victim takes {@dice 3d8} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} and the grikkitog feeds upon its flesh. The creature is {@condition immobilized} until the grikkitog ends the effect as a free action or the target succeeds at a DC 38 check to {@action Escape|CRB}. The grikkitog can immobilize any number of creatures with these maws.

abilities_active.name: Earth Glide
entries: The grikkitog can {@action Burrow|CRB} through dirt and stone at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

abilities_interactive.name: Death’s Grace
entries: The grim reaper can choose whether or not it counts as undead for effects that affect undead differently. Even if it does not count as undead, the grim reaper still never counts as a living creature.

abilities_interactive.name: Status Sight
entries: The grim reaper automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and emotions of all creatures it can see.

abilities_automatic.name: Aura of Misfortune
entries: 20 feet. Living creatures in the aura must roll twice on all d20 rolls and use the lower result.

abilities_automatic.name: Negative Healing
entries: The grim reaper can choose whether or not it takes positive damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Lurking Death
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within 100 feet makes a ranged attack or uses an action that has the concentrate, manipulate, or move trait.
entries: The grim reaper teleports to a square adjacent to the triggering creature and makes a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against it. If the {@action Strike|CRB} hits, the grim reaper disrupts the triggering action.

abilities_active.name: Death Strike
entries: A creature critically hit by any of the grim reaper’s attacks or that critically fails against any of its spells must succeed at a DC 47 Fortitude save or die.

abilities_active.name: Energy Drain
entries: When the grim reaper hits and deals damage with its scythe, it regains 20 Hit Points, and the target must succeed at a DC 43 Fortitude save or become {@condition doomed} 1. If the target is already {@condition doomed}, the {@condition doomed} value increases by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition doomed} 3).

abilities_active.name: Final Death
entries: A creature killed by the grim reaper can’t be brought back to life by any means short of divine intervention.

abilities_active.name: Infuse Weapon
entries: Any scythe gains the agile trait, can’t be disarmed, and becomes a +3 major striking keen scythe while the grim reaper wields it. If the grim reaper Strikes a creature with a weakness to any specific type of damage, the scythe’s damage counts as that type of damage, in addition to slashing.

attacks.name: keen scythe
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d10+23} slashing plus death strike and energy drain

abilities_interactive.name: Death’s Grace
entries: The grim reaper can choose whether or not it counts as undead for effects that affect undead differently. Even if it does not count as undead, the grim reaper still never counts as a living creature.

abilities_interactive.name: Status Sight
entries: The grim reaper automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and emotions of all creatures it can see.

saving_throws.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

abilities_automatic.name: Aura of Misfortune
entries: 20 feet. Living creatures in the aura must roll twice on all d20 rolls and use the lower result.

abilities_automatic.name: Negative Healing
entries: A lesser death can choose whether or not it takes positive damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Lurking Death
entries: As grim reaper, except the triggering creature must be within 60 feet.

abilities_active.name: Infuse Weapon
entries: Any scythe gains the agile trait, can’t be disarmed, and becomes a +2 greater striking keen scythe while the lesser death wields it.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Eerie Flexibility
entries: Despite its size, the gug’s multiple joints allow it to fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed.

abilities_active.name: Furious Claws
entries: The gug makes up to four claw Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward the gug’s multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after the gug makes all its attacks.

abilities_active.name: Rend
entries: A Rend entry lists a {@action Strike|CRB} the monster has. The monster automatically deals that {@action Strike|CRB}'s damage again to the enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.

abilities_automatic.name: Erosion Aura
entries: 120 feet. The guthallath erodes away the physical integrity of all around it. Creatures and objects in the emanation other than the guthallath have their hardness and resistances reduced by 10. At the start of its turn, a creature in the erosion aura's area takes {@dice 6d6} bludgeoning damage (basic Fortitude DC 39).

abilities_automatic.name: Immunity to Magic
entries: The guthallath is immune to spells of lower than 7th level and the activated effects of magic items of lower than 14th level.

abilities_active.name: Annihilation Beams
entries: A guthallath releases two beams of destruction from its eyes. Each beam is a 120-foot line. Everything in either line takes the effect of a hit from a 10th-level {@spell disintegrate|CRB} spell (DC 41 Fortitude). There is no additional effect on creatures in any area where the beams overlap. The guthallath can’t use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Deadly Throw
abilities_active.requirements: The guthallath has a creature grabbed.
entries: The guthallath throws the creature into the air, 100 feet high and 50 feet away. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a DC 41 basic Reflex save.

abilities_active.name: Powerful Blows
entries: If a guthallath hits with an attack and rolls a natural 19 on the d20 roll, the attack is a critical hit. This has no effect if the 19 would be a failure.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d12+18} bludgeoning plus Improved Grab or Improved Push 20 feet

abilities_interactive.name: Coven
entries: This monster can form a coven with two or more other creatures who also have the coven ability. This involves performing an 8-hour ceremony with all prospective coven members. After the coven is formed, each of its members gains elite adjustments (page 6), adjusting their levels accordingly. Coven members can sense other members' locations and conditions by spending a single action, which has the concentrate trait, and can sense what another coven member is sensing as a two-action activity, which has the concentrate trait as well.

Covens also grant spells and rituals to their members, but these can be cast only in cooperation between three coven members who are all within 30 feet of one another. A coven member can contribute to a coven spell with a single-action spellcasting activity that has a single verbal component. If two coven members have contributed these actions within the last round, a third member can cast a coven spell on her turn by spending the normal spellcasting actions. A coven can cast its coven spells an unlimited number of times but can cast only one coven spell each round. All covens grant the 8th-level {@spell baleful polymorph|CRB} spell and all the following spells, which the coven can cast at any level up to 5th: {@spell augury|CRB}, {@spell charm|CRB}, {@spell clairaudience|CRB}, {@spell clairvoyance|CRB}, {@spell dream message|CRB}, {@spell illusory disguise|CRB}, {@spell illusory scene|CRB}, {@spell prying eye|CRB}, and {@spell talking corpse|CRB}. Individual creatures with the coven ability also grant additional spells to any coven they join. A coven can also cast the control weather ritual (Core Rulebook 411), with a DC of 23 instead of the standard DC.

If a coven member leaving the coven or the death of a coven member brings the coven below three members, the remaining members keep their elite adjustments for 24 hours, but without enough members to contribute the necessary actions, they can't cast coven spells.

abilities_interactive.name: Sea Hag’s Bargain
entries: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality—such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice—in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.

saving_throws.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

abilities_active.name: Dread Gaze
entries: The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 20). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

entries.Critical Success: No effect.
entries.Failure: {@condition Frightened} 1 and {@condition slowed} 1 for 1 round. If the target was {@condition dying}, it remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.
entries.Critical Failure: {@condition Frightened} 2 and {@condition slowed} 1 for 1 minute. If the target was {@condition dying}, it remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

saving_throws.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

abilities_automatic.name: Sound Imitation
entries: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to {@action Lie|CRB} can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

abilities_active.name: Betraying Touch
entries: The green hag touches a creature that doesn’t realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag’s enfeebling humors and takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Enfeebling Humors
entries: A creature damaged by a hag’s claw must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or be {@condition enfeebled} 1 for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it’s {@condition enfeebled} 2 for 1 day.

abilities_active.name: Exhale Miasma
entries: The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a 15-foot cone is affected by her enfeebling humors (attempting a save as normal). She can’t use Exhale Miasma again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

saving_throws.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

abilities_active.name: Bonds of Iron
entries: Once per day, an annis hag can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to {@action Grapple|CRB} against the target’s Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, the annis hag gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal {@action Grapple|CRB}, the annis hag doesn’t need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Rend
entries: A Rend entry lists a {@action Strike|CRB} the monster has. The monster automatically deals that {@action Strike|CRB}'s damage again to the enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.

After the coven is formed, each of its members gains elite adjustments (page 6), adjusting their levels accordingly.
