abilities_interactive.name: Nightmare Rider
entries: When a night hag rides a {@spell nightmare|CRB} (page 244), the {@spell nightmare|CRB} also gains the night hag’s status bonus to saves against magic, and both the hag and rider benefit when the night hag uses her heartstone’s {@spell ethereal jaunt|CRB} innate spell.

saving_throws.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, –2 to all saves if the night hag does not have her heartstone

entries.name: Abyssal Plague
entries.note: A creature can’t recover from drained until abyssal plague is cured.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Dream Haunting
entries: If a night hag is ethereal and hovering over a sleeping chaotic or evil creature, she can ride the victim’s back until dawn. The creature endures tormenting dreams as the hag casts {@spell nightmare|CRB} on it, and is exposed to {@spell abyssal plague|CRB}. Any {@condition drained} caused by dream haunting is cumulative. Only an ethereal being can confront the night hag and stop her dream haunting.

abilities_active.name: Spell Ambush
entries: A creature {@condition flat-footed} to the night hag takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+8} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} evil and {@spell Abyssal plague|CRB}

abilities_active.name: Captivating Song
entries: The harpy cries out an eerie, compelling melody. Each non-harpy creature within a 300-foot aura must attempt a DC 21 Will save to avoid becoming captivated by the harpy’s song. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the harpy uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Captivating Song, that creature is temporarily immune to Captivating Songs for 24 hours.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the harpy as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If a captivated creature is adjacent to the harpy, it stays still and doesn’t act. If attacked by the harpy, the creature is freed from captivation at the end of the harpy’s turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but if attacked by the harpy, the creature can attempt a new save at the start of its next turn, rather than being freed at the end of the harpy’s turn.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The hell hound breathes flames that deal {@dice 4d6} fire damage to all creatures in a 15-foot cone (DC 19 basic Reflex save). The hell hound can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.

abilities_automatic.name: Hellish Revenge
abilities_automatic.trigger: The Nessian warhound is critically hit by any Strike.
entries: The Nessian warhound’s Breath Weapon recharges. It can immediately use it as part of this reaction.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The warhound breathes flames that deal {@dice 10d6} fire damage to all creatures in a 15-foot cone (DC 28 basic Reflex save.) The warhound can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. If the Nessian warhound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_automatic.name: Formation
entries: When it’s adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

abilities_automatic.name: Formation
entries: When it’s adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

abilities_active.name: Crossbow Precision
entries: [The first time the archer hits with a crossbow attack in a round, it deals {@dice 1d8} extra precision damage.

abilities_active.name: Perfect Aim
entries: The hobgoblin archer ignores the {@condition concealed} condition. Their targets don’t benefit from lesser cover, and they reduce the AC bonus from standard cover by 2 against the hobgoblin archer’s attack.

abilities_active.name: Running Reload
entries: The archer Strides, Steps, or Sneaks, then Interacts to reload.

abilities_interactive.name: General’s Cry
entries: When a hobgoblin general rolls initiative, as long as they can perceive at least one foe, they can yell a mighty battle cry. The hobgoblin general attempts an Intimidate check to {@action Demoralize|CRB} a single foe within 60 feet as a free action. If successful, any ally with the goblin trait can, as its first action on its first turn of the combat, {@action Stride|CRB} up to double its speed as a single action.

abilities_automatic.name: Formation
entries: When it’s adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

abilities_active.name: Polearm Critical Specialization
entries: On a critical hit, the target of the critical hit is moved 5 feet in a direction of the hobgoblin general’s choice.

abilities_interactive.name: Master Link
entries: A homunculus can’t speak, but it is telepathically linked to its creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master’s knowledge and everything the homunculus hears. The range of this link is 1,500 feet. The homunculus adopts the same alignment as its creator and is utterly faithful. If the homunculus is destroyed, the master takes {@dice 2d10} mental damage. If the master is slain, the homunculus becomes mindless, claims its current location as its lair, and instinctively attacks anyone who comes near.

entries.name: Homunculus Poison
entries.note: A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an Interact action.

abilities_active.name: Horse
entries: Horses serve as mounts and beasts of burden in many societies. They are loyal and typically gentle creatures, and they are invaluable to those looking to travel long distances. Smaller folk, like gnomes and halflings, often utilize ponies as mounts, while horses are the favored steeds for humans and other Medium humanoids. Most horses that the average humanoid encounters are domesticated, though large herds of these powerful animals can be found in the wild.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.

abilities_active.name: Gallop
entries: The riding pony Strides twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.

This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Head Regrowth
entries: A hydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra’s heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head’s Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature’s turn.

A hydra can regrow a severed head using Hydra Regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target acid or fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra’s whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all five heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

abilities_automatic.name: Hydra Regeneration
entries: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 × the number of heads it has. If a hydra’s body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a DC 25 Fortitude save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra’s regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

abilities_automatic.name: Multiple Opportunities
entries: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It can’t use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB} it makes. Whenever one of the hydra’s heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

abilities_active.name: Focused Assault
entries: The hydra attacks a single target with its heads, overwhelming its foe with multiple attacks and leaving almost nowhere to dodge. The hydra Strikes with its fangs. On a successful attack, the hydra deals damage from its fangs {@action Strike|CRB} to the target, plus an additional {@dice 1d6} damage for every head it has beyond the first. Even on a failed attack, the hydra deals the damage from one fangs {@action Strike|CRB} to the target creature, though it still misses completely on a critical failure. This counts toward the hydra’s multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of heads the hydra has.

abilities_active.name: Storm of Jaws
entries: The hydra makes a number of Strikes up to its number of heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the hydra’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after the hydra makes all its attacks.

abilities_active.name: Drag
entries: The hyena makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} against a {@condition prone} enemy. If it hits, in addition to dealing damage, the hyena Strides up to 10 feet, dragging the enemy along.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The hyena deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage to any creature that’s within reach of at least two of the hyena’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Bonecrunching Bite
entries: A creature that is critically hit by a hyaenodon must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become {@condition wounded} 1 as the creature’s bones or cartilage are crushed by the beast’s jaws.

abilities_active.name: Drag
entries: The hyena makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} against a {@condition prone} enemy. If it hits, in addition to dealing damage, the hyena Strides up to 10 feet, dragging the enemy along.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The hyaenodon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the hyaenodon’s allies.

“WE ARE DRAGONS!” Kobolds consider themselves scions of dragonkind, and they are extremely proud of this purported heritage, no matter how laughable other creatures might consider these claims. Despite such skepticism, kobolds share more than a superficial resemblance to true dragons, with scale colorations closely matching the colors seen among chromatic dragonkind. Some kobolds develop a strong propensity toward powerful draconic magic and manifest these chromatic traits with more intensity. These so-called dragon mages are highly respected by other kobolds, and often rise to leadership positions within the tribe.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d10+5} piercing plus Knockdown and bonecrunching bite

abilities_active.name: Hurried Retreat
abilities_active.requirements: The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.
entries: The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that’s not adjacent to any enemy.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Hurried Retreat
entries: The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that’s not adjacent to any enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_automatic.name: Dragonscaled
entries: A kobold dragon mage’s resistance depends on the color of its scales: Black acid 5, Blue electricity 5, Green poison 5, Red fire 5, White cold 5.

abilities_active.name: Illusory Retreat
abilities_active.requirements: The kobold dragon mage is adjacent to at least one enemy.
entries: The dragon mage creates an illusion of itself in its square and then becomes {@condition invisible} (with the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell) for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The dragon mage can move up to half its Speed, but it must end its movement in a space that’s not adjacent to any enemies. This is a 1st-level spell that requires a somatic component.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_automatic.name: Altered Weather
entries: A kraken reshapes the weather within 2 miles of it, with the effect of the control weather ritual centered on the kraken and based on its emotional state, at the GM’s discretion. If the kraken dies, the weather returns to normal immediately.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Double Attack
entries: The kraken makes two Strikes with two different arms or tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. Double Attack counts as two attacks toward the kraken’s multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after both attacks are made. If the kraken subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Double Attack.

abilities_active.name: Ink Cloud
entries: The kraken emits a cloud of black, venomous ink in an 80-foot emanation. This cloud has no effect outside water. Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to kraken ink poison and are {@condition undetected} while inside the cloud. The kraken can’t use Ink Cloud again for {@dice 2d6} rounds, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Jet
entries: The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.

entries.name: Kraken Ink
entries.note: Krakens are immune to this poison.

saving_throws.abilities: +4 status to all saves vs. fear

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Pain Frenzy
entries: Whenever the krooth is damaged by a critical hit, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of its next turn. It can’t use reactions while this frenzy lasts.

abilities_active.name: Aquatic Ambush
entries: The monster moves up to its swim Speed + 10 feet toward the triggering creature, traveling on water and on land. Once the creature is in reach, the monster makes a {@action Strike|CRB} against it. The creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster is hiding in water and a creature that hasn't detected it is within the listed number of feet.

abilities_active.name: Poison Tooth
abilities_active.requirements: The krooth damaged a creature with its jaws on its most recent action this turn.
entries: The krooth snaps off one of its teeth in the creature it hit. The creature takes {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} and is {@condition drained} 1. Neither can be healed while the tooth remains. Removing the tooth safely requires a successful DC 26 check to {@action Administer First Aid|CRB}. Instead of ending bleeding or stabilizing, this removes the {@condition drained} condition, but it doesn’t automatically end the bleed damage.

abilities_active.name: Lamia’s Caress
entries: The lamia touches a creature, who must succeed at a DC 23 Will save or become {@condition stupefied} 1. If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition stupefied} 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Dervish Strike
entries: The lamia matriarch makes a scimitar attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch’s caress.

abilities_active.name: Matriarch’s Caress
entries: As Lamia’s Caress, but DC 28, and the creature is {@condition stupefied} 2 (or has its existing {@condition stupefied} increased by 2) if it critically fails.
abilities_active.entries_as_xyz: Ability not found: 'Matriarch’s Caress As Lamia’s Caress, but DC 28, and the creature is {@condition stupefied} 2 (or has its existing {@condition stupefied} increased by 2) if it critically fails.' in Lamia Matriarch, p.217

abilities_automatic.name: Verdant Burst
entries: When a leaf leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring {@dice 1d4} Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area is filled with tree saplings, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these trees, they wither after 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Deafening Blow
entries: When a leaf leshy hits with its seedpod {@action Strike|CRB}, the target must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The target is {@condition deafened} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Glide
entries: The leshy glides gently through the air, moving 5 feet toward the ground and up to 25 feet forward. As long as the leshy spends at least 1 action gliding each round, it remains in the air at the end of each turn. For the purpose of determining damage from falls, a leaf leshy always treats falls as if they were 20 feet shorter.

abilities_interactive.name: Keepsake
entries: The leshy can store an item of light Bulk or less in its head, concealing it as {@spell nondetection|CRB}. If stored for 24 hours, the item benefits from {@spell mending|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Verdant Burst
entries: As leaf leshy, except plants regain {@dice 1d8} Hit Points and the area sprouts gourds instead of tree saplings.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Ensnare
entries: When the gourd leshy damages a creature with a fist or seed {@action Strike|CRB}, vines lash out from the leshy (or seed) and wrap around the target’s limbs. The target must attempt a DC 17 Reflex save. On a failure, the target takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round; on a critical failure, the target is {@condition immobilized} for 1 round and the penalty to Speed lasts for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: Verdant Burst
entries: As leaf leshy, except only fungi are healed, they regain {@dice 2d8} Hit Points, and the area sprouts fungi.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Spore Cloud
entries: A fungus leshy can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a 15-foot emanation. Each creature must succeed at a DC 16 Fortitude save or take 1 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent poison damage}. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage} continues and can see only within 20 feet (or 10 feet, on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Spores
entries: A creature that takes damage from a fungus leshy’s spore pod {@action Strike|CRB} must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

abilities_automatic.name: Frightful Presence
entries: A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected by the presence.

abilities_automatic.name: Counterspell
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature casts a spell the lich has prepared.
entries: The lich expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature’s casting of that same spell. The lich loses its spell slot as if it had cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

abilities_active.name: Drain Phylactery
entries: 6th level.

abilities_active.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: DC 32.

abilities_active.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: If a reaction would disrupt the lich’s spellcasting action, the lich attempts a DC 15 flat check. On a success, the action isn’t disrupted.

abilities_interactive.name: Torpor
entries: Typically, a demilich is inert when encountered and doesn’t take actions until its {@spell contingency|CRB} reaction has been triggered (see below).

abilities_automatic.name: Telekinetic Whirlwind
entries: 20 feet. Telekinetic whirlwind activates when the demilich ends torpor. Loose debris in the area whip up into a whirling storm. This obscures vision, making any creature in the area {@condition concealed}, and causes creatures in its area (except the demilich) to treat all creatures as {@condition concealed}. Any creature other than the demilich that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes {@dice 2d12} bludgeoning damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Contingency
abilities_automatic.trigger: While the lich is in torpor, a creature disturbs the demilich’s remains, touches its treasure, or casts a spell that would affect the demilich.
entries: A demilich has one permanent 8th-level {@spell contingency|CRB} spell in effect with one of its arcane innate spells of 5th level or lower as the companion spell—typically {@spell dimension door|CRB}. Trigger While the lich is in torpor, a creature disturbs the demilich’s remains, touches its treasure, or casts a spell that would affect the demilich. The demilich ends torpor, rolls initiative, and gains the effect of its {@spell contingency|CRB}’s companion spell. The {@spell contingency|CRB} resets after 24 hours.

abilities_automatic.name: Countermeasures
abilities_automatic.trigger: The demilich’s turn begins.
entries: The demilich casts {@spell blink|CRB}, fly, {@spell spell turning|CRB}, or {@spell true seeing|CRB} on itself. It usually chooses {@spell spell turning|CRB} unless it already has that spell in effect.

abilities_active.name: Demilich Eye Gems
entries: A demilich has gemstone eyes that glow when the demilich is active. Each eye contains an 8th-level spell that targets one creature (usually one eye has {@spell maze|CRB} and the other {@spell polar ray|CRB}). The demilich can Activate an eye. This uses the number of spellcasting actions the spell requires, and also requires {@spell command|CRB} and envision components. When the demilich casts a spell from a gemstone eye, that eye stops glowing for {@dice 1d4} rounds, during which time that eye’s spell can’t be used. Occasionally, one or both of the two demilich eye gems can be harvested from a destroyed demilich as magic items (see below).

abilities_active.name: Devour Soul
abilities_active.requirements: A soul has been trapped in one of the demilich’s blight quartz gems (see Trap Soul) for 24 hours.
entries: The demilich consumes the soul. The soul is utterly destroyed, and the demilich regains HP equal to double the creature’s level.

abilities_active.name: Mental Magic
entries: A demilich can replace all material and somatic components for casting spells with verbal components, and can replace all {@action Interact|CRB} components for activating magic items with envision components.

abilities_active.name: Staff Gems
entries: A demilich long ago absorbed the spells from a staff into gemstone nodules embedded in its skull, with larger nodules representing higher-level spells. It can cast any of the spells as though it were Activating the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 8 charges. A typical demilich has the spells from a greater staff of necromancy, but it could have spells from another staff of 8th level or lower instead.

abilities_active.name: Trap Soul
entries: Ten blight quartz gemstones on the demilich’s skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts {@spell bind soul|CRB}. This {@spell bind soul|CRB} can target and affect a {@condition dying} creature instead of a corpse. The {@condition dying} creature can attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save; if it succeeds, it doesn’t die and its soul is not trapped but it’s enervated 2 (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature’s body swiftly turns to dust.

The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in {@spell bind soul|CRB}, except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. The demilich can Devour a Soul it has trapped.

abilities_automatic.name: Curse of Fire
entries: When a creature slays a crag linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 35 Will save or permanently gain weakness to fire 15.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The crag linnorm breathes out a stream of magma in a 120-foot line that deals {@dice 12d6} fire damage to creatures within the area (DC 34 basic Reflex save). Any creature that fails its save also takes {@dice 4d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}. The crag linnorm can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The magma remains until the start of the linnorm's next turn. If the linnorm was on the ground, the magma remains as a burning line on the ground directly under the line of the Breath Weapon, and if the linnorm was airborne, the magma rains downward in a sheet 60 feet high. Any creature that moves across or through the magma takes {@dice 6d6} fire damage (DC 34 basic Reflex save). At the start of the linnorm's next turn, the magma cools to a thin layer of brittle stone on the ground, or the magma rain finishes falling and turns to harmless pebbles. The cooled magma quickly degrades to powder and sand over the course of several hours.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_automatic.name: Curse of Frost
entries: When a creature slays an ice linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or permanently gain weakness to cold 15.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The ice linnorm spews out a blast of freezing, viscous ooze in a 60-foot cone that deals {@dice 15d6} cold damage to creatures within the area (DC 38 basic Reflex save). The freezing ooze clings to those struck and hardens into thick sheets of ice. A creature that fails the saving throw is {@condition immobilized} by the ice until it succeeds at a check to {@action Escape|CRB} or it or an ally Forces Open the ice (DC 34 for either case). At the start of its turn, a creature still {@condition immobilized} by the ice takes {@dice 4d6} cold damage. Another creature can free a frozen target by dealing a total of 20 fire damage to the frozen target. Left unattended, the ice crumbles away in 1 minute on its own. Creatures with the fire trait can't be frozen in place by this breath weapon. Flying creatures fall if frozen, and swimming creatures that are frozen rise toward the surface of the water at a speed of 60 feet per round. An ice linnorm can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_automatic.name: Curse of Death
entries: When a creature slays a tarn linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or it can no longer recover Hit Points via any means, such as healing spells, the Medicine skill, or natural healing from rest.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The tarn linnorm can expel either a 120-foot line or a 60-foot cone of acid dealing {@dice 20d6} acid damage to creatures within the area (DC 44 basic Reflex save). The acid creates toxic fumes. At the beginning of the linnorm’s next turn, those who failed the breath weapon’s Reflex save must succeed at a DC 42 Fortitude save or gain {@condition sickened} 4 from the poisonous fumes. A tarn linnorm can’t use Breath Weapon or Overwhelming Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Double Bite
entries: The tarn linnorm Strides and then makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} with each of its heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the tarn linnorm’s multiple attack penalty, and the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after the tarn linnorm makes all of these attacks.

abilities_active.name: Overwhelming Breath
entries: A tarn linnorm uses its Breath Weapon twice. A creature attempts only one save and can take damage only once. The tarn linnorm can’t use Breath Weapon or Overwhelming Breath again for {@dice 2d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: Curse of Boiling Blood
entries: When a creature slays a tor linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 48 Will save or permanently gain weakness to fire 20 and {@condition slowed} 1 from the agonizing pain it now endures at all times. As long as a character continues to suffer this curse, its {@condition slowed} condition can never be reduced below {@condition slowed} 1.

abilities_automatic.name: Lava Affinity
entries: A tor linnorm can breathe and swim freely while submerged in lava and magma.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The tor linnorm expels a 60-foot cone of flame and ash dealing {@dice 20d6} fire damage to creatures within the area (DC 46 basic Reflex save). At the start of the tor linnorm’s next turn, the area affected by the breath weapon is covered in thick, scorching smoke that burns both the lungs and eyes, dealing an additional {@dice 10d6} fire damage to all creatures in the area (DC 46 basic Reflex save). A creature that spends an entire round in the smoke with open eyes must succeed at a DC 44 Fortitude save or is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. The smoke dissipates after 1 minute; in strong winds, the smoke dissipates in 5 rounds, and in more powerful winds, it may clear even more quickly. The tor linnorm can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Slashing Claws
entries: A tor linnorm makes four Strikes with its claws, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the tor linnorm’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after the tor linnorm makes all its attacks.

abilities_interactive.name: Uncanny Climber
entries: A giant gecko’s feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a giant gecko attempts an Athletics check to climb and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.

abilities_automatic.name: Gnashing Grip
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature grabbed by the giant monitor lizard’s jaws fails a check to Escape.
entries: The giant monitor lizard’s jaws deal {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and the triggering creature is exposed to monitor lizard venom.

abilities_active.name: Lurching Charge
entries: The giant monitor lizard Strides twice and then makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB}. If the lizard moved at least 20 feet away from its starting position, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this attack roll.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d10+3} piercing plus Grab and monitor lizard venom

abilities_active.name: Intimidating Display
entries: The giant frilled lizard Strides. If it ends that {@action Stride|CRB} adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition frightened} 2 (or {@condition frightened} 3 on a critical failure). The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_active.name: Deep Breath
entries: A lizardfolk defender can hold their breath for 175 rounds (17-1/2 minutes).

abilities_active.name: Terrain Advantage
entries: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are {@condition flat-footed} to the lizardfolk defender.

creature.name: Lizardfolk Scout
items: blowgun (10 darts, 1 of which is coated with giant centipede venom)

abilities_active.name: Deep Breath
entries: As lizardfolk defender, but 150 rounds (15 minutes).
entries_as_xyz: A lizardfolk defender can hold their breath for 175 rounds (17-1/2 minutes).

abilities_active.name: Hidden Movement
entries: If the lizardfolk scout starts its turn {@condition undetected} by a creature or {@condition hidden} from it, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the scout’s attacks until the end of the scout's turn.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Terrain Advantage
entries: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are {@condition flat-footed} to the lizardfolk defender.

abilities_active.name: Deep Breath
entries: As lizardfolk defender, but 200 rounds (20 minutes).
entries_as_xyz: A lizardfolk defender can hold their breath for 175 rounds (17-1/2 minutes).

abilities_active.name: Spike Volley
entries: The manticore flings up to two spikes from its tail, targeting either two different creatures or a single creature. If the manticore targets two different creatures, these creatures must be within 20 feet of one another, and the manticore makes a separate {@action Strike|CRB} against each; this counts as only one {@action Strike|CRB} for the manticore’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after both attacks. If the manticore fires both spikes at the same creature, it makes a single {@action Strike|CRB}. If the attack hits, it deals the damage of a single spike, but the target is pinned in place, rendering it {@condition immobilized}. A creature that succeeds at a DC 23 Athletics check (attempted as a single action) can pull the spike free.
A manticore can hurl no more than 12 spikes in 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Mantis, Giant
entries: These monstrously oversized insects are silent predators with lightning-quick forelegs and a bone-breaking bite.

abilities_active.name: Deadly Mandibles
abilities_active.trigger: The giant mantis Grabs a creature with its leg.
entries: The mantis pulls the creature adjacent to it, then makes a mandibles {@action Strike|CRB} against the creature.

abilities_active.name: Lunging Strike
entries: The giant mantis lunges forward, making a leg {@action Strike|CRB} with an extended reach of 20 feet.

abilities_active.name: Sudden Strike
entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven’t acted are {@condition flat-footed} to the giant mantis.

abilities_active.name: Fling
entries: The deadly mantis flings a {@condition grabbed} creature into the air, up to 30 feet overhead and up to 30 feet away from the mantis (the creature takes damage from the fall as normal). If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a DC 31 basic Reflex save.

abilities_active.name: Leaping Grab
entries: The mantis Leaps up to 40 feet vertically and 20 feet horizontally. At any point during the {@spell jump|CRB}, it can make a leg {@action Strike|CRB}. If it hits, it automatically Grabs the target, bringing the creature along until the end of the {@spell jump|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Rending Mandibles
entries: The mantis makes a mandibles {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature it has {@condition grabbed}. If that {@action Strike|CRB} hits and the creature is wearing armor with Hardness 12 or lower, the armor is {@condition broken}. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn’t further damage armor that’s already {@condition broken}.

abilities_active.name: Sudden Strike
entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven’t acted are {@condition flat-footed} to the giant mantis.

abilities_automatic.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 25 Fortitude save. If the creature fails, it becomes {@condition slowed} 1 for 1 minute. The medusa can deactivate or activate this aura by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

abilities_automatic.name: Biting Snakes
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature ends its turn adjacent to the medusa.
entries: The medusa makes a snake fangs {@action Strike|CRB} against the creature.

abilities_active.name: Focus Gaze
entries: The medusa fixes their glare at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Fortitude save against the medusa's petrifying gaze. If the creature was already {@condition slowed} by petrifying gaze before attempting its save, a failed save causes it to be {@condition petrified} permanently. After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the medusa's next turn.

abilities_active.name: Aquatic Dash
entries: The merfolk warrior swims and attacks in one of two patterns. They either {@action Swim|CRB} twice and {@action Strike|CRB} one opponent at the end of their movement, or {@action Swim|CRB} once and {@action Strike|CRB} at any point during their movement.

abilities_active.name: Hydraulic Asphyxiation
abilities_active.requirements: The target is fully submerged in water, within 30 feet of the merfolk wavecaller, and holding its breath.
entries: The merfolk wavecaller commands the tides to crush their foe’s throat, rooting the target in place and forcing it to choke up precious air. The target must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or become {@condition immobilized} for 1 round and immediately lose {@dice 1d4} actions' worth of air (or twice that on a critical failure).

abilities_automatic.name: Adhesive
entries: The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a DC 23 Reflex save or become {@condition grabbed} ({@action Escape|CRB} DC 23). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful DC 23 Athletics check (made as a single action). A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.

abilities_automatic.name: Object Lesson
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.
entries: The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic’s adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod {@action Strike|CRB} against any creature adjacent to the mimic. Object Lesson can’t be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.

abilities_active.name: Mimic Object
entries: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn’t change the mimic’s texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 28 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.

abilities_interactive.name: Natural Cunning
entries: A minotaur automatically critically succeeds at Survival checks to avoid becoming lost or to find its way, including those from the {@spell maze|CRB} spell.

abilities_active.name: Axe Swipe
entries: The minotaur swings its axe in a wide arc, making greataxe Strikes against any two foes who are adjacent to each other and within the minotaur’s reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

abilities_active.name: Hunted Fear
entries: The minotaur snorts and clomps as it hunts its prey, inspiring terror. The minotaur makes an Intimidation check to {@action Demoralize|CRB} all living creatures within 60 feet that can hear the minotaur but not see it. Roll once and apply the result to all creatures. If the targets are in a {@spell maze|CRB} or similarly difficult-to-navigate structure, the minotaur gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. Creatures that become {@condition frightened} as a result also take a –2 circumstance penalty to Survival checks to avoid getting lost for 1 minute. This use of {@action Demoralize|CRB} doesn't have the visual trait. Each target is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Powerful Charge
entries: The minotaur Strides twice, then makes a horn {@action Strike|CRB}. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the {@action Strike|CRB}’s damage is increased to {@dice 2d8+10}.

abilities_interactive.name: Windsense
entries: The mu spore senses vibrations in the air through its aerial spores.

abilities_automatic.name: Enormous
entries: A mu spore is a massive creature and takes up a space of 10 squares by 10 squares (50 feet by 50 feet).

abilities_automatic.name: Spores
entries: 60 feet. A living creature that enters the area or ends its turn within it is corrupted by spores. It must succeed at a DC 42 Fortitude save or be {@condition clumsy} 1, {@condition enfeebled} 1, and {@condition slowed} 1 for 1 round. Fungi and plants are immune.

abilities_automatic.name: Grasping Tendrils
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within 10 feet of the mu spore moves or attacks the mu spore.
entries: The spore uses Grab on the triggering creature. There is no limit to how many creatures it can grab with the sticky tendrils that cover its body.

abilities_active.name: Cough Spores
entries: The mu spore releases a cloud of burrowing spores in a 400-foot cone. The spores deal {@dice 22d6} piercing damage to all creatures, objects, and wooden structures in the area, but not to plants or fungi (DC 46 basic Reflex save). The mu spore can’t use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Enormous Inhalation
entries: The mu spore pulls all creatures and objects in a 400-foot cone 400 feet toward its mouth. A successful DC 43 Fortitude save halves the distance, or avoids the pull on a critical success. The mu spore automatically attempts to Swallow Whole each creature adjacent to it at the end of the inhalation.

abilities_active.name: Fast Swallow
abilities_active.trigger: The mu spore Grabs a creature with its jaws.
entries: The spore uses Swallow Whole.

abilities_active.name: Greater Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC. A creature that fails this save falls {@condition unconscious}, and a creature that succeeds is then temporarily immune to falling {@condition unconscious} from Greater Constrict for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Overpowering Jaws
entries: The mu spore still deals 18 piercing damage if its jaws {@action Strike|CRB} is a failure (but not on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Partitioned Anatomy
abilities_automatic.trigger: The mukradi would be confused, paralyzed, slowed, or stunned.
entries: The mukradi confines the debilitating effect to a certain portion of its nervous system, ignoring the effect but causing a maw of its choice to go dormant for the effect’s duration. That maw can’t be used for a {@action Strike|CRB} or Breath Weapon during that time. This ability can’t be used if all the mukradi’s heads are dormant.

abilities_automatic.name: Spitting Rage
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature scores a critical hit on the mukradi.
entries: The mukradi’s Breath Weapon recharges. It can use its Breath Weapon immediately as part of this reaction. It canʼt use this reaction again until it recharges its Breath Weapon naturally.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The mukradi breathes a blast of energy from one of its three heads; each creature in the area must attempt a DC 36 basic Reflex save. The mukradi can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items: {@bold Acid Maw} (acid) 10-foot-wide, 60-foot line of acid dealing {@dice 16d6} acid damage.
{@bold Flame Maw} (fire) 60-foot cone of fire dealing {@dice 16d6} fire damage.
{@bold Shock Maw} (electricity) 120-foot line of electricity dealing {@dice 16d6} electricity damage.

abilities_active.name: Pull Apart
entries: The mukradi makes two Strikes with different maws against the same target. If both hit, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d12+13} slashing damage, with a DC 36 basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the creature is torn to pieces and dies. The mukradiʼs multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.

abilities_active.name: Thrash
entries: The mukradi Strikes once against each creature in its reach. It can {@action Strike|CRB} up to once with each maw, once with its tail lash, and any number of times with its legs. Each attack takes a –2 circumstance penalty and counts toward the mukradi's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks are made.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_automatic.name: Despair
entries: 30 feet. Living creatures are {@condition frightened} 1 while in a mummy guardian’s despair aura. They can’t naturally recover from this {@spell fear|CRB} while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a DC 22 Will save (after taking the penalty from being {@condition frightened}) or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

entries.name: Mummy Rot
entries.note: This disease and any damage from it can’t be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by mummy rot turns to dust and can’t be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic.

abilities_automatic.name: Great Despair
entries: 30 feet. As the mummy guardian’s despair, except the DC is 26 and the paralysis lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When a mummy pharaoh is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild its body in its tomb over {@dice 1d10} days. If the re‑forming body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. A slain mummy pharaoh can be destroyed for good with a consecrate ritual.

abilities_automatic.name: Undead Mastery
entries: 100 feet. Commanded or allied undead in the aura that have a lower level than the mummy pharaoh gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Channel Rot
entries: The mummy pharaoh can deliver insidious mummy rot through melee weapons it wields.

entries.name: Insidious Mummy Rot
entries.note: This disease and any damage from it can’t be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by insidious mummy rot turns to sand and can’t be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic.

abilities_active.name: Sandstorm Wrath
entries: The mummy pharaoh exhales a 60-foot cone of superheated sand that deals {@dice 5d6} fire and {@dice 5d6} slashing damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). The mummy pharaoh can’t use Sandstorm Wrath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_automatic.name: Guarded Thoughts
entries: Dark nagas are immune to any form of {@spell mind reading|CRB}.

stages.entry: unconscious with no Perception check to wake up

abilities_interactive.name: Smoke
entries: 15 feet. The {@spell nightmare|CRB} continually exhales black smoke that creates concealment in an aura around it. Nightmares and their riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes {@condition sickened} 2 (DC 23 Fortitude negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. The {@spell nightmare|CRB}, its rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura’s {@condition sickened} effect but not the concealment.

abilities_active.name: Flaming Gallop
entries: The {@spell nightmare|CRB} Strides or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing {@dice 3d6} fire damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save) once to each creature other than the {@spell nightmare|CRB}’s rider that the {@spell nightmare|CRB} moves adjacent to during its gallop.

abilities_interactive.name: Smoke
entries: 20 feet. As {@spell nightmare|CRB}, but DC 28.

abilities_active.name: Flaming Gallop
entries: As {@spell nightmare|CRB}, but {@dice 6d6} fire damage and DC 30.

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

abilities_active.name: Mind Crush
abilities_active.requirements: The nilith has a creature grabbed.
entries: The nilith reaches into the mind of the {@condition grabbed} creature and implants disjointed images of the victim’s worst fears and nightmares. The {@condition grabbed} creature takes {@dice 6d6} mental damage (DC 31 basic Will save). On a critical failure, the target is also affected as though by {@spell feeblemind|CRB}, and it must attempt a second Will save against that effect.

abilities_interactive.name: Wild Empathy
entries: The naiad can use Diplomacy to {@action Make an Impression|CRB} on and make very simple Requests of animals.

abilities_automatic.name: Water Dependent
entries: A naiad bonds to a spring, pool, pond, or similar-sized water feature. While within 300 feet of her bonded body of water, she can use her innate {@spell tidal surge|CRB} at will. She doesn’t recover Hit Points or reduce the {@condition drained} condition when resting beyond that range. Unlike most other nymphs, she doesn’t suffer penalties from being apart from her bonded body of water. A naiad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new body of water.

abilities_active.name: Water Healing
entries: While within her bonded body of water (see water dependent above), the naiad heals 1 Hit Point every 10 minutes.

abilities_interactive.name: Nature Empathy
entries: The dryad can use Diplomacy to {@action Make an Impression|CRB} on and make very simple Requests of animals and plants.

abilities_automatic.name: Tree Dependent
entries: A dryad is mystically bonded to a single great tree and must remain within 300 feet of it. If she moves beyond that range, she becomes {@condition sickened} 1 and is unable to recover. She must attempt a DC 18 Fortitude save every hour or increase the {@condition sickened} value by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition sickened} 4). After 24 hours, she becomes {@condition drained} 1, with this value increasing by 1 every additional 24 hours. A dryad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new tree.

abilities_active.name: Tree Meld
entries: The dryad touches a tree of enough volume to contain her and merges into it for as long as she wishes. She can {@action Cast a Spell|CRB} while inside as long as the spell doesn’t require a line of effect outside the tree. She can hear, but not see, what’s going on outside the tree. She can {@action Dismiss|CRB} this effect.
Significant physical damage dealt to the tree expels the dryad from the tree and deals {@dice 3d6} damage to her. {@spell Passwall|CRB} expels the dryad without dealing damage.

If a dryad uses this ability on her bonded tree, she instead enters an extradimensional living space within the tree; Tree Meld gains the extradimensional trait. A dryad can bring up to two other creatures with her when entering her home within her bonded tree. The dryad can still be expelled from this space as above.

abilities_interactive.name: Wild Empathy
entries: The naiad can use Diplomacy to {@action Make an Impression|CRB} on and make very simple Requests of animals.

abilities_automatic.name: Nymph’s Beauty
entries: 30 feet. DC 23. On a failed save, the target is {@condition stunned} 1 for this turn and whenever it begins its turn within 30 feet of the naiad queen for the next 24 hours, even if it can’t see her on subsequent turns.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Focus Beauty
entries: On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the naiad queen’s beauty, the image of the queen sears into the creature’s mind, allowing no further sight and effectively blinding the creature until restored via {@spell restore senses|CRB} or a similar effect, or until the naiad queen chooses to remove the effect using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

abilities_active.name: Water Healing
entries: As naiad, but the naiad queen can {@spell heal|CRB} in any body of water in her domain and regains 28 HP.
entries_as_xyz: While within her bonded body of water (see water dependent above), the naiad heals 1 Hit Point every 10 minutes.

abilities_interactive.name: Nature Empathy
entries: The dryad can use Diplomacy to {@action Make an Impression|CRB} on and make very simple Requests of animals and plants.

abilities_automatic.name: Nymph’s Beauty
entries: DC 30. On a failed save, the target is {@condition immobilized} in awe for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Focus Beauty
entries: On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the dryad queen’s beauty, the target suffers the effects of a failed save against {@spell charm|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Tree Meld
entries: As dryad, except the hamadryad can enter and exit her extradimensional domain from any tree in her domain and she can bring up to eight other creatures with her when she does so.

abilities_active.name: Compression
entries: A giant octopus can move through a gap at least 2 feet wide without Squeezing, and can {@action Squeeze|CRB} through a gap at least 1 foot wide.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Ink Cloud
entries: The octopus emits a cloud of black ink in a 30-foot emanation. This cloud has no effect outside of water. Creatures inside the cloud are {@condition undetected} and can’t use their sense of smell. The cloud dissipates after 1 minute. The octopus can’t use Ink Cloud again for {@dice 2d6} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Jet
entries: The octopus moves up to 200 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.

abilities_active.name: Writhing Arms
entries: The giant octopus makes up to four Strikes with different arms, each against a different target. Each attack counts separately for the octopus’s multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase the penalty until the octopus has made all the attacks. If the octopus subsequently uses the Grab action, it can Grab any number of creatures it hit with Writhing Arms.

abilities_automatic.name: Putrid Stench
entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened} 1 until the end of its turn (plus {@condition slowed} 1 for as long as it is {@condition sickened} on a critical failure). While within the aura, an affected creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: Filth Wallow
entries: A ofalth gains fast healing 2 when in an area with a high concentration of debris, junk, or excrement, such as a refuse heap or sewer.

stages.entry: 2d8 persistent bleed damage every hour and enfeebled 1
2d8 persistent bleed damage every hour and enfeebled 2

abilities_active.name: Glutton’s Feast
entries: If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws {@action Strike|CRB}, they gain {@dice 1d4} temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Glutton’s Rush
entries: The ogre glutton Strides twice and makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB}. If they damage a living creature with this {@action Strike|CRB}, the temporary Hit Points they receive from glutton’s feast is increased to {@dice 2d4}.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d8+8} piercing plus Grab and glutton’s feast

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Bellowing Command
entries: The ogre boss issues a {@spell command|CRB} to hasten their fellows. Each ogre ally who hears and understands this {@spell command|CRB} becomes {@condition quickened} until the end of that ally’s next turn, but can use the extra action only to {@action Step|CRB} or {@action Stride|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Sweeping Hook
abilities_active.trigger: The ogre boss successfully Trips a creature using an ogre hook.
entries: The ogre boss makes an ogre hook {@action Strike|CRB} against the creature they tripped.

abilities_interactive.name: Motion Sense
entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

abilities_active.name: Filth Wave
entries: The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures within a 20-foot emanation. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 17 Reflex save or take {@dice 1d4} acid damage and take a –10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls {@condition prone}). A creature can spend an {@action Interact|CRB} action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.

abilities_interactive.name: Motion Sense
entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

abilities_interactive.name: Transparent
entries: A gelatinous cube is so clear that it’s difficult to spot. A successful DC 23 Perception check is required to notice a stationary cube, and a creature must be Searching to attempt this check. A creature that walks into the cube is automatically Engulfed (this usually causes the GM to call for initiative).

abilities_active.name: Engulf
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of any creatures in its path. Any creature of the monster's size or smaller whose space the monster moves through can attempt a Reflex save with the listed DC to avoid being engulfed. A creature unable to act automatically critically fails this save. If a creature succeeds at its save, it can choose to be either pushed aside (out of the monster's path) or pushed in front of the monster to the end of the monster's movement. The monster can attempt to Engulf the same creature only once in a single use of Engulf. The monster can contain as many creatures as can fit in its space.
