A creature that fails its save is pulled into the monster's body. It is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The creature takes the listed amount of damage when first engulfed and at the end of each of its turns while it's engulfed. An engulfed creature can get free by Escaping against the listed escape DC. An engulfed creature can attack the monster engulfing it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either method can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.
If the monster dies, all creatures it has engulfed are automatically released as the monster's form loses cohesion.

abilities_active.name: Paralysis
entries: A creature Engulfed by the cube or hit by its attack is {@condition paralyzed} unless it succeeds at a DC 20 Fortitude save. A victim can attempt a new save to recover at the end of each of its turns.

abilities_active.name: Weak Acid
entries: A gelatinous cube’s acid damages only organic material—not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

abilities_interactive.name: Motion Sense
entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

abilities_automatic.name: Split
entries: Whenever an ochre jelly is hit by an attack or effect that would deal slashing, piercing, or electricity damage and the ochre jelly has at least 10 HP, the jelly splits into two identical jellies with half the original’s HP. One jelly is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or sturdy to push).

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Ochre Acid
entries: An ochre jelly’s acid damages only flesh—not bone, stone, wood, or other materials.

abilities_interactive.name: Motion Sense
entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

abilities_automatic.name: Corrosive Mass
entries: A creature that hits the pudding with a metal or wooden weapon must succeed at a DC 22 Reflex save or the weapon takes {@dice 2d6} acid damage (after dealing damage to the black pudding as normal). Thrown weapons and ammunition take this damage automatically with no save.

abilities_automatic.name: Split
entries: When the black pudding is hit by an attack that would deal slashing or piercing damage and has 10 or more HP, it splits into two identical puddings, each with half the original’s HP. One pudding is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or sturdy to push).

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Corrosive Touch
entries: When the pudding hits a creature with its pseudopod, any acid damage is dealt to the creature’s armor or clothing as well as the creature.

abilities_active.name: Suction
entries: The pudding can climb on ceilings and other inverted surfaces, though such surfaces are difficult terrain for it.

attacks.name: pseudopod
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+7} bludgeoning plus {@dice 2d6} acid, corrosive touch, and Grab

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Ferocity
entries: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its {@condition wounded} value increases by 1. When it is {@condition wounded} 3, it can no longer use this ability.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.

abilities_active.name: Battle Cry
entries: Bellowing mightily, the warchief gives themself and all orc allies within 60 feet a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of the orc warchief’s next turn.

abilities_automatic.name: Stench
entries: 40 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or be {@condition sickened} 1 (plus {@condition slowed} 1 for the same duration on a critical failure). On a success, the creature is temporarily immune to the {@condition sickened} and {@condition slowed} effects of this stench for 1 hour. Regardless of the save, while within the aura, creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against diseases. An otyugh’s stench is due to the offal and refuse that it wallows in, so cleaning the creature thoroughly (with {@spell create water|CRB} and sufficient scrubbing, for example) deactivates the aura, while a sufficiently plugged nose allows an individual to avoid exposure to the stench.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Reposition
entries: The otyugh attempts to move all creatures that it has {@condition grabbed} into other spaces within the reach of its tentacles, rolling a single Athletics check and comparing the result against each creature’s Fortitude DC. On a failure, the creature remains in place, and on a critical failure, the creature is no longer {@condition grabbed}.

entries.name: Filth Fever
entries.note: The sickened and unconscious conditions from filth fever don’t improve on their own until the disease is cured.

stages.entry: sickened 1 and slowed 1 as long as it remains sickened

abilities_active.name: Bloodcurdling Screech
entries: The owlbear unleashes a loud screech that terrifies its prey. Each creature in an 80-foot emanation must attempt a DC 20 Will save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition fleeing} for 1 round and {@condition frightened} 3.

abilities_active.name: Gnaw
abilities_active.requirements: The owlbear has a creature grabbed with its talons.
entries: The owlbear attempts to disembowel the creature with a beak {@action Strike|CRB}. If the {@action Strike|CRB} hits, the target must attempt a DC 22 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The target is {@condition sickened} 1 and {@condition slowed} 1 as long as it remains {@condition sickened}.

abilities_active.name: Screeching Advance
entries: The owlbear makes a Bloodcurdling Screech and Strides twice. All creatures within 80 feet of the owlbear at any point during this movement are subjected to the effects of Bloodcurdling Screech.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.

abilities_active.name: Assisted Mount
abilities_active.requirements: The pegasus is Flying without a rider.
entries: The pegasus Flies. At any point during the movement, it can allow a willing adjacent creature to {@action Mount|CRB} it. That creature must use a reaction to do so.

abilities_active.name: Gallop
entries: The pegasus uses 2 move actions, each of which can be either {@action Stride|CRB} or {@action Fly|CRB}. It gains a +20-foot circumstance bonus to its Speeds during a Gallop.

abilities_automatic.name: Self-Resurrection
entries: When a phoenix dies, it collapses into a pile of smoldering ashes before returning to life fully healed {@dice 1d4} rounds later, as if subject to a 7th-level resurrect ritual. Self-resurrection happens only if there are some remains to resurrect; for instance, a phoenix killed by a {@spell disintegrate|CRB} spell can’t use this ability. A phoenix whose remains rest within an area devoted to an evil deity by consecrate can’t self-resurrect until its remains are no longer in that area. A phoenix can self-resurrect only once per year.

abilities_automatic.name: Shroud of Flame
entries: 20 feet. {@dice 4d6} fire, DC 37 basic Reflex save. While this aura is active, any adjacent creature that hits the phoenix with a melee attack or otherwise touches it takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage. The phoenix can activate or deactivate the aura with a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

abilities_active.name: Flaming Strafe
entries: The phoenix blazes with superheated flame and Flies up to its Speed. It deals {@dice 6d6} fire damage to each creature within 20 feet of each square it moves through (DC 37 basic Reflex save).

attacks.name: beak
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d12+9} piercing plus {@dice 3d8} fire and {@dice 2d10} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire}

attacks.name: talon
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d6+6} piercing plus {@dice 3d8} fire and {@dice 2d10} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire}

abilities_active.name: Drain Bonded Item
abilities_active.requirements: The adept hasn’t acted yet on this turn.
entries: The adept expends the power stored in its staff. This gives the adept the ability to cast one prepared spell it had already previously cast today (choosing a different spell level each time), without spending a spell slot. The adept must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell’s other requirements.

abilities_active.name: Duskwalker
entries: Duskwalkers are infused with the same energies as psychopomps. These ashen scions are reborn on the Material Plane to serve as guardians of the cycle of life and death.

condition: effects that would transform their body or soul to an undead

abilities_active.name: Ghost Hunter
entries: The duskwalker’s weapons have the benefits of the ghost touch property rune on attacks against incorporeal undead.

abilities_active.name: Hunt Prey
entries: The duskwalker designates as its prey a single creature that it can see and hear or that it is Tracking. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it Seeks its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when it Tracks its prey. It also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against its prey.

Lastly, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks, Intimidation checks, and Stealth checks against its prey and to any check to {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB} about its prey, as well as a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against its prey’s attacks. The duskwalker can have only one prey designated at a time.

abilities_active.name: Hunted Shot
entries: The duskwalker makes two longbow Strikes against its hunted prey. If both Strikes hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

abilities_automatic.name: Divine Grace
abilities_automatic.trigger: The angelkin is targeted by a spell that allows a saving throw.
entries: The scion gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the saving throw.

abilities_automatic.name: Glimpse of Redemption
abilities_automatic.trigger: An enemy damages one of the angelkin’s allies.
entries: Both the enemy and ally must be within 15 feet of the angelkin. The angelkin causes its foe to hesitate under the weight of its sins as visions of possible redemption play out in its mind’s eye. The foe chooses one of two options:

items: The ally is completely unharmed by the triggering damage.
The ally gains resistance 7 to all damage against the triggering damage. After the damaging effect resolves, the enemy becomes {@condition enfeebled} 2 until the end of its next turn.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_interactive.name: Site Bound
entries: A poltergeist is tied to a location and can’t travel more than 120 feet from the place where it was created or formed. Some poltergeists are instead bound to a specific room, building, or similar area.

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance against non-magical)

abilities_automatic.name: Natural Invisibility
entries: A poltergeist is naturally {@condition invisible}. It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.

abilities_automatic.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When a poltergeist is destroyed, it re-forms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after {@dice 2d4} days. A poltergeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

abilities_automatic.name: Telekinetic Defense
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist.
entries: The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.

abilities_active.name: Frighten
abilities_active.requirements: The poltergeist must be invisible.
entries: The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a DC 21 Will save, becoming {@condition frightened} 2 on a failure. On a critical failure, it’s also {@condition fleeing} for as long as it’s {@condition frightened}. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes {@condition invisible} again.

abilities_active.name: Telekinetic Storm
entries: The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small objects, such as dozens of pieces of silverware or books, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.

items: When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object {@action Strike|CRB} at a –2 penalty against each creature within 30 feet. These count as one attack for the poltergeist’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks.

When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object {@action Strike|CRB} against the target, and the damage increases to {@dice 3d12}. It deals {@dice 1d12} damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.

attacks.name: telekinetic object
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d12} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing (depending on object)

abilities_active.name: Jaunt
entries: The poracha teleports up to 40 feet. It must have line of sight to the space it teleports to. It can’t use Jaunt again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Object Meld
entries: The poracha touches an adjacent object of enough volume to contain it. It merges into the object indefinitely, and while it’s inside, time moves exceptionally slowly for it and it has only limited perception of the outside world. The poracha can sense what’s going on outside the object only using tremorsense. The poracha can use only mental actions or Jaunt; if it Jaunts, it leaves the object and appears where it chooses. If a creature Strikes the object, the poracha is expelled unharmed.

abilities_interactive.name: Entropy Sense
entries: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of {@spell nondetection|CRB} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

abilities_automatic.name: Protean Anatomy
entries: A voidworm’s vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the voidworm takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Confounding Lash
entries: A creature hit by the voidworm’s tail {@action Strike|CRB} is {@condition stupefied} 1 for 1 round ({@condition stupefied} 2 on a critical hit). A successful DC 16 Will save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4-1} slashing plus {@dice 1d4} chaotic and confounding lash

abilities_interactive.name: Entropy Sense
entries: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of {@spell nondetection|CRB} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

abilities_automatic.name: Protean Anatomy
entries: A voidworm’s vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the voidworm takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

abilities_active.name: Adaptive Strike
entries: The naunet chooses adamantine, cold iron, or silver; its melee Strikes count as that type for 1 minute or until it uses Adaptive {@action Strike|CRB} again.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Confounding Slam
entries: A creature hit by the naunet’s tentacle {@action Strike|CRB} is {@condition stupefied} 2 for {@dice 1d4} rounds (DC 24 Will negates). If the creature was already {@condition stupefied} in this way, the duration extends by 1 round instead. A chaotic creature is only {@condition stupefied} 1 instead.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

attacks.name: tentacle
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8+6} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} chaotic and confounding slam

abilities_interactive.name: Entropy Sense
entries: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of {@spell nondetection|CRB} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

abilities_automatic.name: Spatial Riptide
entries: 30 feet. A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a DC 38 Fortitude save or wink out of existence for {@dice 1d4} rounds before completing the teleport. The creature can’t act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is {@condition stunned} 1. Keketars are immune to this effect.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Reshape Reality
entries: When the keketar casts {@spell hallucinatory terrain|CRB}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

abilities_active.name: Warpwave Strike
entries: A creature struck by a keketar’s jaws or claw {@action Strike|CRB} must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or be subject to a warpwave (page 266).

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d10+15} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} chaotic and warpwave strike

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d10+15} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} chaotic and warpwave strike

abilities_interactive.name: Lifesense
entries: Lifesense allows a monster to sense the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. The sense can distinguish between the positive energy animating living creatures and the negative energy animating undead creatures, much as sight distinguishes colors.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Haunting Melody
entries: The nosoi croons an entrancing song. Each living or undead creature within a 60-foot emanation must attempt a DC 18 Will save. The effect lasts for 1 round, but a nosoi can use this ability again on subsequent rounds to extend the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. A creature that succeeds at any save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. Despite being a mental effect, this ability affects mindless undead. Psychopomps are immune to this ability.

entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature must spend each of its actions on its turn to move closer to the nosoi as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a {@condition fascinated} creature is adjacent to the nosoi, it stays still and doesn’t act. If the creature is attacked, the fascination ends.

abilities_active.name: Spirit Touch
entries: A nosoi’s Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a ghost touch property rune and deal {@dice 1d6} negative damage to living creatures or {@dice 1d6} positive damage to undead.

abilities_interactive.name: Lifesense
entries: Lifesense allows a monster to sense the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. The sense can distinguish between the positive energy animating living creatures and the negative energy animating undead creatures, much as sight distinguishes colors.

abilities_automatic.name: Wrappings Lash
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within reach of the morrigna’s web wrappings uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.
entries: The morrigna makes a {@spell web|CRB} wrappings {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the strike is a critical hit, the triggering action is disrupted.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Spider Minions
entries: The morrigna summons a giant tarantula (page 307) or spider swarm (page 306). These spiders have the summoned trait and remain for 10 minutes or until reduced to 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. The morrigna does not need to Sustain the Spell to direct these summoned creatures, and the morrigna can have any number of summoned spiders in existence at once. The morrigna can see through the eyes of any of their summoned spiders at any time.

abilities_active.name: Spirit Touch
entries: As nosoi, but {@dice 4d6}.
entries_as_xyz: A nosoi’s Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a ghost touch property rune and deal {@dice 1d6} negative damage to living creatures or {@dice 1d6} positive damage to undead.

attacks.name: web wrappings
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d12+14} bludgeoning plus Grab and spirit touch

abilities_active.name: Swoop
entries: The pteranodon Flies up to its Speed and makes one beak {@action Strike|CRB} at any point during that movement.

abilities_active.name: Snatch
entries: A quetzalcoatlus can move at half.

abilities_active.name: Emotional Focus
entries: The quelaunt can cast the following {@class cleric|CRB} domain spells as 8th-level occult innate spells at will without spending Focus Points: {@spell blind ambition|CRB} (Core Rulebook 389), {@spell captivating adoration|CRB} (Core Rulebook 389), and {@spell delusional pride|CRB} (Core Rulebook 391).

abilities_active.name: Emotional Frenzy
entries: The quelaunt casts up to three spells chosen from its at-will innate spells and its emotional focus spells.

abilities_active.name: Feed on Emotion
entries: Frequency once per round; The quelaunt feeds on the emotional unrest of a single creature within 30 feet that’s under a harmful emotion effect. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or take {@dice 4d10} mental damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, the quelaunt regains the same number of Hit Points and Feed on Emotion does not cost the quelaunt an action, allowing it to use another action this turn.
Occult Innate Spells DC 39; 7th {@spell crushing despair|CRB} (×3); 3rd {@spell fear|CRB} (at will); 2nd {@spell hideous laughter|CRB}; Constant (4th) {@spell air walk|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Rapid Strikes
entries: The quelaunt makes three melee Strikes, each against a different target within reach. The multiple attack penalty applies to each attack, but increases only after all the attacks have been made.

abilities_active.name: Spiral of Despair
abilities_active.trigger: A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of the quelaunt's innate spells or emotional focus spells.
entries: Trigger A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of the quelaunt's innate spells or emotional focus spells. As the quelaunt invades the triggering creature's mind and plants the seeds of negative emotions, it also strips away the target’s feelings of hope or positivity. The quelaunt can immediately end a single emotion effect from which the triggering creature is benefiting.

abilities_interactive.name: Thievery
entries: +13 Str +1, Dex +4, Con +3, Int +1, Wis +1, Cha +3.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_interactive.name: Stealth
entries: +20 Str +4, Dex +6, Con +4, Int +2, Wis +1, Cha +5 Items +1 striking kukri.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Disturbing Vision
entries: The raja rakshasa’s eyes flash green as it projects a telepathic wave in a 30-foot emanation. All creatures in the area are assailed by a vision of evil decadence from one of the rakshasa’s past lives. Each non-evil creature in the area must succeed at a DC 29 Will save or become {@condition sickened} 1 (and {@condition stunned} 1 on a critical failure). The visions last {@dice 1d4} rounds, and while they do, the raja rakshasa and all evil creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to all checks. The raja rakshasa can use this ability again only once the previous visions end.

abilities_active.name: Filth Fever
entries: The {@condition sickened} and {@condition unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured. Saving Throw DC 14 Fortitude; Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ({@dice 1d4} hours), Stage 2 {@condition sickened} 1 (1 day), Stage 3 {@condition sickened} 1 and {@condition slowed} 1 (1 day), Stage 4 {@condition unconscious} (1 day), Stage 5 dead.

abilities_interactive.name: to Climb or Swim), Stealth
entries: +6 Str –2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1,

abilities_active.name: Swarming Bites
entries: Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to filth fever.

abilities_active.name: Filth Fever
entries: The {@condition sickened} and {@condition unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured. Saving Throw DC 14 Fortitude; Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ({@dice 1d4} hours), Stage 2 {@condition sickened} 1 (1 day), Stage 3 {@condition sickened} 1 and {@condition slowed} 1 (1 day), Stage 4 {@condition unconscious} (1 day), Stage 5 dead.

abilities_interactive.name: Thievery
entries: +9 Str +0, Dex +4, Con +2, Int +4, Wis +2, Cha +1 Items {@class alchemist|CRB}’s tools, hand crossbow (20 bolts), studded leather armor.

abilities_interactive.name: Infused Items
entries: A ratfolk grenadier carries 2 infused moderate acid flasks, 2 infused moderate {@class alchemist|CRB}’s fires, and 2 infused moderate frost vials. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time they make their daily preparations.

abilities_active.name: Cheek Pouches
entries: A ratfolk grenadier has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects (though no more than 4 light items). The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the {@action Interact|CRB} action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

abilities_active.name: Quick Bomber
entries: The ratfolk grenadier draws an alchemical bomb with an {@action Interact|CRB} action and throws it as a ranged {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Quick Stow
entries: The ratfolk grenadier stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in its cheek pouches.

abilities_active.name: Swarming
entries: A ratfolk grenadier can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability. Only two such creatures can share the same space.

abilities_interactive.name: Stealth
entries: +13 Str +4, Dex +4, Con +2, Int +1, Wis +1, Cha +2 Items iron boots, red cap, scythe.

abilities_interactive.name: Red Cap
entries: A redcap’s woolen hat is dyed with the blood of its victims.

If the redcap loses its cap, it no longer benefits from fast healing and takes a –4 status penalty to its damage rolls. It can create a new cap in 10 minutes, but that cap doesn’t grant its powers until the redcap has turned it red with Blood Soak. A cap has no benefit for creatures other than the redcap who made it.

abilities_automatic.name: Divine Revulsion
entries: If a redcap sees a creature brandish a religious symbol of a good deity (which requires an interact action by that creature) or use one to cast a divine spell, the redcap must attempt a DC 19 Will save. It then becomes temporarily immune to all brandished religious symbols for 10 minutes.

entries.Critical Success: The redcap is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The redcap gains the {@condition fleeing} condition for 1 round and is {@condition frightened} 4.

abilities_active.name: Blood Soak
entries: The redcap dips its cap in the blood of a slain foe. The foe must have died in the last minute, and the redcap must have helped kill it. The redcap gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Deadly Cleave
abilities_active.trigger: The redcap reduces a creature to 0 Hit
entries: Points with a scythe {@action Strike|CRB}. The redcap makes another scythe {@action Strike|CRB} against a different creature, using the same multiple attack penalty as the scythe {@action Strike|CRB} that triggered this reaction.
This counts toward its multiple attack penalty.

abilities_active.name: Stomp
entries: The redcap Strides up to half its Speed and makes a boot {@action Strike|CRB} at any point during that movement. If the boot {@action Strike|CRB} hits a {@condition prone} creature, it deals an extra {@dice 2d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.

abilities_automatic.name: Death Frenzy
abilities_automatic.trigger: The reefclaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points.
entries: Trigger The reefclaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points. The reefclaw makes a claw {@action Strike|CRB} before {@condition dying}.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Reefclaw Venom
entries: Saving Throw DC 17 Fortitude;

abilities_active.name: Maximum Duration
entries: 4 rounds; Stage 1 {@dice 1d6} poison damage and {@condition enfeebled} 1 (1 round), Stage 2 {@dice 1d6} poison damage and {@condition enfeebled} 2 (1 round).

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d6+1} slashing plus reefclaw venom and Grab

abilities_automatic.name: Heat
entries: 5 feet. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@dice 1d6} fire damage. Whenever the remorhaz takes damage from an enemy, this damage increases to {@dice 2d6} until the start of its next turn. Any creature that hits a remorhaz with an unarmed {@action Strike|CRB} takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage, and a weapon that hits a remorhaz takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The remorhaz unleashes a gout of flame that deals {@dice 8d6} fire damage in a 30-foot cone (DC 26 basic Reflex save). It can’t use.

abilities_active.name: Breath
entries: Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Ice Tunneler
entries: A remorhaz can leave a tunnel when it burrows through ice or snow, and it usually does.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_active.name: Thrash
entries: The remorhaz Strikes once with its jaws and once with its tail, each targeting a different creature.
Each attack counts toward the remorhaz’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks have been made.

abilities_automatic.name: Wing Rebuff
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature moves from beyond the reach of the roc’s wing to within the reach of the roc’s wing.
entries: Trigger A creature moves from beyond the reach of the roc’s wing to within the reach of the roc’s wing. The roc makes a wing {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the roc Pushes the creature, it disrupts the triggering move action.

abilities_active.name: Flying Strafe
entries: The roc Flies up to its Speed and makes two talon Strikes at any point during that movement. Each {@action Strike|CRB} must target a different creature. Each attack takes the normal multiple attack penalty.

abilities_active.name: Snack
entries: A roc gains a +2 circumstance bonus to hit with its beak {@action Strike|CRB} if the target is {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in its talon.

abilities_active.name: Snatch
entries: A roc can {@action Fly|CRB} at half Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in either or both of its talons, carrying that creature along with it.

abilities_interactive.name: Religion
entries: +19, Stealth +17 (+25 in stony or icy areas) Str +6, Dex +1, Con +6, Int +1, Wis +3, Cha +1.

abilities_automatic.name: Reactive Lash
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within reach of the roper’s strand leaves a square during a move action it’s using.
entries: Trigger A creature within reach of the roper’s strand leaves a square during a move action it’s using. The roper makes a strand {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.

abilities_active.name: Extend Strands
entries: The roper extends or retracts six thin, sticky tendrils from its body. While the strands are extended, the roper takes a –4 circumstance penalty to Stealth checks, and while they’re retracted, it can’t use its strand Strikes.

abilities_active.name: Flurry of Strands
entries: The roper makes a strand {@action Strike|CRB} with each of its strands (except those that are immobilizing creatures). Each attack must be against a different target. These attacks count toward the roper’s multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks.

abilities_active.name: Pull the Strands
entries: The roper pulls every creature {@condition grabbed} by its strands toward itself. The roper rolls a single Athletics check and compares the result to each {@condition immobilized} creature’s Fortitude DC. The roper pulls each creature it succeeds against up to 25 feet closer and each creature it critically succeeds against up to 50 feet closer.

abilities_active.name: Sticky Strand
entries: Any creature hit by a roper’s strand is {@condition enfeebled} 1 and {@condition grabbed}. Each additional hit from a strand increases the {@condition enfeebled} condition value by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled} 4). This {@condition enfeebled} value decreases by 1 every 8 hours. The roper can move while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} with a strand, but it automatically releases the creature if it moves beyond the strand’s reach. The roper can release an {@condition grabbed} creature as a free action. A creature can sever a strand with a target attack that hits AC 27 and deals at least 18 slashing damage. This doesn’t deal any damage to the roper itself, though it can no longer attack with a severed strand.

abilities_interactive.name: Metal Scent
entries: A rust monster can smell metal as a precise sense.

abilities_automatic.name: Tail Trip
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature carrying a metal item attempts to move out of a square within reach of the rust monster's tail.
entries: Trigger A creature carrying a metal item attempts to move out of a square within reach of the rust monster's tail. The rust monster makes a tail {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.

abilities_active.name: Antenna Disarm
entries: The rust monster attempts to {@action Disarm|CRB} a metal item a creature is holding using its antenna (with the same modifier as an antenna {@action Strike|CRB}). On a success, the item is subject to the rust monster’s rust ability (see below) in addition to the effects of the {@action Disarm|CRB}, and if the check to {@action Disarm|CRB} is a critical success, the rust monster drops the item on the ground in its own space.

abilities_active.name: Rust
entries: A rust monster’s antenna causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If it succeeds at an antenna {@action Strike|CRB} or {@action Disarm|CRB} attempt with its antenna, the rust monster deals {@dice 2d6} damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its.

abilities_active.name: Hardness.
entries: If the rust monster hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against an antenna attack, the shield is automatically {@condition broken}, but no other item is rusted on that attack.

abilities_interactive.name: Performance
entries: +13, Stealth +11, Survival +8 Str +3, Dex +4, Con +1, Int +1, Wis +2, Cha +5 Items dagger, panpipes, shortbow (20 arrows), wineskin.

abilities_interactive.name: Sylvan Wine
entries: A satyr’s wineskin magically enchants any alcohol inside. With an {@action Interact|CRB} action, a living creature can imbibe the alcohol and gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and a +3 item bonus to Will saves against {@spell fear|CRB} effects for the following hour. When the wineskin is removed from a satyr’s person, the magic remains only until the wine spoils. The wineskin holds up to eight drafts of wine.

abilities_active.name: Fleet Performer
entries: When the satyr Plays the Pipes to cast a spell, he can {@action Step|CRB} or {@action Stride|CRB} as part of the activity.

abilities_active.name: Play the Pipes
abilities_active.requirements: The satyr is holding a musical instrument.
entries: Requirements The satyr is holding a musical instrument. The satyr plays a melody on his instrument to cast {@spell charm|CRB}, {@spell fear|CRB}, {@spell sleep|CRB}, or {@spell suggestion|CRB} without expending the spell slot and using his music in place of providing the spell’s component actions. The spell gains the auditory trait and targets all creatures in a 60-foot emanation instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its Will save against any spell is then temporarily immune from spells played from that satyr’s pipes for 1 minute. Satyrs are immune to this music.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Swarming Stings
entries: Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes {@dice 2d8} piercing damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save) and is exposed to scorpion venom.

abilities_interactive.name: Shark Commune
entries: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like “come,” “guard,” or “attack.”

abilities_active.name: Blood Frenzy
abilities_active.requirements: The sea devil is not fatigued or already in a frenzy.

abilities_active.name: Trigger
entries: The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature. The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 7 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a –2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can’t voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is {@condition fatigued}.

abilities_active.name: Bloodletting
entries: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals {@dice 1d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} if the target was {@condition flat-footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.

abilities_interactive.name: Shark Commune
entries: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like “come,” “guard,” or “attack.”

abilities_active.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: As sea devil scout, 11 temporary HP.

abilities_active.name: Bloodletting
entries: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals {@dice 1d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} if the target was {@condition flat-footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.

abilities_active.name: Unimpeded Throw
entries: A sea devil brute can use thrown ranged weapons underwater with no penalty due to range increment.

abilities_interactive.name: Survival
entries: +11 Str +5, Dex +2, Con +4, Int +0, Wis +3, Cha +2 Items longspear, spear (2)

abilities_interactive.name: Shark Commune
entries: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like “come,” “guard,” or “attack.”

abilities_active.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: As sea devil scout, 15 temporary HP.

abilities_active.name: Bloodletting
entries: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals {@dice 1d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} if the target was {@condition flat-footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.

abilities_active.name: Hateful Tide
abilities_active.requirements: The sea devil baron is in a blood frenzy.
entries: Requirement The sea devil baron is in a blood frenzy. The sea devil baron unleashes a whirlwind of attacks against its foes, making a single melee {@action Strike|CRB} with its claws or jaws against each opponent within reach.

abilities_interactive.name: Undetectable
entries: A sea serpent automatically tries to counteract any detection, revelation, or {@spell scrying|CRB} divination attempted against it, using its Stealth modifier for its counteract modifier.

abilities_active.name: Capsize
entries: The sea serpent attempts to capsize an aquatic vessel of its size or smaller that it’s adjacent to. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 35 or the pilot’s Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Sea Serpent Algae
traits: poison The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent’s neck is full of psychotropic algae. Saving Throw DC 34 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 confused and
spends its first action each turn to descend 20 feet (1 round
entries: Stage 2 {@condition confused} and, if flying, descends until reaching the ground or water below (1 round).

abilities_active.name: Spine Rake
entries: The sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or Strides. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes {@dice 4d6+8} slashing damage (DC 32 basic Reflex save).

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance against non-magical)

abilities_automatic.name: Light Vulnerability
entries: An object shedding magical light (such as from the light spell) is treated as magical when used to attack the shadow.

abilities_active.name: Shadow Spawn
entries: When a creature’s shadow is pulled free by {@action Steal|CRB} Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the {@spell command|CRB} of the shadow that created it. This shadow spawn doesn’t have {@action Steal|CRB} Shadow and is perpetually and incurably {@condition clumsy} 2. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

abilities_active.name: Slink in Shadows
entries: The shadow can {@action Hide|CRB} or end its {@action Sneak|CRB} in a creature’s or object’s shadow.

abilities_active.name: Steal
entries: Shadow (divine, necromancy) Requirement The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand {@action Strike|CRB} on its previous action. The shadow pulls at the target’s shadow, making the creature {@condition enfeebled} 1. This is cumulative with other {@condition enfeebled} conditions from shadows, to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled} 4. If this increases a creature’s {@condition enfeebled} value to 3 or more, the target’s shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). {@condition Enfeebled} from {@action Steal|CRB} Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance against non-magical)

abilities_interactive.name: Mound
entries: When it’s not in danger, the shambler spends 1 minute settling into a pile that looks like a lump of loose vegetation. While it is in this form, creatures must actively {@action Seek|CRB} and succeed at a DC 22 Perception check (DC 28 in forests or swamps) to detect the shambler’s true nature.

abilities_automatic.name: Electric Surge
entries: Whenever the shambler would take electricity damage or is targeted with an electricity effect, it gains 12 temporary HP and is {@condition quickened} until the end of its next turn. It can use its extra action to {@action Stride|CRB}, {@action Strike|CRB}, or {@action Swim|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Shamble
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature unaware of the shambler’s true nature comes within 10 feet.
abilities_automatic.requirements: The shambler is in mound form.
entries: The shambler makes a vine {@action Strike|CRB} against the creature. Then roll initiative.

abilities_active.name: Vine Lash
entries: The shambler makes a vine {@action Strike|CRB} against each creature within reach. Its multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks.

abilities_interactive.name: Blood Scent
entries: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

abilities_active.name: Breach
entries: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 25 feet high, making a {@action Strike|CRB} against a creature at any point during the {@spell jump|CRB} (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water’s surface). After the {@action Strike|CRB}, the shark splashes back down into the water.

abilities_active.name: Savage
abilities_active.requirements: The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.
entries: The creature the shark hit takes {@dice 1d12} slashing damage.
Strafing Chomp {@as 1} The shark Swims up to half its swim Speed, makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB}, and then Swims up to half its Speed further. The {@action Strike|CRB} deals half damage.

abilities_interactive.name: Blood Scent
entries: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

abilities_active.name: Breach
entries: As great white shark, but the megalodon’s reach allows it to attack a creature up to 35 feet above the surface of the water (or 40 feet with its tail).
