If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_interactive.name: Radiance Dependence
entries: The shining child is {@condition flat-footed} while in areas of {@spell darkness|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Blinding Aura
entries: 60 feet. The shining child sheds bright light. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a Fortitude DC 29 save. If it fails, it is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute, and if it critically fails, it’s permanently {@condition blinded}. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.

abilities_automatic.name: Overwhelming Light
abilities_automatic.trigger: The shining child enters an area of magical darkness or begins its turn in an area of magical darkness.
entries: The shining child attempts to counteract the magical {@spell darkness|CRB} (as a 7th-level spell).

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d4+5} bludgeoning plus {@dice 4d6} fire and {@dice 2d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire}

attacks.name: fire ray
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d10+3} fire, plus {@dice 2d10} positive damage if the target is undead

abilities_automatic.name: Maddening Cacophony
entries: 60 feet. A shoggoth constantly voices syllables and mutterings that mortals were not meant to hear. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become {@condition confused} for 1 round ({@dice 2d4} rounds on a critical failure). A creature that successfully saves is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Eat Away
entries: A creature that begins its turn inside the shoggoth takes {@dice 9d6} acid damage.

abilities_active.name: Engulf
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of any creatures in its path. Any creature of the monster's size or smaller whose space the monster moves through can attempt a Reflex save with the listed DC to avoid being engulfed. A creature unable to act automatically critically fails this save. If a creature succeeds at its save, it can choose to be either pushed aside (out of the monster's path) or pushed in front of the monster to the end of the monster's movement. The monster can attempt to Engulf the same creature only once in a single use of Engulf. The monster can contain as many creatures as can fit in its space.

A creature that fails its save is pulled into the monster's body. It is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The creature takes the listed amount of damage when first engulfed and at the end of each of its turns while it's engulfed. An engulfed creature can get free by Escaping against the listed escape DC. An engulfed creature can attack the monster engulfing it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either method can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.
If the monster dies, all creatures it has engulfed are automatically released as the monster's form loses cohesion.

abilities_active.name: Armor-Rending
entries: Any time the shuln scores a critical hit with a melee {@action Strike|CRB}, it also deals the same amount of damage to the target’s armor, bypassing any Hardness lower than 10, like adamantine.

stages.entry: 4d6 poison damage and paralyzed for 2d6 hours.

abilities_active.name: Unstoppable Burrow
entries: Shulns can burrow into solid rock and any metal with a hardness less than that of adamantine like it is soil or loose rubble, leaving a tunnel 10 feet in diameter.

creature.name: Sinspawn
items: one weapon determined by its sin

abilities_interactive.name: Sin Scent
entries: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

saving_throws.abilities: +1 status to saves vs. magic, +4 status to saves vs. mental

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Sinful Bite
entries: A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a DC 18 Will save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

entries.Critical Success: Unaffected.
entries.Critical Failure: {@condition Sickened} 2 plus an additional penalty, determined by the sinspawn’s sin, while it remains {@condition sickened}.

abilities_active.name: Sin
entries: A sinspawn gains an additional skill based on its sin, as well as a weapon that reflects the preferences of its kinds’ ancient creators. The seven sins and the benefits they confer upon a sinspawn are noted in the Sinspawn Sins section.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Shield Block
entries: The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
abilities_automatic.trigger: The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

abilities_active.name: Gallop
entries: The horse Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.

abilities_active.name: Undead Steed
entries: Undead and creatures allied with them can {@spell Command|CRB} a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.

abilities_active.name: Broad Swipe
entries: The giant makes two Strikes with its glaive against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

abilities_active.name: Terrifying Charge
entries: The giant Strides and makes a horns {@action Strike|CRB} with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the giant attempts to {@action Demoralize|CRB} the target.

attacks.name: claw
effects: but with its claw Strike. [two-actions] Massive Rush The hulk Strides
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d6+11} slashing {@as 2} Broad Swipe As skeletal giant, but with its claw {@action Strike|CRB}. {@as 2} Massive Rush The hulk Strides and makes a claw {@action Strike|CRB} with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the hulk automatically Shoves the target 10 feet.

abilities_interactive.name: Skeletal Lore
entries: A skulltaker taps into the memories of the creatures whose bones make up its body. This gives it the Skeletal Lore skill, which it can use to {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB} of any kind. In addition, it can speak and understand all the languages known by the creatures whose bones make up its body (typically including Common and the regional language of the skulltakerʼs home region). The skulltaker can use Skeletal Lore as the primary skill check for the legend lore ritual (Core Rulebook 413), and it can cast legend lore without secondary casters.

abilities_automatic.name: Shard Storm
entries: 10 feet. A cloud of bone shards surrounds the skulltaker. When a creature moves into the emanation or begins its turn there, shard storm attempts to counteract any {@spell death ward|CRB} effect on the creature (+30 counteract modifier) and then deals {@dice 4d6} slashing damage and {@dice 4d6} negative damage to the creature, with a DC 40 basic Reflex save.

abilities_active.name: Bonetaker
entries: Whenever a creature dies within 60 feet of a skulltaker, the skulltaker draws a portion of the creature’s bones into its shard storm. The creature must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or rise as a skeletal {@class champion|CRB} (page 298) in {@dice 1d4} rounds. These skeletal champions are {@condition controlled} by the skulltaker.

abilities_active.name: Energy Drain
entries: When a skulltaker hits with a melee {@action Strike|CRB}, the target must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained} 2 and {@condition doomed} 1.

abilities_active.name: Splintered Ground
entries: The skulltaker causes splintered bones to erupt from all solid surfaces in a 100-foot emanation, except for surfaces of worked stone. A creature moving through the bones takes 10 piercing damage and 10 negative damage for every 5 feet of movement. The first time each round a creature takes piercing damage from these splintered bones, it must succeed at a Reflex save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to all Speeds for 10 minutes, or a –15-foot circumstance penalty for 24 hours on a critical failure. The bones remain in place until the skulltaker uses this action again or the bones are manually removed, which takes 10 minutes for each 5-foot square.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d10+14} piercing plus {@dice 3d6} negative and energy drain

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 3d6+14} slashing plus {@dice 3d6} negative and energy drain

abilities_active.name: Belly Grease
entries: The slurk extrudes a slippery {@spell grease|CRB} from its ventral glands to coat the floor under it and in a 5-foot emanation, turning the affected area into uneven ground for 10 minutes, after which it dries to a putrid crust. The DC to {@action Balance|CRB} across the slime is 18.

abilities_active.name: Entangling Slime
entries: A creature struck by a slurk’s slime squirt becomes {@condition clumsy} 1 and takes a –5-foot penalty to Speed for 1 hour or until the slime is removed. The slime can be removed with a total of three {@action Interact|CRB} actions by the entangled creature or creatures adjacent to the creature. These actions don’t need to be consecutive or made by the same creature.
A snake’s hide can be cleanly removed with a successful Crafting check or appropriate Lore check.

abilities_automatic.name: Slink
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature ends its movement adjacent to the viper or within the viper’s space.
entries: The viper Strides, Climbs, or Swims up to 10 feet (or up to the relevant Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). It must end its movement in a location that isn’t within 5 feet of a foe. This movement doesn’t trigger reactions.

abilities_automatic.name: Tighten Coils
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature grabbed or restrained by the ball python attempts to Escape.
entries: The DC of the {@action Escape|CRB} check is increased by 2.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Wrap in Coils
abilities_active.requirements: A Medium or smaller creature is grabbed or restrained in the ball python’s jaws.
entries: The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python’s coils can hold one creature.

abilities_automatic.name: Coiled Opportunity
entries: As {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB}, but the snake can use this reaction only if it’s Coiled.

abilities_active.name: Coil
entries: The giant viper uses an action to coil itself, increasing its reach with its fangs from 5 to 10 feet. After the giant viper Strikes with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.

abilities_automatic.name: Tighten Coils
entries: The DC of the {@action Escape|CRB} check is increased by 2.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature grabbed or restrained by the ball python attempts to Escape.

abilities_active.name: Greater Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC. A creature that fails this save falls {@condition unconscious}, and a creature that succeeds is then temporarily immune to falling {@condition unconscious} from Greater Constrict for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Slither
entries: The giant anaconda Strides, Climbs, or Swims up to half its Speed, pulling any creatures it has {@condition grabbed} with it.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_active.name: Wrap in Coils
abilities_active.requirements: A Large or smaller creature is grabbed or restrained in the giant anaconda’s jaws.
entries: The giant anaconda moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Greater Constrict against the creature. The giant anaconda’s coils can hold as many creatures as will fit in its space.

languages: one spoken by its creator (typically Common)

abilities_interactive.name: Personality Fragments
entries: A soulbound doll shares fragments of its donor soul’s personality, though none of that creature’s memories. This causes a soulbound doll to match the donor soul’s alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits.

abilities_interactive.name: Bardic Lore
entries: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have the Bardic Lore {@class bard|CRB} feat, allowing them to {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB} on any topic.

abilities_active.name: Claw Rake
entries: The sphinx rears back on their hind legs and makes two claw Strikes at the same target, using the same attack bonus as their highest melee attack. If both attacks deal damage, the target takes extra damage equal to one claw {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Pounce
entries: The sphinx Strides and makes a {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of that movement. If the sphinx began this action {@condition hidden}, they remain {@condition hidden} until after the attack.

abilities_active.name: Warding Glyph
entries: Once per week, a Sphinx can create a magical symbol as though casting a heightened {@spell glyph of warding|CRB} spell. The sphinx usually shapes the glyph to take the form of a written riddle, and sets the password to the answer. A creature that gives the wrong answer or tries to pass without answering must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or suffer one of the following spell effects, chosen by the sphinx when creating the symbol: {@spell synaptic pulse|CRB} (5th), {@spell charm|CRB} (4th), {@spell fear|CRB} (3rd), {@spell phantom pain|CRB} (3rd), {@spell sleep|CRB} (3rd). The sphinx learns the identity of any creature that answers the riddle and tends to be {@condition friendly} to them.

abilities_interactive.name: Web Sense
entries: The spider swarm has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its {@spell web|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Swarming Bites
entries: Each enemy in the spider swarm’s space takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage with a DC 14 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to spider swarm venom.

abilities_interactive.name: Web Sense
entries: The spider swarm has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its {@spell web|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Spring Upon Prey
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature touches the hunting spider’s web while the spider is on it.
abilities_automatic.requirements: Initiative has not yet been rolled.
entries: The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a {@spell Web|CRB} before it rolls initiative.

abilities_active.name: Web Trap
entries: A creature hit by the hunting spider’s {@spell web|CRB} attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it Escapes (DC 17).

abilities_active.name: Hair Barrage
entries: The tarantula flicks its legs, flinging spiky hairs in a 15-foot cone. This deals {@dice 4d6} piercing damage with a DC 25 basic Reflex save.

abilities_interactive.name: Web Sense
entries: The spider swarm has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its {@spell web|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Spring Upon Prey
entries: The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a {@spell Web|CRB} before it rolls initiative.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature touches the hunting spider’s web while the spider is on it.
abilities_automatic.requirements: Initiative has not yet been rolled.

abilities_active.name: Web Tether
entries: A creature hit by the spider’s {@spell web|CRB} {@action Strike|CRB} is {@condition restrained} and tethered to the spider, preventing it from moving farther away from the spider. The spider can have one creature tethered at a time. The DC to {@action Escape|CRB} or {@action Force Open|CRB} the {@spell web|CRB} is 30. The tether can be severed with a {@action Strike|CRB} (AC 20, Hardness 5, HP 20), but this doesn’t free the {@condition restrained} creature.

abilities_interactive.name: Luminous Fire
entries: A sprite naturally sheds light like a torch. The sprite can extinguish, rekindle, or change the color of this light using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While this light is extinguished, the sprite’s Strikes don’t deal fire damage and they can’t use their luminous spark {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Fiddle
entries: A grig can rub its legs together to create a catchy fiddling tune that compels others within 30 feet to dance about, with varying effects depending on a DC 18 Will save. A listener is temporarily immune for 10 minutes on a success, but otherwise, if the grig continues to Fiddle each round, the creature receives no additional saves.

entries.Failure: {@condition Flat-footed} and –10-foot status penalty to Speeds.

abilities_active.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust
entries: The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie’s next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target’s DC 21 Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

items: {@spell Charm|CRB} (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a {@spell charm|CRB} spell, except it doesn’t gain a bonus to its save if the only {@condition hostile} act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target’s adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
{@bold Memory Loss} (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
{@spell Sleep|CRB} (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, {@spell sleep|CRB}) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-level {@spell sleep|CRB} spell.
{@bold Subdual} (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes {@dice 4d6} mental damage, depending on its basic Will save.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Surprise Attacker
entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven’t acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to the tengu.

abilities_automatic.name: Spore Cloud
entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn there is exposed to spore blight.

abilities_active.name: Infest Environs
abilities_active.requirements: The terotricus is in a swamp or forested area.
entries: The terotricus drains nutrients from nearby trees and undergrowth while simultaneously infesting them with fungal growth. All non-magical plant life (though not plant creatures) within a 60-foot emanation withers and sprouts foul mold and slimy mushrooms, removing any cover and concealment provided by trees and undergrowth. The terotricus is healed 200 Hit Points.

abilities_active.name: Sticky Spores
entries: A creature hit by a terotricus’s spores must succeed at a DC 40 Reflex save or take a –10-foot status penalty to all its Speeds for 1 minute. On a critical failure, the creature is {@condition immobilized} until it Escapes (DC 40).

attacks.name: tentacle
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d10+16} bludgeoning plus {@dice 2d6} chaotic, {@dice 2d6} evil, and Improved Grab or Improved Push 20 feet (40 feet on a critical hit)

attacks.name: spores
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d8+6} poison plus {@dice 2d6} chaotic, {@dice 2d6} evil, spore blight, and sticky spores

saving_throws.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

abilities_automatic.name: Aura of Corruption
entries: 120 feet. Plants near Treerazer twist, deform, and transform into thorny or fungoid parodies of their natural shapes. A living creature in this area must succeed at a DC 47 Fortitude save each round or become partially transformed into plantlike matter. Those who fail this saving throw are treated as if they were plants for the purposes of any effect that particularly harms or inconveniences plant creatures more than other creatures, but do not gain any benefits of being plant creatures. This effect lasts as long as the creature remains within the area of corruption and for 1 minute thereafter.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Defoliation
entries: Treerazer exudes a pulse of sickly green light in a 30-foot-radius emanation. All plants in the area (including creatures under the effect of his aura of corruption) blacken and wither. Non-creature plants immediately wither and die. Plant creatures take {@dice 20d8} negative damage with a DC 49 basic Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save is {@condition doomed} 1 for 1 minute and {@condition sickened} 3. Treerazer can choose to exclude any number of plants in the area from this effect, and generally does so to preserve twisted and corrupted plants or fungi, or plant creatures that are allied to his cause. Treerazer can’t use Defoliation for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Dispelling Strike
abilities_active.trigger: Treerazer hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a weapon Strike or a defoliation attack.
entries: Treerazer casts his innate {@spell dispel magic|CRB}, targeting the creature he hit with his {@action Strike|CRB} or one spell affecting that creature.

abilities_active.name: Staggering Strike
entries: When Treerazer scores a critical hit with a melee attack, the target is {@condition stunned} 2.

attacks.name: Blackaxe
attacks.damage: {@dice 4d12+15} slashing plus {@dice 1d6} acid, {@dice 1d6} chaotic, and {@dice 1d6} evil, and {@dice 2d6} slashing vs. plants

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Rend
entries: A Rend entry lists a {@action Strike|CRB} the monster has. The monster automatically deals that {@action Strike|CRB}'s damage again to the enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Vigorous Shake
abilities_automatic.trigger: The troll king takes persistent acid or fire damage.
entries: The troll king shakes itself to remove {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid} or fire effects. The troll king immediately attempts a DC 15 flat check to end the {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage} that triggered this reaction. If the troll king succeeds at this check, it can immediately use Primordial Roar as part of this reaction.

abilities_active.name: Rend
entries: A Rend entry lists a {@action Strike|CRB} the monster has. The monster automatically deals that {@action Strike|CRB}'s damage again to the enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.

abilities_active.name: Forced Regeneration
abilities_active.requirements: The troll king’s regeneration is not currently deactivated.
entries: The troll king regains 15 HP.

abilities_active.name: Primordial Roar
entries: The troll king unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature within 100 feet must attempt a DC 29 Will save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.

abilities_active.name: Unstoppable Charge
entries: The troll king Strides twice in a straight line. It can make up to two claw Strikes during this movement and one jaws {@action Strike|CRB} at the end of its movement. It can’t {@action Strike|CRB} the same creature more than once.

abilities_interactive.name: Wild Empathy
entries: The unicorn has a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows it to communicate with them. The unicorn can use Diplomacy to {@action Make an Impression|CRB} on animals and to make very simple Requests of them.

abilities_active.name: Ghost Touch
entries: A unicorn’s Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

abilities_active.name: Powerful Charge
entries: The unicorn Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn {@action Strike|CRB}. If the unicorn moved at least 20 feet, it deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage on a hit.

attacks.name: horn
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d10+4} piercing plus {@dice 1d6} good and ghost touch

abilities_automatic.name: High Winds
entries: 40 feet. Air in the aura is difficult terrain for Flying creatures without the air trait.

abilities_active.name: Lightning Crash
entries: The uthul unleashes a powerful bolt of lightning and a stunning thunderclap. The bolt deals {@dice 6d12} electricity damage to all creatures in a 30-foot line, with a DC 34 basic Reflex save, and every creature in a 20-foot emanation must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save. The uthul can’t use Lightning Crash again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Swiftness
entries: An uthul’s movement doesn’t trigger reactions.

abilities_active.name: Whirlwind Form
entries: The uthul transforms itself into a swirling vortex of storm and fury 10 feet wide and up to 40 feet tall. It stays in this form for 3 rounds or until it Dismisses the effect. While in this form, the uthul gains resistance 10 to physical damage and can move through other creatures. Its aura remains active, but it can’t make debris Strikes nor use Lightning Crash. Instead, any creature the uthul moves through takes {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage and {@dice 2d12} electricity damage. A creature can take this damage only once per round. A Large or smaller creature must also succeed at a DC 32 Reflex save or be picked up and held suspended within the vortex. Suspended creatures move with the uthul. A creature can attempt to escape by spending an action to attempt a DC 32 Reflex save (or a DC 32 Acrobatics check to maneuver in flight if it has a fly Speed). Upon escaping, or when the uthul transforms back into its storm cloud form, a suspended creature is hurled {@dice 1d4} × 10 feet in a random direction, then falls unless it can fly or otherwise remain aloft. After returning to its normal form, the uthul must wait 1 minute before it can use Whirlwind Form again.

abilities_active.name: Drink Blood
entries: When Drinking Blood, the spawn regains 5 HP.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Dominate
entries: DC 22.

abilities_active.name: Drink Blood
entries: When Drinking Blood, the vampire regains 10 HP.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Dominate
entries: DC 26.

abilities_active.name: Drain Bonded Item
abilities_active.requirements: The vampire hasn’t acted yet on this turn.
entries: The vampire expends the power stored in its signet ring. This gives the vampire the ability to cast one prepared spell it had already previously cast today, without spending a spell slot. The vampire must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell’s other requirements.

abilities_active.name: Drink Blood
entries: When Drinking Blood, the vampire regains 10 HP.

abilities_active.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: If another creature’s reaction would disrupt the vampire mastermind’s spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a DC 15 flat check. If the vampire succeeds, its action isn’t disrupted.

abilities_automatic.name: Avenging Bite
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within reach of the warg’s jaws attacks one of the warg’s allies.
entries: The warg makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The warg’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the warg’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Swallow Whole
entries: The monster attempts to swallow a creature of the listed size or smaller that it has {@condition grabbed} in its jaws or mouth. If a swallowed creature is of the maximum size listed, the monster can't use Swallow Whole again. If the creature is smaller than the maximum, the monster can usually swallow more creatures; the GM determines the maximum. The monster attempts an Athletics check opposed by the {@condition grabbed} creature's Reflex DC. If it succeeds, it swallows the creature. The monster's mouth or jaws no longer grab a creature it has swallowed, so the monster is free to use them to {@action Strike|CRB} or Grab once again. The monster can't attack creatures it has swallowed.

A swallowed creature is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The swallowed creature takes the listed amount of damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. If the victim Escapes this ability's {@condition grabbed} condition, it exits through the monster's mouth. This frees any other creature {@condition grabbed} in the monster's mouth or jaws. A swallowed creature can attack the monster that has swallowed it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or cutting itself free can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.

If the monster dies, a swallowed creature can be freed by creatures adjacent to the corpse if they spend a combined total of 3 actions cutting the monster open with a weapon or unarmed attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.

abilities_automatic.name: Avenging Bite
entries: The warg makes a jaws {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within reach of the warg’s jaws attacks one of the warg’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The winter wolf breathes a cloud of frost in a 15-foot cone that deals {@dice 5d8} cold damage (DC 23 basic Reflex save). The winter wolf can’t use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The winter wolf’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the winter wolf’s allies.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_automatic.name: Frightful Presence
entries: A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected by the presence.

abilities_active.name: Absorb
abilities_active.trigger: The warsworn moves into a dying creature’s space.
entries: The warsworn absorbs the {@condition dying} creature into itself, instantly killing the creature and healing the warsworn for a number of Hit Points equal to the creature’s level. As long as the warsworn still exists, absorbed creatures can’t be resurrected except by {@spell wish|CRB} or a similarly powerful effect.

abilities_active.name: Animated Weapons
entries: The warsworn assumes control of unattended weapons within 100 feet, forcing them to {@spell levitate|CRB} around it. The warsworn can telekinetically wield these weapons to make melee Strikes with a reach of 100 feet.

abilities_active.name: Energy Drain
entries: When a warsworn hits with a corpse wave {@action Strike|CRB} or damages a creature with Trample, the target must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained} 2 and {@condition doomed} 1. On a critical success, the target becomes temporarily immune to the warsworn’s energy drain for 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Plummet
entries: A creature hit by a warsworn’s scrap ball {@action Strike|CRB} must attempt a DC 37 Reflex save. On a failure, the target falls {@condition prone}; if the target was airborne, it falls up to 120 feet, taking damage from the fall and landing {@condition prone} if the descent brings it to the ground. On a critical failure, the target is also held under a pile of scrap (DC 37 to {@action Escape|CRB}).

abilities_active.name: Trample
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of the listed size, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. The monster can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the listed {@action Strike|CRB}, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at the listed DC (no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, double damage on a critical failure).

attacks.name: animated weapon
attacks.damage: four of the weapon’s damage dice +9 of the weapon’s damage type

abilities_active.name: Implant Eggs
entries: The giant wasp lays eggs in an adjacent creature that is {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition unconscious}, exposing it to the wasp larva disease.

abilities_active.name: Swarming Stings
entries: Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes {@dice 2d8} piercing damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save) and is exposed to wasp venom. A successful save negates the poison exposure.

abilities_interactive.name: Spider Speak
entries: The {@spell web|CRB} lurker can speak with spiders, with the same effects and limitations as {@spell speak with animals|CRB}.

abilities_automatic.name: Spring upon Prey
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature touches the web lurker’s web while the web lurker is on it.
entries: Requirement Initiative has not yet been rolled. The {@spell web|CRB} lurker automatically notices the creature and Strides or Climbs before rolling initiative.

abilities_active.name: Web Trap
entries: A creature hit by the {@spell web|CRB} lurker’s {@spell web|CRB} attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it succeeds at DC 20 Acrobatics check to {@action Escape|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Web Lurker Traps
entries: The following traps are some used by {@spell web|CRB} lurkers.

abilities_active.name: Blood Leech
abilities_active.trigger: The wemmuth deals damage to a creature with Constrict.
entries: The wemmuth heals a number of Hit Points equal to half the total damage dealt by Constrict.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Engulf
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of any creatures in its path. Any creature of the monster's size or smaller whose space the monster moves through can attempt a Reflex save with the listed DC to avoid being engulfed. A creature unable to act automatically critically fails this save. If a creature succeeds at its save, it can choose to be either pushed aside (out of the monster's path) or pushed in front of the monster to the end of the monster's movement. The monster can attempt to Engulf the same creature only once in a single use of Engulf. The monster can contain as many creatures as can fit in its space.

A creature that fails its save is pulled into the monster's body. It is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The creature takes the listed amount of damage when first engulfed and at the end of each of its turns while it's engulfed. An engulfed creature can get free by Escaping against the listed escape DC. An engulfed creature can attack the monster engulfing it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either method can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.
If the monster dies, all creatures it has engulfed are automatically released as the monster's form loses cohesion.

abilities_active.name: Thorny Mass
entries: Whenever a creature within 10 feet attempts a melee attack against a wemmuth or uses Acrobatics to {@action Tumble Through|CRB} its space, that creature takes {@dice 1d12+10} piercing damage.

abilities_interactive.name: Heatsight
entries: Heatsight is a precise sense that sees heat signatures.

abilities_active.name: Dream Haunting
entries: A target that fails its save against the wendigo’s {@spell nightmare|CRB} is exposed to wendigo torment.

abilities_active.name: Howl
entries: The wendigo unleashes a forlorn howl that can be heard up to 1 mile away. Any creature that hears the howl must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or be {@condition frightened} 1. Any creature that critically fails and is within 120 feet of the wendigo is instead {@condition frightened} 3, and is also {@condition fleeing} for {@dice 1d4} rounds (or until it’s no longer {@condition frightened}, whichever comes first). A creature {@condition frightened} by a wendigo’s howl still naturally recovers from its fright but can’t reduce it below {@condition frightened} 1 in this way until 1 hour has passed or magic is used. Whether it succeeds or fails its save, a creature is then temporarily immune to that wendigo’s Howl for 24 hours.

abilities_active.name: Ride the Wind
abilities_active.trigger: The wendigo casts wind walk while it has Grabbed a foe.
entries: The wendigo attempts to turn the {@condition grabbed} creature into wind and carry it along as part of the action. If the target succeeds at a DC 38 Will save, it prevents itself from being transformed; in this case, the wendigo still transforms, automatically releasing the victim. A creature forced to Ride the Wind along with the wendigo is exposed to wendigo torment. The target can attempt a new Will save each round to return to normal, though it immediately becomes corporeal and begins falling if it succeeds.

entries.name: Wendigo Torment
entries.note: A creature affected by wendigo torment can’t recover beyond stage 1 until it has been restored to full HP.

stages.entry: The creature searches for an individual of its own ancestry to kill and devour.

abilities_interactive.name: Rat Empathy
entries: The wererat can communicate with rodents.

abilities_automatic.name: Nimble Dodge
abilities_automatic.trigger: The wererat is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.
entries: The wererat gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Curse
entries: the Wererat (curse, necromancy, primal); Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d8+2} piercing plus curse of the wererat

entries: The werewolf can communicate with lupines.

This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.

Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Curse
entries: the Werewolf (curse, necromancy, primal); Saving Throw DC 19 Fortitude.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The werewolf’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the werewolf’s allies.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d8+8} piercing plus curse of the werewolf

abilities_interactive.name: Bear Empathy
entries: The werebear can communicate with ursines.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Curse
entries: the Werebear (curse, necromancy, primal); Saving Throw DC 22 Fortitude.

abilities_active.name: Hunt Prey
abilities_active.requirements: The werebear can see or hear the target or is Tracking it in exploration mode.
entries: The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it Seeks its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when it Tracks its prey. The werebear also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against the prey it’s hunting. The werebear can designate only one creature as its hunted prey at a time. If it uses Hunt Prey against a different creature, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. In any case, this designation lasts until the werebear’s next daily preparation.

abilities_active.name: Mauler
entries: The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has {@condition grabbed}.

abilities_active.name: Precision Edge
entries: The werebear deals {@dice 1d8} additional precision damage on its first successful {@action Strike|CRB} against its hunted target on each of its turns.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d12+7} piercing plus curse of the werebear

abilities_automatic.name: Final Spite
abilities_automatic.trigger: The wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points.
entries: The wight makes a {@action Strike|CRB} before being destroyed. It doesn’t gain any temporary HP from {@spell drain life|CRB} on this {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Drain Life
entries: When the wight damages a living creature with its claw {@action Strike|CRB}, the wight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained} 1. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save to a maximum of {@condition drained} 4.

abilities_active.name: Wight Spawn
entries: A living humanoid slain by a wight’s claw {@action Strike|CRB} rises as a wight after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wight spawn is under the {@spell command|CRB} of the wight that killed it. It doesn’t have {@spell Drain Life|CRB} or Wight Spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy} 2 for as long as it is a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains {@spell Drain Life|CRB} and Wight Spawn, and is no longer {@condition clumsy}.

abilities_automatic.name: Glow
entries: 20 feet. A will-o’-wisp is itself naturally {@condition invisible}, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

abilities_automatic.name: Magic Immunity
entries: A will-o’-wisp is immune to all spells except {@spell faerie fire|CRB}, {@spell glitterdust|CRB}, {@spell magic missile|CRB}, and {@spell maze|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Feed on Fear
abilities_active.requirements: An enemy is under a fear effect or dying within 15 feet of the will-o’-wisp.
entries: The will-o’-wisp feeds on the creature’s terror. It regains {@dice 2d4} Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites. A will-o’-wisp can take this action only once per round.

abilities_active.name: Go Dark
entries: The will-o’-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming {@condition invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while {@condition invisible}, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o’-wisp only {@condition hidden} to all observers until it moves.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The wolf’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf’s allies.

abilities_automatic.name: Buck
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.

abilities_active.name: Pack Attack
entries: The dire wolf’s Strikes deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf’s allies.

abilities_active.name: Worry
abilities_active.requirements: The dire wolf has a creature grabbed with its jaws.
entries: The dire wolf fiercely shakes the {@condition grabbed} creature with its teeth, dealing {@dice 1d10+2} damage (DC 20 basic Fortitude save).

abilities_interactive.name: Lifesense
entries: Lifesense allows a monster to sense the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. The sense can distinguish between the positive energy animating living creatures and the negative energy animating undead creatures, much as sight distinguishes colors.

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: (except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

abilities_automatic.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
entries: A wraith caught in sunlight is {@condition stunned} 2 and {@condition clumsy} 2.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Drain Life
entries: When the wraith damages a living creature with its {@spell spectral hand|CRB} {@action Strike|CRB}, the wraith gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 23 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained} 1. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save to a maximum of {@condition drained} 4.

abilities_active.name: Wraith Spawn
entries: A living humanoid slain by a wraith’s {@spell spectral hand|CRB} {@action Strike|CRB} rises as a wraith spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wraith spawn is under the {@spell command|CRB} of the wraith that killed it. It doesn’t have {@spell drain life|CRB} or wraith spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy} 2 for as long as it is a wraith spawn. If the creator of the wraith spawn dies, the wraith spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wraith; it regains its free will, gains Wraith Spawn, and is no longer {@condition clumsy}.

abilities_automatic.name: Stench
entries: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened} 1, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths’ stenches for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: Stench
entries: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened} 1, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths’ stenches for 1 minute.

abilities_automatic.name: Stench Suppression
entries: A xulgath skulker can suppress its stench aura as a free action to better hide its presence. The skulker can resume its stench aura as a free action.

abilities_active.name: Hidden Movement
entries: If a xulgath skulker starts its turn {@condition undetected} by a creature or merely {@condition hidden} from it, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the skulker’s attacks until the end of the skulker’s turn.

abilities_active.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

abilities_automatic.name: Stench
entries: 30 feet. As xulgath warrior, but DC 19.
entries_as_xyz: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened} 1, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths’ stenches for 1 minute.

abilities_active.name: Weakening Strike
entries: The target must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become {@condition enfeebled} 1 (or {@condition enfeebled} 2 on a critical hit) for 1 round.

Lone exiles of yeti clans have little use for treasure and leave the gear of their slain victims behind where it is quickly covered by snowfall. Clan-based yetis, on the other hand, create beautifully carved stonework, some of which they shape into protective talismans of rare beauty.

abilities_interactive.name: Snowblind When
entries: Hiding, the yeti is {@condition concealed} by any snowfall, even if it’s not thick enough to make other creatures {@condition concealed}.

abilities_automatic.name: Nightmare Guardian
entries: Yetis gain a +4 status bonus to saves against {@spell fear|CRB} and against spells and abilities that affect dreams. A yeti that falls prey to a supernatural {@spell nightmare|CRB} loses this ability and becomes permanently enraged, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls and a –1 status penalty to AC.

abilities_automatic.name: Vanish
abilities_automatic.trigger: The yeti is hidden or undetected while not in combat, and a creature would observe it.
entries: The yeti Strides or Climbs up to half its Speed to a location where it can {@action Hide|CRB}, then Hides. If its new Stealth check result meets or exceeds the triggering creature’s Perception DC, the yeti remains {@condition hidden}.

abilities_active.name: Grisly Arrival
abilities_active.trigger: The yeti hits a creature in the first round of combat and the yeti was hidden from that creature at the start of combat.
entries: Each enemy within 30 feet that witnesses the attack (including the target of the attack) must attempt a DC 23 Will save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} 2; on a critical failure, it’s {@condition frightened} 4.

abilities_active.name: Rend
entries: A Rend entry lists a {@action Strike|CRB} the monster has. The monster automatically deals that {@action Strike|CRB}'s damage again to the enemy.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.

abilities_automatic.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.
abilities_automatic.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

abilities_active.name: Dune
entries: Until the next time it acts, the zaramuun appears to be a sand dune. It has an automatic result of 47 (50 in sandy terrain) on Deception and Stealth checks and DCs to pass as a sand dune. Any creature that walks onto the zaramuun moves into its body and is Engulfed.

abilities_active.name: Engulf
entries: The monster Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of any creatures in its path. Any creature of the monster's size or smaller whose space the monster moves through can attempt a Reflex save with the listed DC to avoid being engulfed. A creature unable to act automatically critically fails this save. If a creature succeeds at its save, it can choose to be either pushed aside (out of the monster's path) or pushed in front of the monster to the end of the monster's movement. The monster can attempt to Engulf the same creature only once in a single use of Engulf. The monster can contain as many creatures as can fit in its space.

A creature that fails its save is pulled into the monster's body. It is {@condition grabbed}, is {@condition slowed} 1, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating. The creature takes the listed amount of damage when first engulfed and at the end of each of its turns while it's engulfed. An engulfed creature can get free by Escaping against the listed escape DC. An engulfed creature can attack the monster engulfing it, but only with unarmed attacks or with weapons of light Bulk or less. The engulfing creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. If the monster takes piercing or slashing damage equaling or exceeding the listed Rupture value from a single attack or spell, the engulfed creature cuts itself free. A creature that gets free by either method can immediately breathe and exits the swallowing monster's space.
If the monster dies, all creatures it has engulfed are automatically released as the monster's form loses cohesion.

abilities_active.name: Raking Sand
abilities_active.requirements: The zaramuun hit with a melee Strike with its last action, or it has a creature Engulfed.
entries: The zaramuun attempts to {@action Disarm|CRB} one primarily metal or stone object from the Struck or Engulfed creature and casts its innate {@spell dimensional anchor|CRB} on the target creature.

abilities_active.name: Sand Glide
entries: The zaramuun can {@action Burrow|CRB} through sand and dirt (but not stone) at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnel or sign of its passing. Any Engulfed creatures are left behind when it Burrows. Loose sand and scree are not difficult terrain for a zaramuun.

abilities_active.name: Sandblast
entries: The zaramuun sprays a blast of sand that deals {@dice 11d10} slashing damage to all creatures in a 60‑foot line (Reflex DC 38). It can’t Sandblast again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: No effect.
entries.Critical Failure: Full damage and {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

abilities_interactive.name: Slow
entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t use reactions.

abilities_active.name: Jaws
abilities_active.requirements: The zombie has a creature grabbed or restrained.
entries: The zombie makes a jaws unarmed melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} creature with an attack modifier of +7 that deals {@dice 1d8+3} piercing damage.

abilities_interactive.name: Slow
entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t use reactions.

abilities_active.name: Jaws
entries: As zombie shambler, but with an attack bonus of +9 that deals {@dice 1d12+4} piercing damage. A creature damaged by the jaws is exposed to zombie rot.
abilities_active.requirements: The zombie has a creature grabbed or restrained.
entries_as_xyz: The zombie makes a jaws unarmed melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} creature with an attack modifier of +7 that deals {@dice 1d8+3} piercing damage.

entries.name: Zombie Rot
entries.note: An infected creature can’t heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d8+4} bludgeoning plus Grab and zombie rot

abilities_interactive.name: Slow
entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t use reactions.

abilities_interactive.name: Slow
entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed} 1 and can’t use reactions.

abilities_active.name: Corpse Throwing
entries: A zombie hulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw zombie shamblers, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands {@condition prone}, but if it’s not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.

abilities_active.name: Wide Swing
entries: The zombie hulk makes a hunk of meat {@action Strike|CRB} and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the {@action Strike|CRB}’s reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie hulk’s multiple attack penalty.

abilities_active.name: Ability Glossary
entries: The following creature abilities are listed here because they are shared by many creatures or are highly complex. The statistics for individual creatures might alter the traits, the number of actions, or other rules of these abilities. Anything noted in a specific creature’s stat block overrides the general rules for the ability below. In these abilities, “monster” is used for the creature that has the ability, to differentiate it from any other creatures the ability might affect.

abilities_active.name: All-Around Vision
entries: This monster can see in all directions simultaneously, and therefore can't be flanked.

abilities_active.name: Aquatic Ambush
abilities_active.requirements: The monster is hiding in water and a creature that hasn't detected it is within the listed number of feet.
entries: The monster moves up to its swim Speed + 10 feet toward the triggering creature, traveling on water and on land. Once the creature is in reach, the monster makes a {@action Strike|CRB} against it. The creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: Attack of Opportunity
abilities_active.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: The monster attempts a melee {@action Strike|CRB} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This {@action Strike|CRB} doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|CRB}.

abilities_active.name: At-Will Spells
entries: The monster can cast its at-will spells any number of times without using up spell slots.

abilities_active.name: Aura
entries: A monster's aura automatically affects everything within a specified emanation around that monster. The monster doesn't need to spend actions on the aura; rather, the aura's effects are applied at specific times, such as when a creature ends its turn in the aura or when creatures enter the aura.

If an aura does nothing but deal damage, its entry lists only the radius, damage, and saving throw. Such auras deal this damage to a creature when the creature enters the aura and when a creature starts its turn in the aura. A creature can take damage from the aura only once per round. The GM might determine that a monster's aura doesn't affect its own allies. For example, a creature might be immune to a monster' frightful presence if they have been around each other for a long time.

abilities_active.name: The
entries: GM might determine that a monster’s aura doesn’t affect its own allies. For example, a creature might be immune to a monster’ frightful presence if they have been around each other for a long time.

abilities_active.name: Buck
abilities_active.trigger: A creature Mounts or uses the Command an Animal action while riding the monster.
entries: Most monsters that serve as mounts can attempt to buck off unwanted or annoying riders, but most mounts will not use this reaction against a trusted creature unless the mounts are spooked or mistreated. The triggering creature must succeed at a Reflex saving throw against the listed DC or fall off the creature and land {@condition prone}. If the save is a critical failure, the triggering creature also takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage for the fall.

abilities_active.name: Catch Rock
abilities_active.trigger: The monster is targeted with a thrown rock Strike or a rock would fall on the monster.
abilities_active.requirements: The monster must have a free hand but can Release anything it's holding as part of this reaction.
entries: The monster gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack or to any defense against the falling rock. If the attack misses or the monster successfully defends against the falling rock, the monster catches the rock, takes no damage, and is now holding the rock.

abilities_active.name: Change Shape
entries: The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster's transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn't gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

abilities_active.name: Constant Spells
entries: A constant spell affects the monster without the monster needing to cast it, and its duration is unlimited. If a constant spell gets counteracted, the monster can reactivate it by spending the normal spellcasting actions the spell requires.

abilities_active.name: Constrict
entries: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

abilities_active.name: Coven
entries: This monster can form a coven with two or more other creatures who also have the coven ability. This involves performing an 8-hour ceremony with all prospective coven members. After the coven is formed, each of its members gains elite adjustments (page 6), adjusting their levels accordingly. Coven members can sense other members' locations and conditions by spending a single action, which has the concentrate trait, and can sense what another coven member is sensing as a two-action activity, which has the concentrate trait as well.

Covens also grant spells and rituals to their members, but these can be cast only in cooperation between three coven members who are all within 30 feet of one another. A coven member can contribute to a coven spell with a single-action spellcasting activity that has a single verbal component. If two coven members have contributed these actions within the last round, a third member can cast a coven spell on her turn by spending the normal spellcasting actions. A coven can cast its coven spells an unlimited number of times but can cast only one coven spell each round. All covens grant the 8th-level {@spell baleful polymorph|CRB} spell and all the following spells, which the coven can cast at any level up to 5th: {@spell augury|CRB}, {@spell charm|CRB}, {@spell clairaudience|CRB}, {@spell clairvoyance|CRB}, {@spell dream message|CRB}, {@spell illusory disguise|CRB}, {@spell illusory scene|CRB}, {@spell prying eye|CRB}, and {@spell talking corpse|CRB}. Individual creatures with the coven ability also grant additional spells to any coven they join. A coven can also cast the control weather ritual (Core Rulebook 411), with a DC of 23 instead of the standard DC.

If a coven member leaving the coven or the death of a coven member brings the coven below three members, the remaining members keep their elite adjustments for 24 hours, but without enough members to contribute the necessary actions, they can't cast coven spells.
